post_title: Not a Job, ItтАЩs Mental Exhaustion
full_review: I previously worked remotely at N3XT Ventur3s . From the outside, the company may seem professional and fast-growing, but internally itтАЩs one of the most toxic workplaces IтАЩve experienced. ЁЯФ╣ Work Culture & Environment: There is zero respect for employees. The Head of Dept. was manipulative and inappropriate,often suggesting coffee meetups at odd hours, which felt far from professional. Employees are treated more like disposable laborers than valued team members. ЁЯФ╣ Performance DoesnтАЩt Matter тАУ Flattery Does: If youтАЩre good at brown-nosing , you can get by doing almost nothing. But if youтАЩre actually hard-working and honest, your life will be made difficult. Line managers are never satisfied unless you please them in certain тАЬotherтАЭ ways. Genuine contribution is overlooked. ЁЯФ╣ C3O & Company Culture: Rumor has it the C3O has a personal bedroom inside the office . No comments beyond thatтАФbut it says a lot about the internal culture. ItтАЩs the classic case of a small-time founder thinking theyтАЩve become a god after some growth. ЁЯФ╣ No Growth, Just Survival: Aside from receiving your salary on time, there is nothing positive here. Benefits, recognition, trainingтАФthese are reserved for the so-called тАЬleadership team.тАЭ The rest of the staff are treated like rickshaw-pullers: overworked and undervalued. ЁЯФ╣ HR? Part of the Problem: I did raise my concerns to HR, but their response made it clearтАФthey're just as much a part of the toxic system. Possibly even worse. If you care about your dignity, mental health, and career growth , think very carefully before applying to or joining N3XT V3ntures. Not all jobs are worth it. This is one of them

post_title: A Decent Company
full_review: Pretty decent environment. Pretty good for a traineeship. Dual-monitor desktop with 32 GB RAM for each engineer. 40% Eid (2 Eids) bonus even for trainees. The HR is very well-behaved. Clean toilets and regular Imam-led prayer facilities. No females at the office, which allows co-workers to communicate more freely with each other and helps avoid gender-related troubles. The partially subsidized lunch, which costs about 67 BDT/day/person, is quite good. Full Eid vacation, unlike some other companies. A free doctor once or twice a week. (A) Particular Senior Engineer(/s) being moderately hostile and rude to juniors, examinees, and interviewees can sometimes be quite stressful. But the hostility has not been extremeтАФe.g., I am not aware of him/them using slurs or doing "tui-tukari". And also, such occasional unconstructive criticism, threats, and belittling cannot break your heart if you have no heart in the first place, LOL. As "it is not a training centre", there is a lot of room for improvement in providing structured mentorship and a detailed roadmap, but that's not a huge issue as of 2025 because AI can provide much better mentorship than humans. Salary for trainees is pretty decent, but maybe the same cannot be said for non-trainees considering the 9 hours/day, 5.5 days/week routine.

post_title: Project Manager role is a scam!
full_review: If you are an experienced and skilled project manager, think twice about being a part of this company . The CEO sometimes randomly hires project manager just to fool his Japanese clients and get a new project. You start the project with your plans and strategies, and then you will see the reality. The CEO has an unsung project manager. Also, he has kept another assistant for that unsung project manager, who has 0 knowledge of project management but 100% arrogance. You will start seeing some ridiculous things. One of these two unsung project managers will gradually take your place. You are the PM, but they will lead the scrum! Even if you want to know any updates in the spec, you have to sync with these two ladies. And you canтАЩt say anything, because it is all planned by the CEO so that you resign yourself from this toxicity, and he can make more profit from the project. Imagine you are an experienced PM and you have to obey someone who is very junior to you and has no domain knowledge. The CEO promotes these ladies and changes their designations randomly whenever he wants. He will intentionally hand over your tasks to them in order to bring down your image, and he is very much proud of this kind of toxicity. So before applying for this role, do some research on how long the previous project managers survived in this company !

comments.comment_text: Yeah! Startups always preach about valuing adaptability, teamwork, and collaboration тАФ but in reality, you only reward those who licks your ass, not those who actually contribute. You run a circus in name of a company.┬а

Fast-paced tech companies with startup vibes arenтАЩt for everyone and thatтАЩs okay. They tend to lack the luxury of layered hierarchies, fixed boundaries, and title based authority. Instead, they reward adaptability, teamwork, and the ability to collaborate without needing to constantly remind others of oneтАЩs seniority.
In some cases, when things donтАЩt go according to personal expectations, it becomes easier to criticize the environment than to acknowledge a mismatch in working style. Words like "toxic" often get thrown around when the real challenge was a discomfort with flat structures, or perhaps the inability to work alongside juniors without feeling threatened.
Here, respect is earned, not granted by default. Influence comes from contribution, not from position. And while the company isnтАЩt perfect (no place is), itтАЩs built by people who choose cooperation over politics and growth over ego.
Friendly advice: If you're looking for a place where no one questions you, juniors stay quiet, and your title alone guarantees authority - you might want to try a textbook corporate setup instead. Startups can be messy, but for those who can handle the pace and let go of power plays, they can also be incredibly rewarding.

post_title: Favouritism and team politics
full_review: The company was once a great place to work before the COVID-19 pandemic. However, in recent years, as the employee number has expanded, there has been a noticeable increase in unclear and inconsistent practices around employee evaluations and hiring. Those who spent a significant amount of time gossiping with the CEO often received promotions and salary increases more frequently than other high-performing employees. Further, referrals from certain individuals seemed to carry much more weight, while others' referrals went unnoticed. There seemed to be a rush to be in the CEO's good book among members of small teams with members having equal designation as each wanted to get promoted before others. This often came at the cost of one member badmouthing about another one to the higher up.

post_title: Worst Work Environment Under a Puppet CEO and His Wife
full_review: The CEO isnтАЩt actually a bad person, but his wife is extremely difficult. SheтАЩs consistently rude to the staff and treats the office peon like a personal servant. Whenever something goes wrong, she publicly insults her husband in front of everyone. The office space is quite small, which isnтАЩt a big issue by itself, but she frequently gets into conflicts with the neighboring offices. There was even an incident where he physically assaulted another officeтАЩs peon. As a result, the building management issues them warnings almost every other day. Inside the office, sheтАЩs always shouting and scheming about how to disturb the neighboring offices. Ironically, the people in those offices are very polite and have never caused any troubleтАФtheyтАЩre genuinely decent individuals. Despite some positive aspects of the company, her behavior severely damages the working environment. Instead of focusing on improving the work, she spends time plotting how to mentally pressure and control the staff.

post_title: A company rooted in misogyny: 2 bochorer application saga
full_review: I first heard about Tw!nb!t years ago, when I used one of their iOS apps. Ekhono mone ase how polished and smart that app felt. That was the moment I thought to myself, тАЬEkdin, I want to be part of this team.тАЭ So, the journey began. Over the past two years, I applied to four different roles at Tw!nb!t ( & other companies as well). For the other ones, I went through multiple rounds, got shortlisted, interviewed, even made it to final stages. Meanwhile, I got offers from several other companies. I even landed a role at Mogoj Station as an iOS engineer. But Tw!nb!t? Every single time REJECTED! I was honestly ffrustrated.I got into severe impostor syndrome. Amar POV thekey, My resume was solid, my experience was relevant, and I even had referrals. But no matter how hard I tried, hoina, even reply o painah! But then, out of sheer frustration and curiosity, I decided to do something I shouldтАЩve done earlier and HR ke directly LinkedIn-e message kori. Ekta polite text pathailam, tarpor ekdin call o korlam. And thatтАЩs when I found out something that honestly shook me.┬аTw!nb!t shudhu male engineer-i hire kore.┬аKothao job description-e ei kotha mention nai. No disclaimer, no heads-up, kichui na. Ar ami ekjon qualified female developer, bujhtei parini je bar bar keno ami silent rejection-er moddhe porte chhilam.┬аBujhlam je prottekta company-r nijer culture, hiring policy thakte pare. But ekta basic jinis holo transparency. Jodi age thekei mention korto je eta male-only office, ami to onno route nite partam. Eta shudhu misleading na, eta ekdom disrespectful. Amader moto onek candidate time, energy, effort dei apply korar jonney.

post_title: An egotistic kid is running the whole company and will make your life unbearable.
full_review: ItтАЩs really tough to start. Why? Because I am puzzled with the word "cultural fit" The CEO of the company believes it promotes a good culture ,┬а thatтАЩs true. But┬а you'd need to be reborn to actually see the truth. LetтАЩs see if you can find this " good culture " yourself. Before saying anything else, I have to admit one thing this company does well is paying salaries on time . ThatтАЩs┬а positive, especially from a Bangladeshi perspective. Now, letтАЩs get into it. If you're late by even one minute , you must apologize. Do it three days in a row and you lose a leave day. The most frequently used word around here is "Fire." They wonтАЩt tell you directly that you will be fired. Instead, they say things like, тАЬIf anyone does this or that, theyтАЩll be fired.тАЭ It may sound funny to the CEO, sitting in a superior position, but itтАЩs not funny for the employees. He treats developers with open disrespect . He doesnтАЩt believe theyтАЩre capable of doing anything good. In every meeting, whether itтАЩs a team lead meeting or just a casual check-in, he never misses the chance to criticize and frustrate the developers. There's zero encouragement even when developers perform well. Instead, it's always complaints like, тАЬYou guys canтАЩt even do this simple thing?тАЭ This attitude might come from his belief that developers are too costly, so itтАЩs better to undermine their worth to justify low salaries. He is constantly driven by his ego, as if he dreamt of building a company where only his voice matters. He refuses to hire skilled senior software engineers, probably because he feels insecure, even though he is the CEO. As a SUST alumnus, he clearly shows salary discrimination toward employees from other universities. So these are the so-called " good cultural values " of this company. I still donтАЩt understand how one can build a healthy culture while maintaining such a hostile and fear-driven relationship with employees. He promotes nothing except his own superiority . There is only one real problem here, and that is the CEO himself. Pros: Most employees are good and friendly. Salaries are paid on time. Interns get enough time and space to learn and grow.

post_title: Nepotism Over Merit: How Poor Leadership Is Crippling  N3XT Ventur3S
full_review: The company's leadership structure is built more on personal relationships than on professional merit. Top management roles are occupied by relatives and friends-of-friends rather than qualified, experienced professionals. As a result, critical technical and strategic decisions are made without proper knowledge, foresight, or industry best practices. This lack of capable leadership has led to: Frequent micromanagement and instability A toxic culture of favoritism and fear Poor technical direction due to non-technical leadership No clear career development path or mentorship Salary increments below industry standards No recognition of hard work or dedication Employees with strong potential and high performance find themselves ignored or even pushed aside if they don't belong to the inner circle. The absence of senior professionals with relevant experience limits growth, learning, and innovation across the company. Some internal policies and office rules border on unethical, showing a lack of care for employee well-being, morale, or professional development. Be Careful When Decide to Newly Join Here

So if you're into unpaid modeling gigs, awkward marketing roles disguised as tech jobs, and bringing your own equipment to work тАФ this place is perfect for you! post_title: Not a Good Place to Work for QA
full_review: I was working witth C3fa1o over three years and subsequently went on to look elsewhere for greener pastures. For QA Engineers specifically, C3fa1o not offered the same level of job security, increment ,career growth, or visibility as that seen by developers. Salary increases and promotions for QA come relatively more slowly or none at some point than for their developer counterparts. In times of organizational restructuring/ client contract ending or downsizing, QA jobs are the first to feel the heat. I saw more than once during my tenure. There does not appear to be much long term investment in QA personnel by the company either. While if youтАЩre someone who prioritizes career growth, stability, and a clear professional trajectory within the QA domain, itтАЩs important to weigh these factors carefully before joining. However, if youтАЩre seeking a collaborative environment and youтАЩre less concerned with structured growth or job security in QA, C3fa1o can still be a decent workplace.

post_title: Toxic Company
full_review: Unprofessional Behavior from Management : Direct supervisors, including my boss, often behaved rudely and lacked basic professional courtesy. Leave Requests Often Denied : Reasonable leave requests were not approved, even in cases where time off was necessary. Salary Payments Were Consistently Delayed : Salaries were rarely paid on time, causing financial inconvenience and stress. Lack of Timely Salary Increments : Management was consistently late in evaluating and providing salary increments. Poor Communication and Responsiveness : There was little to no transparency or timely communication from HR or management regarding salary and policy changes. Lack of Employee Recognition and Support : Employee efforts were often overlooked, and there was minimal support or appreciation for hard work.

post_title: A Year in Hell: The dark side of an MNC (Insurance Company)
full_review: This isnтАЩt just a story тАФ itтАЩs a warning. I spent a year working as a contractual IT Business Analyst for a globally recognized MNC in the insurance domain, through a third-party company called Contest Limited. What seemed like a golden opportunity at first quickly turned into the darkest chapter of my professional life. Let me paint the real picture of what goes on inside. This MNC operates with two categories of employees: FTEs (Full-Time Employees) тАУ the so-called "core team" of the MNC FTCs (Full-Time Contractuals) тАУ second-class citizens employed by vendors like Contest Limited From the moment you step in as a contractual BA, youтАЩre marked. You're not seen as a professional. You're not respected. You're not treated like a human being. You are disposable. You are invisible. You're just a puppet they use and abuse for their convenience. The Business team (FTEs) тАФthe very people youтАЩre supposed to collaborate withтАФare the worst offenders. I have never in my life encountered such a cruel, inhumane, and emotionally abusive group of individuals. They made it clear from day one: you are beneath them . They mocked me publicly. They yelled at me like I was dirt under their shoes. They humiliated me repeatedly in meetings and in front of other team members. They belittled every bit of my effort, even when I delivered exactly what was asked, or more. And God forbid you try to stand up for yourselfтАФ theyтАЩll tear you apart . When I refused to be a pushover, when I tried to maintain my dignity, they retaliated by going after me personally. My own Product Owner and Manager were the ring leaders in this corporate circus of humiliation. TheyтАЩd change their requirements and blame me. TheyтАЩd create false narratives just to discredit my work and steal the credit for my efforts. I was nothing but a scapegoat for their incompetence and cover-ups. Even success was twisted into failure so they could throw me under the bus and pat themselves on the back. IтАЩve heard of toxic workplaces. But this wasnтАЩt just toxic тАФ it was psychological warfare . And it didnтАЩt stop with the Business team. The IT team, who should have been my support system, were just as corrupted. They had merged with the business people in behavior and mindset, becoming just as venomous. It was like rot spreading through the entire body of the organization. By the time my contract ended, I wasnтАЩt just exhausted тАФ I was broken. I lost my confidence , my peace of mind , my self-worth , and nearly, my mental health . IтАЩd go home feeling like a ghost of myself. Some nights IтАЩd feel I'm out of breath, frustrated, and helpless. And all for what? A paycheck? ItтАЩs not worth it. This wasnтАЩt just my story. Almost every other BA around me faced the same disrespect, the same emotional abuse, the same bullying. But they stayed quiet. And I donтАЩt blame them. They have families. Circumstances. Responsibilities. They kept their heads down and swallowed the pain because sometimes, survival comes before self-respect. And that's exactly what these bullies feed on тАФ our silence . But I couldnтАЩt take it anymore. I saw how this silence was making them bolder, crueler. I realized тАФ if no one speaks up , this cycle will just continue. So I decided to break it. I decided to tell the truth today тАФ raw, ugly, and honest . Let me be crystal clear: Do NOT work for this company. Even if you're unemployed. Even if it's the last job left on earth. ItтАЩs not a job тАФ itтАЩs a soul-sucking machine designed to drain you of your dignity, joy, and humanity. You will be blamed. You will be insulted. You will be discarded. No one deserves to go through what I went through. I shared this not for sympathy, but as a warning . Your mental health, your self-respect, and your happiness are worth more than any paycheck .

post_title: No Vision, No Innovation, Just Code Monkeys
full_review: To be honest, thereтАЩs barely any real engineering culture here. Innovation isnтАЩt something that gets talked about тАФ itтАЩs more about checking boxes and pushing out code, no matter the quality. A lot of us feel more like code monkeys than actual engineers. Leadership is a major problem. Most of the people in charge donтАЩt have the technical skills to lead a team, let alone drive engineering forward. If you asked them to invert a binary tree, theyтАЩd probably panic. Concepts like technical debt, system design, or scalability? TheyтАЩre not even part of the conversation. And yet, these are the people setting the direction. WhatтАЩs frustrating is that there are some really solid engineers here тАФ people who genuinely care and are doing their best to keep things afloat. But theyтАЩre fighting an uphill battle. On the flip side, there are also folks who clearly struggle with basic problem-solving, and talking through technical issues with them can honestly feel like itтАЩs lowering your own IQ. This place doesnтАЩt feel like a software company. ItтАЩs more like a business that happens to have software, but run by people who donтАЩt understand or value how good software is actually built. Add in the micromanagement, the blame culture, and the lack of accountability, and youтАЩve got a really demoralizing environment. ThereтАЩs potential here, but until leadership takes engineering seriously and starts empowering the right people, weтАЩre just going to keep spinning our wheels.

post_title: Scam Warning: Avoid T3ch E1ement IT тАУ Unpaid Salaries & Lies with false promises
full_review: тА╝я╕ПтЭМЁЯЪл **Warning Notice** ЁЯЪлтЭМтА╝я╕П тА╝я╕ПтЭМЁЯЪл T3ch E1ement IT LTDЁЯЪлтЭМтА╝я╕П This is an important caution regarding a company named **T3ch E1ement IT**. Before accepting any remote or full-time job at this company, please make sure to do proper background checks: * Understand the structure and management of the company * Verify whether they pay salaries on time and follow a proper payment process * Ensure the offer letter clearly mentions salary, bonuses, leave policies, and overtime From my personal experience тАФ along with that of several others тАФ the company still owes us unpaid salaries. Their usual practice is to withhold two months of salary and then, if you leave the job, they simply do not pay those dues. Nothing is documented in writing beyond verbal commitments, and they never confirm anything via phone or message that could serve as proof. Every time they promised to pay тАЬbefore Eid,тАЭ but both Ramadan and Qurbani Eids passed тАФ still no payment. I was supposed to receive my salary for November and December, but in December, the company owner was taken into police custody. Due to the internal issues and these salary-related complications, I decided I would no longer continue working without pay. Even while he was in jail, I continued working out of good faith, hoping that he would settle my dues once released. But after he got out, he started giving excuses again. He even asked me to rejoin the company but never cleared the previous payments. To this day, I havenтАЩt been paid. He keeps delaying тАФ тАЬnot today, maybe tomorrowтАЭ тАФ and now claims the payment will be made in July or August. This is just a tactic to keep dragging it out while avoiding actual payment. **My sincere request to everyone in the community** тАФ before joining any company: * Always ask for a written offer letter * Make sure the offer clearly states salary, working hours, leave policy, and overtime terms * Do not start work unless all terms and conditions are clearly documented All job seekers should stay alert and avoid falling into traps set by such fraudulent individuals or companies. **Thank you.**

post_title: Toxic Work Culture and Worst Tech Team Lead
full_review: The company lacked a clear direction and long-term vision. Leadership at the top was disconnected from the product and the market, with the founder often appearing delusional about the goals and purpose of the organization. Decision-making was inconsistent, and reactions to minor issues were often exaggerated and unprofessional. A toxic culture of favoritism thrived, where those skilled in flattery and office politics were promoted over those focused on real work and results. Constructive criticism or independent thinking was discouraged, and conformity was rewarded more than competence. The tech team, rather than being a center of innovation and execution, operated more like a closed circle. The team lead was known for manipulative behavior, often taking credit for others' contributions and actively suppressing team members' growth to protect his own position. Personal gain was prioritized over collaboration, learning, or transparency. Overall, it was an environment where talent was stifled, and progress was blocked by ego, insecurity, and internal politics. Growth-minded professionals often found themselves frustrated and disillusioned, recognizing that staying too long could compromise their values, skills, and career trajectory.

post_title: No Work Culture тАУ Confusing and Unstructured Environment
full_review: As an augmented team member, the work environment felt disorganized and lacked a defined structure. I was required to report to multiple people, each with different expectations and instructions. This led to frequent confusion and conflict in priorities, making it difficult to focus or deliver consistent results. Instead of a unified direction, I often found myself caught between contradictory tasks and guidance, with little clarity on who to follow. This lack of ownership and cohesion created unnecessary stress and hampered productivity.

post_title: Rude and Misbehaving culture
full_review: You will face mental torture in the name of Scrum meetings. Project managers and some team leads will misbehave with you and display a rude attitude. They don't know how to manage projects or respect other people. The project manager just plays the blame game. This company used to be good, but nowadays it's becoming more like a scam. Project managers team up with certain leads to mistreat developers. They set unrealistic deadlines, which is highly unprofessional. There's a culture of information hiding, toxic politics, and abuse of power. In meetings, the ridiculous CT0 says things like, "We do not need seniors." Well, the company should understand and say, "We do not need a CT0 like you."

post_title: Only ржкрзНржпрж╛рж░рж╛meter is real.
full_review: If you are someone who only wants a steady paycheck in life but do not know when that might end, have no ambition in career; congratulations! you can join here for the constant mental abuse that will put 50 shades to shame. This company used to be an example of excellence but now its only a shell of its former glory. The people who made it great are no longer there. Only the oiling specialists remaining. MD and his sons act like only they know about latest technology or AI whereas they have no idea how a technology works. You will be forced to create and fillup meaningless excel spreadsheets in the name of efficiency. You won't have any spare time to hunt for new business, sometimes even forced by management. But at the end of the day, finance department will berate you for poor sales performance. Daily meetings will occurr with management which has no outcome but you will always be in a constant state of fear because some poor soul might get sacked from that meeting. The MD will only order you to learn. Does't matter if you have mountains of experience in the past, you are here only to learn from him. Which is why it is now jokingly called as "Say33ful's Sch00l of L3arning". You are here only to fill up excel, do cold calls like chaldal or sheba xyz call center.

full_review: You three self-proclaimed "Chalak" clownsтАФCFO, CTO, COO- have crossed every line of decency. Half of June 2025 is gone, and your employees are still begging for their May salaries ! Your policy says salaries hit accounts by the 5th working day of the month, yet here we are, while your pockets are filled with dollars. No shame, no remorse, just pure greed. Eid came and went, and your workers? Left with empty hands and broken spirits. Families struggled to celebrate because you couldnтАЩt be bothered to pay employees on time. You knew that the Bangladesh banking system would shut down for at least 10 days, and employees also informed you about this. And what did we get? A pathetic, copy-pasted template response blaming Bangladesh Bank and City BankтАЩs тАЬbitlami.тАЭ Do you think weтАЩre fools? We see through your lies! You are enjoying to the fullest, while employees, the тАЬkamlas,тАЭ suffer. Your excuses donтАЩt hold water. Employees told you in advance, begged for a solution, but you ignored us. Now you dare point fingers at the banks? This isnтАЩt incompetence, itтАЩs deliberate. Listen up, Bhai: your days of dodging accountability are numbered. You canтАЩt hide behind fake promises and recycled excuses forever. This isnтАЩt just a delay; itтАЩs a betrayal. Emne Kore beshi din cholbe na. To anyone reading this or considering working for these clowns: donтАЩt fall for their fake hope . TheyтАЩll dangle dreams of stability, but all youтАЩll get is empty promises and late paychecks. post_title: I am happy. I hope company gets rich and pays my in dollars instead.
full_review: Honestly, Opt!m!zely came as a blessing to my life. Good pay. Good work. Nice bosses. Great environment. In a year I got a promotion without even asking for one, which made me feel recognized and that there is a good process in place. It feels like a fair place to work. Your chances are fair and balanced if you can deliver. None if you can't deliver. I feel I can live with that pesky balance of not having guaranteed job security as long as the other things don't change. It was like a 2X better experience than where I was previously anyways (I was at an MNC, no less). So generally I don't understand the┬а negative feedback that some of these people have shared. I mean, kichu shomossha thakbei. It's not earth shattering that there are smaller issues like policy changes to be honest. If I were to complain about all small inconveniences like these then even my parents would get feedback on how they run their house lol. So it's okay. I can say Alhamdulillah and carry on. And I understand if some others can't. HHWW.

post_title: Feedback to management
full_review: There was a recent post on Deshi Mula regarding the Automation Team Lead. While I don't agree with the tone used in some parts of the messageтАФsince it came across as disrespectfulтАФthere are certainly valid concerns raised. If a capable individual isn't assigned to a leadership role, it inevitably impacts the entire team, leading to frustration and dissatisfaction. People will eventually find ways to express their grievances. Consider the case of the ML team and its former Team Lead. Unfortunately, this individual lacked the necessary skills and leadership qualities, creating a toxic environment that negatively affected both the team and the company as a whole. Despite being formed nearly five years ago, the team has yet to deliver anything in production. Imagine the level of frustration and demotivation this caused among the team members, who are, in fact, very talented and deserved better guidance. Moreover, there's a noticeable imbalance in workload distribution across teamsтАФsome are underutilized while others are overwhelmed. It's understandable that management may lean towards assigning responsibilities based on personal familiarity or perceived reputation, but such an approach ultimately harms the organization. Currently, the number of senior and mid-level engineers is quite low. Fresh graduates often leave shortly after joining, and if this trend continues, even more experienced professionals will likely follow. As a result, the progression of junior engineers into mid or senior roles will slow significantly. To address this, management must find effective strategies to retain talent. One potential solution could be ensuring team members have the opportunity to work on meaningful and innovative projects that keep them engaged.

From everything IтАЩve heard, the legacy he left behind among all his team members/seniors is admirable. Kudos to them!Wishing them all continued success.

post_title: Simple Review
full_review: Good Things The company has a friendly workplace where everyone gets along well. They also provide free rice and torkari as mentioned in other review. Things to Improve You only get 12 days leave each year for both vacation and sick days, which feels too little. The development team gets more focus, like bigger increments and more input in decisions like office tour. The CTO, who also acts as the manager and comes from a developer background, prioritize the development team. Other teams may work as hard or harder than the development team but get less recognition. Many teamleads have similar experience levels, so leadership can feel inconsistent. Management pushes you to work extra hard, but when its time for increment, you might get less than expected, even if you work hard all year. Why This Happens Please comment below why do you think this happens. In my opinion the development team gets more attention because the CTO understands their work better. This can make other teams feel less valued, even when they contribute a lot. Suggestions The company could offer more days off. Be clearer about raises, and give fair recognition to all. Better leadership training and involving everyone in decisions could make the workplace even better.

In this company you will never get your salary on time, if you are looking for your salary for the month of March, you might get it at 25th -30th of April, in some cases you might not get it in following month. There are many employees in the company who does not get salaries for 2-4 months. I can share a story, that was the Eid month, and Eid date was probably 17th of that month, the company only provided bonus for that Eid and did not pay the salaries to most of the employees, and the management told that they dont have money, but in that month the MD or CTO went to a vacation trip to CANADA for one month with his family, without clearing the salaries. Over all this company has a very toxic work environment, the management always try to make employees work extra hours, there is a culture to insult employees infront of everybody, always work overload and is very difficult to take leave.

post_title: The CTO ruining the company
full_review: 52 Digital, formerly known as B0rd!ng Vi5ta(A Danish company) is drowning with ill mentality of Bangladesh Office current CTO and regional director. He is cheap and narrow minded selfish person, ruining careers of many senior engineers. He is an incapable CTO, knows nothing about tech. Came to this position with his buttering mouth. But speaking English is not the best skill as a CTO. He is insecure about his position as CTO and regional director. He knows he do not deserve this positions, so when he sees competition coming up with smart senior engineers, he is afraid and pulls strings to get rid of the brilliant minds, who were actually adding value. Not only that, he plays tricks and politics to hamper team bonding and spirit. Many brilliant engineers have left. Who did not, with the CTO's action they were fired without any prior notice. There are many I can name. Everyone left being disturbed. 52 Limited is now in danger with this dictator. If he is not removed, then the company is in danger and may not sustain. Till he has taken over the management says the company is in loss (last 5-6 years). The CTO often uses mind games, abuses verbally and destroys careers whom he sees as threats. He loves the soothsayers, who oils him, but not the smart engineers. CTO should be removed, if the company needs to grow or even sustain. It's high time.

@Coyote, thank you for articulating so well. I apologize for vilifying him and to some extent exaggerating some of the points. But I will not apologize for pointing out his limitations and his zero effort for improvement. Even on this Thursday, he made a terrible mistake out of carelessness. If Kamrul were the sufferer of the blunder I highly doubt he would have been that much compassionate towards him. Where is the compassion for the victims? I didn't have the fortune to work with the previous director, but the way people still talk about him says a lot about his competency. Also, you tried to refute the point about the absence of the current director's discussion ability in the same clause with the github example. How does that make sense? If you want to compare two directors in the same way I was trying to compare the interns from two different domains then how would that work? Why should the identity matter in the first place? Why can't we just have a proper debate on valid points like you are doing? When you are going to have an 1 on 1 with him, please let him know that respect is earned.

@Manatee, let me start by saying that I don't think your criticisms are entirely baseless. But the problem is that you seem to be going overboard with it. And also your attitude in conveying them.
Take a look at your arguments. You claim that the engineer director never writes code or participates in discussions. Is this true? Let's see. Go to the Github profile of the director - https://github.com/?tab=overview and click on "Show more activity" to expand on them. I can see plenty of pull requests, reviews, and contributions. So your claim is already refuted.
Now, you could say these are trivial contributions, and even an intern could do that. An engineer director should be doing more. Well, then let's take a look at the previous engineering director's activities from 2023 using the same metric and process - https://github.com/?tab=overview&from=2023-12-01&to=2023-12-31
What do we see? If we just take a look at the number of contributions in our repos, it seems the previous director's contributions are even less. If we take a look at the complexity or significance of the contributions, I don't see much difference either. Does that mean he was an even worse director? Nope. At best, this is the oversimplified cause fallacy. This same counter-argument can be used for the interns when you try to assess their performance by comparing GitHub statistics. I do not care about defending anyone, but your points are not entirely rational.
If he is contributing, he clearly knows how to set up localdev. It is not rocket science. But you said he couldn't set up his localdev yet in 18 months. Maybe you meant to say he should be more qualified for his role, but this is not what you wrote. Therefore, your claim is once again refuted. And how do you know whether he was able to set up his localdev or not? Have you been monitoring his machine?
He does have context about what my team and pod are working on. I will admit that he has scope for improvement to be more connected with the teams, but see how you went overboard with this point and villified him unfairly? Funny how you yourself are saying how Kamrul made terrible arguments and backing off.
I could go on and address some of your other claims, but I don't have all day. You have exaggerated, assumed, and oversimplified in most of the claims I disagree with. But that's not the biggest problem I have with such remarks. The biggest problem I see here is your attitude and choice of words. Using insults (shameless idioit, lazy fk), spreading hate, even using passive-aggressive and mocking phrases like "emotional puppy", "my sweet little innocent angel" on someone brave enough to disclose his real identity, with a condescending attitude when you made a lot of unsubstantiated claims exaggerated with emotional bias and with a terrible attitude yourself. Oh, the irony.
Back in the Newscred days, we used to have five values for our company. One of them was - "compassion over being right". I guess we lost it down the road. I would blame the management and leadership more though, for not scrutinizing enough during the recruitment and for not upholding that culture strongly, as opposed to blaming you guys. You could be 100% right in your arguments rationally, and even then, I would say you are part of the bigger problem. It applies to others as well who seem to have the same kind of attitude. This is easily the biggest reason for our downfall as a company.
I would still request you to do better. Come forward and have an open discussion. Talk to your manager, talk to the engineering director, talk in public channels, and voice your concerns. In fact, I am planning to have a 1:1 with the engineering director myself to share some of my own feedback. Because I do want things to improve. I do not need to lick anyone, nor do I have to resort to anonymous snarky comments with over-exaggeration. Peace.
I'm not an Engineer. From an outsider perspective, I see the location champion more in the smoking room, having coffee, and involved with his gang than working with his team.┬а

Hey emotional puppy first know the difference between "check" and "compare". You are acting like so empathetic and yet you haven't thought about the contributions of the intern in the EXP team nor the high performing EXP engineers who deserve more. Bro/sis, my sweet innocent little angel, tell me, should I go to the director and tell him that he needs to learn at least some basic features of the product that he is supposed to supervise? That he needs to be aware of the teams and engineers whom he is supposed to guide? The very teams that he "assisted" to form without having any knowledge about the strength and weaknesses of the members in it. Perhaps he should join with the interns as one of them. And brother/sister, this is deshimula not your dreamworld.

post_title: Very Disappointing Experience тАФ Poor Management and False Promises
full_review: I joined this training program hoping to gain valuable experience and grow my skills in the software field. Unfortunately, my experience was full of disappointments. I want to share this so others can make a better decision before joining. The overall management felt unprofessional and disconnected from the real software industry. The head of the academy often used technical buzzwords to sound smart, but didnтАЩt offer any helpful insight or real guidance. Most sessions lacked meaningful content, and the leadership seemed more interested in appearances than supporting our growth. In this program, good communication in English was given more value than actual problem-solving or programming skills. Many trainees who were strong in coding were overlooked, while others with better English but weaker technical skills were praised. This approach was discouraging and unfair. During the full training period, trainees received no salary or support тАФ not even for transportation or basic expenses. Only lunch was provided. The management kept saying they were "investing in us" through classrooms and trainers. However, they had already received major funding from the EDGE program. It felt like most of the money stayed with them, and trainees got very little in return. They clearly said only 50% of trainees would be selected for their internal team, which was fine. But they also promised to create job opportunities for the rest тАФ something that never happened. There was no follow-up or support for those who didnтАЩt get selected. Even worse, they gave us our training certificates in May 2025 тАФ more than a year and a half after training ended in November 2023. They blamed the delay on тАЬgovernment verification,тАЭ but in the end, there was no government seal or signature on the certificate at all. There was strong favoritism toward trainees from Jahangirnagar University. Many top positions and opportunities were regularly given to students from that university. It didnтАЩt seem to be based on skill or performance, but on personal connections. The head of the academy and another senior member тАФ who constantly highlighted his internship at Wordwide reputed company's R&D тАФ are both from that university. This person often acted with an attitude, showing off during sessions and repeating that he worked at Samsung R&D, sometimes more than once per session. But when it came to real contributions or support, there was very little action. This made the environment feel even more biased and unhelpful. This training had potential, but it was badly managed. Trainees gave their full time and effort with the hope of a better future, but many were left disappointed. The lack of fairness, broken promises, and favoritism ruined the experience for many of us. I truly hope this academy takes feedback seriously and works on building a more fair, professional, and transparent program in the future тАФ one that values real talent, not just connections or communication skills.

post_title: ЁЯТЩ 4 Years at V2 Technologies Ltd тАФ A Journey I'll Always Be Grateful For
full_review: ItтАЩs hard to put into words what these four years at V2 Technologies Ltd meant to me. I joined the company as almost a newcomer to the tech world тАФ not just in experience, but in mindset. But over time, this company, and the amazing people in it, shaped me into a Senior Data Engineer whoтАЩs not only confident in skills, but also in personality, leadership, and team spirit. I didnтАЩt just learn to code or build reports and dashboards тАФ I learned how to learn , how to take ownership, how to experiment, how to lead, and most importantlyтАж how to enjoy the journey . There were days when we stayed in the office for 2тАУ3 nights straight, pushing through deadlines. And we didnтАЩt complain тАФ we bonded , we grew , we laughed , and we learned together . I got to work across so many areas тАФ databases, reporting, dashboards, analytics, machine learning, DevOps тАФ and that full-stack exposure was priceless. I was lucky to work with some of the most genuine people IтАЩve ever met. No office politics, no egos тАФ just love and respect like a family. My closest colleagues are still the people I turn to for advice, even in personal matters. The Database team тАФ you were the best. The ML and DevOps teams тАФ you inspired me every day, leart a lot of things. My Principal Engineer and my angry cotton hearted Manager тАФ thank you for guiding me with patience and wisdom. And there is someone ABC bhai тАФ youтАЩre one of a kind. Tough on the outside, but always full of care (Gaach pagol) You'll always know who he is. And all the other teams including SE, Business, CSM, UI/UX, Testing, Andoid my gratitude to all, really. I still remember whom I first met and who helped me in every single way of my work- X,Y,Z bhai (Trust me they were real genius!) I got them as my senior,┬а I fell in love of their way of work. The culture at V2 was something else. So many events , celebrations, and random fun moments (you'll also come to know if you've ever been there who is the burden taker for all these, respect to him) тАФ I never once felt like I was missing home while I was in the office. After a certain point, I felt it was time for me to grow further тАФ to fly a little higher. I shared everything honestly with my seniors тАФ which companies I was interviewing with, where I got offers, where I was thinking of going. And you know what? They supported me fully. That says everything about the kind of people they are. Even now, part of me still wishes I couldтАЩve stayed. But growth sometimes means moving on. Every company has room to improve, and V2 is no different. The company builds amazing products тАФ truly genius stuff тАФ but I always felt they needed a stronger sales strategy to get the clients they deserve. I hope they land a global giant one day. ThereтАЩs a need for more structured onboarding and learning тАФ especially around internal tools, documentation , and best practices. This would make life easier for newcomers. Oh тАФ and yes, please improve the lunch food ЁЯШЕ (everyone says this, and IтАЩll say it too). At the end of the day, people donтАЩt fall in love with companies тАФ they fall in love with their leaders , mentors , and teammates тЭдя╕П . For me, V2 will always be one of the most meaningful chapters of my life. It's another family, not corporate.

post_title: Review of Station 23 тАУ From a DeveloperтАЩs Point of View
full_review: As a developer, IтАЩve had the opportunity to collaborate with Station 23, and itтАЩs been one of the most rewarding professional experiences of my career. What stands out most is the strong engineering culture. The team values clean code, modern architecture, and best practicesтАФsomething every developer appreciates. From day one, I noticed a collaborative atmosphere where knowledge sharing is encouraged, and everyone is genuinely passionate about technology. Station 23 works with a wide range of technologies, including .NET, Java, Python, mobile stacks, and cloud platforms like AWS and Azure. This gave me a chance to expand my skills and work on challenging, meaningful projects that solve real-world problems. Their agile process is well-implemented, with regular code reviews, CI/CD pipelines, and a supportive QA team that ensures quality. Even under tight deadlines, the focus remains on delivering scalable, maintainable solutionsтАФnot just quick fixes. ┬аWhat also impressed me is the leadership's openness to innovation. If you bring an idea or suggest a new tool or approach, they actually listen. This fosters a real sense of ownership and motivation among developers. If you're a developer looking to grow, learn, and build great software in a positive and progressive environment, Brain Station 23 is a fantastic place to be.

post_title: Peak toxicity with zero class.
full_review: This place isnтАЩt just bad тАФ itтАЩs a masterclass in how to destroy potential, drain souls, and reward mediocrity. B0ng0 BD is where ambition goes to die, creativity gets buried alive, and toxic behavior is not just tolerated тАФ itтАЩs celebrated. Management? A clown show of insecurity and cheapness. Leadership operates on ego, not logic. TheyтАЩll penny-pinch you on essentials but splurge on PR to look like a "cool startup." Spoiler: no one's buying it. They demand loyalty but give you crumbs. No vision, no planning, just daily chaos and last-minute panic masked as "startup hustle." Work culture? Radioactive. Backstabbing is currency here, and flattery is the only language that gets you noticed. Actual talent? Irrelevant. If you donтАЩt suck up, youтАЩre blacklisted. If you speak up, youтАЩre gaslit. Nepotism and favoritism run so deep, youтАЩd think itтАЩs a royal court, not a company. Coworkers? Imagine a toxic WhatsApp group turned into an office. Gossip, passive aggression, fake smiles тАФ all under a thin layer of forced professionalism. ItтАЩs not a team; itтАЩs survival of the fakest. The worst people rise, and the best burn out. Bottom line: Bongo BD is a circus without a ringmaster, run by people who value bootlicking over brilliance. ItтАЩs not a workplace тАФ itтАЩs a psychological thriller with bad lighting and worse coffee. Run. DonтАЩt walk. RUN.

post_title: Junior staff position is usually badly influenced or controlled by the broken HR panel.
full_review: By admitting students with very low tuition fees, the university severely compromises its standards, while only the admission office staff enjoy increased value and salaries. Faculty salaries have been raised to sky-high levels, but junior staff (below Senior Officer level) are continuously exploited and receive no benefits. Some Senior Officers benefit by pleasing higher management, securing their own salary hikes, while ignoring the needs of junior staff тАФ neither increasing their salaries nor the extremely low overtime rate (15тАУ25 BDT/hour). The HR management, influenced by personnel from A**l K***r Group, has intensified this exploitation further and displays unreasonable behavior, often nitpicking without cause. Incompetent individuals hold officer positions, turning the workplace into a center for flattery and favoritism. There are employees who have worked for 12тАУ15 years yet still earn only 20тАУ25k BDT monthly, simply because of biased favoritism from officer-level staff тАФ who themselves get large increments every year. One major reason for the institution's academic decline is that key panels are filled with non-academic members who seem to exist only to exploit junior staff. There is no healthy working environment тАФ over 3,000 students are crammed into an eight-story residential building. Classrooms are tiny, and even 120-minute classes are squeezed into just 40 minutes тАФ leading to complete chaos. Additionally , there are countless issues that cannot be described fully here. However, the core problems include: excessive flattery culture, exploitation, inequality, corruption, poor working environment, unqualified senior management, and a broken HR system.

post_title: Let's talk about rajshahi office
full_review: Salary: Salary in rajshahi branch is much more less than dhaka office. not only entry level salary but also increment. The branch head U****n G***h and the CEOs say that salary is less in rajshahi because daily cost of a person is less in rajshahi. how does that justify the whole thing? MNC want cheap labour, garments want cheap labour but a company which talks about treating employees right is doing this. the salary gap is too much, like 10-30k. they say they provide salary based on skill. does this mean that employee in rajshahi office are less skilled or they are doing less work? U****n G***h: sometimes the management(U****n G***h) talk in a way that they have done a big favour by bringing the company to rajshahi and we all should be very grateful for that and we should not talk about any facilities that are given in dhaka office. he humiliates employees for small things. there is a rule for giving penalty if a employee attends office after 10:30. if a employee is late for even 1 minute then the employee has to give 100 tk penalty. why a employee is not trusted? he enforces to take sessions. he wants the employe to arrange these sessions which takes time and effort. if employees takes session and the work is delayed then he would ask to work extra hour or days surely. He even makes the employee feel bad about food and other facilities. he has favourite employee, E****l K***s. E****l K***s can come to office anytime he wants. U****n G***h says E****l K***s works properly so penalty rule can be different for him. but if any other employee wants to work at home, he wouldnt allow that. everything is fair for E****l K***s. everyone can see that and everyone knows the facilities that he is giving to E****l K***s. dhaka management will only value those people about whom U****n G***h talks in good way. he has some other favourite employees, yusuf hasan, priyonti mutsuddi. he would compare one employee with another. he would call employee and lecture them for hours if he sees the employee is late or if anyone has a difefrent opinion than him. he would make them employee feel so bad by saying different kind of things. everyone in the office knows tanha tahity is U****n G***h's favourite as well. Projects: projects are not well structured and not managed properly. U****n G***h will force the employee to manage the projects properly. he has made naj product manager and asks her to see how the products are going. how can a girl who used to work in frontend manage product? she does not even have proper experience. Leave: he pressurize to take leave even for small things where there are only total 15 days of leave. at the end of the year, if a employee want to take a leave then it wont be possible. U****n G***h does not want all the employee to take leave together. if that is the case then management could have had a better way to handle this. Benefits: no extra benefit then food and salary. Dhaka colleagues: dhaka colleagues see rajshahi employee very poorly. they treat the employees as people here are less qualified and they act like they are all modern(We are not insecure). U****n G***h will force us to welcome them when they come and go out with them and. don't we have a life of our work and our own works to do? some very unprofessional people are hired who doesnt know how to act in the office and how project are actually managed. There was a girl who was in weekdemy. maybe her name is masuma, she acted like she was some big employee in the company. there would be vape in her desk. the main problem is, she used to do nothing. never saw her doing anything. employees invested time guiding the weekdemy interns but they dont even come to office properly. this whole program was a failure. There are many more things in rajshahi office which are not properly managed. it would take the whole day to finish talking about them. Note to management: Please try to make rajshahi office more employee friendly and handle the projects properly. it is hard to manage a office in a place like rajshahi but the resources you have dont underestimate them or humiliate them. it breaks the confidence of the employee. And please make U****n G***h understand that if a senior employee is humiliated in front of juniros, it makes them feel very bad.

post_title: A Toxic Brew: The Leadership Failure at 2SL Wireless
full_review: Part 1: The COO - A Recipe for Disaster The COO at 2SL Wireless was a straight-up liability. His leadership was a joke тАУ totally biased and weak. He was all about sucking up and surrounded himself with yes-men who cooked up fake Excel sheets to make things look good. Real talent and experienced heads of departments got the boot if they weren't in his little club. It was a classic case of "scratch my back, I'll scratch yours," and the company paid the price. He had zero clue about sales or business in general, and his whole "eat oil give oil" mentality was like a virus infecting the entire organization. Bottom line: he was a terrible boss and a major reason why the company tanked. Part 2: The CFO - Talented but Toxic The CFO has a different kind of problem тАУ talented, sure, but completely self-serving. He was a master at playing the MD, churning out bogus Excel reports just to keep him happy. Performance? Zero. Showing off? Hundred percent. He was quick to fire good people from his own team, probably because he felt threatened. Meanwhile, he was busy lining his own pockets and those of his cronies with fat salaries while everyone else, especially in non-tech departments, got peanuts. This guy was a one-person wrecking crew, single-handedly destroying the company from the inside out with his selfish moves. Part 3: A Toxic Culture Doomed 2SL Wireless: Avoid 2SL Wireless like the plague. This isn't a workplace, it's a morale graveyard. Forget about growth or feeling valued тАУ this company is stuck in the past with zero employee benefits updates and shrinking flexibility. Raises? Don't hold your breath. Expect a measly 2-5% if you're lucky, with no clear system in place. Collaboration at the top is non-existent, with CXOs seemingly operating in their own isolated silos. Forget recognition for hard work. Your efforts will likely go unnoticed in this environment. There's no clear vision for the future, and employee well-being is clearly not a priority. This isn't just a lack of positive culture; it's a breeding ground for negativity and disengagement. Stay far, far away if you value your career and sanity.

post_title: MD Thinks, PMO Types тАФ Excel (Mula) Life is Fine
full_review: I donтАЩt usually write reviews, but after spending considerable time at 2SL and observing how things really operate on the inside, I feel the need to share a few hard truths. i dont work at 2SLWireless anymore but i thinks you need to read this. ItтАЩs easy to point fingers at the top┬а the COO and CFO certainly deserve criticism for poor strategic direction. But the problems at 2SL run much deeper. The real dysfunction thrives in the middle layer of management, particularly within the PMO department , which has unfortunately become a shadow of what it should be. Rather than acting as a strategic backbone, the PMO team has turned into a format factory . Two individuals in particular R1y@d and T0u%!4 have played a central role in this. Their primary task? Taking the MDтАЩs impulsive, often unclear instructions and turning them into Excel files and documents using ChatGPT. ThereтАЩs no analysis. No strategic thinking. Just templated outputs that rarely reflect the actual operational needs of the company. These documents donтАЩt guide; they confuse. Yet somehow, these two have become the MDтАЩs most тАЬtrustedтАЭ individuals┬а not because of performance, but because of blind compliance. Instead of challenging poor decisions or offering practical solutions, they act as loudspeakers, formatting and forwarding directives without context or clarity. The result? Employees are left confused, spending valuable productive hours filling out endless Excel templates most of which serve no real purpose. Meanwhile, those who could fix the problem┬а the middle managers┬а continue to enable it, either by staying silent or playing along. post_title: A cautionary tale - avoid B3vy Comm3rce if you value professionalism, growth, or leadership
full_review: A cautionary tale тАФ avoid B3vy Commerce if you value professionalism, growth, or leadership Working at B3vy Commerce was one of the most disheartening professional experiences IтАЩve had in my career. I joined with high hopes, excited by the companyтАЩs mission and potential. Unfortunately, what I encountered was a toxic environment plagued by poor leadership, lack of transparency, and a deeply unprofessional culture. 1. Dysfunctional leadership - especially from the top The biggest red flag is the director, J@f@r. Leadership sets the tone for a company, and in this case, JafarтАЩs tone is arbitrary, ego-driven, and devoid of accountability. He micromanages when it suits him but disappears when guidance is genuinely needed. Constructive feedback is treated as disloyalty, and sycophancy is rewarded over merit. It creates an atmosphere where employees are more concerned with staying off his radar than actually doing good work. 2. No real career growth There are no clear KPIs, no structured performance reviews, and promotions are either political or non-existent. Promises about career progression are made during hiring and then conveniently forgotten. The few people who are promoted tend to be close to the inner circle rather than the ones contributing meaningfully. 3. Toxic culture masked as тАЬstartup hustleтАЭ The company romanticizes chaos and overwork. People are expected to work weekends, respond late at night, and constantly be available тАФ not because it's necessary, but because it's seen as тАЬcommitment.тАЭ Burnout is rampant, and support is minimal. Mental health is just a buzzword in all-hands meetings тАФ no actual policies back it up. 4. Lack of direction and strategy Projects are started on a whim and dropped just as quickly. ThereтАЩs no long-term roadmap, and priorities change weekly depending on JafarтАЩs mood or whatever article he read that day. This instability makes it impossible to build anything sustainable or take ownership of your work. 5. HR and admin? Practically non-existent. ThereтАЩs no proper onboarding, no grievance redressal system, and no confidentiality if you raise concerns. Everything feels cobbled together and temporary, including contracts and documentation. YouтАЩll spend more time fixing broken internal systems than actually contributing to the companyтАЩs goals. In conclusion: If you're early in your career, desperate for a line on your resume, and don't mind sacrificing your well-being or professional integrity, maybe you can survive a few months at Bevy Commerce. Otherwise, I urge you to steer clear. There are far better companies out there that actually value their people and know what they're doing.

post_title: Disheartening Experience Rooted in Bias and Mismanagement
full_review: During my time at the company, I witnessed a troubling culture of favoritism, mismanagement, and a lack of accountability among the senior leadership in the Bangladesh office. Many members of the management team behave more like shareholders than leadersтАФissuing orders without participating in the actual work and rarely taking responsibility when issues arise. Recruitment practices are deeply problematic, often favoring personal referrals from senior officials rather than merit-based selection. If youтАЩre not connected to someone in leadershipтАФwhether as a relative, spouse, partner, or close friendтАФitтАЩs difficult to get hired. Even if you do manage to secure a position, youтАЩre likely to face discrimination in the form of lower salary increments, fewer growth opportunities, and unequal treatment compared to those with internal connections. Leads and managers frequently show favoritism, granting certain employees special privileges related to leave policies, pay raises, and assignments. Decision-making is primarily driven by the interests of senior leadership, with little to no regard for fairness or employee input. A particularly concerning issue is the expectation placed on junior employees to work beyond regular office hours, including weekends and public holidays. Refusing to do so is often met with pressure, veiled threats, or implications that it could affect your standing in the company. This exploitative approach not only disrupts work-life balance but also fosters a toxic environment of fear and compliance. Furthermore, the management is actively taking advantage of the current economic situation and the scarcity of quality job opportunities by continuously hiring and pushing excessive workloads onto existing employees. This practice allows them to maximizing output, with little regard for employee well-being or sustainability. The constant pressure to deliver under unrealistic expectations is draining and demoralizing. Additionally, abrupt decisionsтАФlike the sudden change in office hours to 8 AMтАУ4 PMтАФare made without employee consultation. While junior staff are expected to be punctual, many leads routinely arrive hours late, creating an unfair and disheartening work environment. The disparity in treatment is obvious, yet efforts are made to conceal these issues from the US-based management team.

Yes, there might be a referral system in place, and that's totally fine. Referral systems are common all over the world. However, I can assure you that the authorities did not overlook more capable candidates just because someone was referred.

post_title: Rant to my own people!
full_review: Been seeing lots of reviews about Optimizely lately - some useful, others just keyboard therapy. HereтАЩs mine: honest, balanced, and to the point. If youтАЩre here for real insight, not drama, read on: LetтАЩs start with the Cons (because yтАЩall clearly love to start your day with negativity) But here are the Pros (and theyтАЩre not imaginary, either): And now, the fun and best part: roasting the drama queens (or kings? What should I tell you?) And letтАЩs not forget the support we got during serious stuff - like when internet was cut during the student protests. Folks from other countries covered for us. My manager had my back, and for that, IтАЩll always be grateful. You donтАЩt get that kind of empathy everywhere. Finally, to Seniors, EAB, HR: Please start by having real conversations with global leadership . Copy-pasting U.S. strategy to Bangladesh doesnтАЩt work . Here, job security is sacred. You fire someone in the U.S. - they get another job next week. Here? Not so simple. Explain the market, the culture, and the consequences. Otherwise, you all suck and are good for nothing! HR team , can we please talk? When you sit together in a corner like a secret illuminaty society, it makes people (at least me) paranoid. Be more approachable. Mingle with the team like everyone else in the office. Be more human. Laura (CPO) set a great example - Please follow that energy. Wrapping up: No company is perfect. Optimizely isnтАЩt either. But itтАЩs not trash just because itтАЩs not giving out coffee like Santa Claus or took away unlimited PTO. If youтАЩre writing a review, be balanced . Tell people whatтАЩs working and whatтАЩs not. DonтАЩt take the good stuff for granted while building a whole rant around what you didnтАЩt get. Be real, or just keep scrolling.

post_title: Friendly and flexible culture across the company, with some room for improvement in the QA team
full_review: The company has a friendly and collaborative culture where most teams work well together and support each other. Engineers are valued, leadership is approachable, and learning is encouraged. While the QA team could improve in aligning with the rest of the organizationтАЩs openness, overall itтАЩs a positive environment with room to grow and thrive.

post_title: Changing Culture and Growing Concerns
full_review: When I joined, the culture was welcoming, energetic, and motivating, even though the workload was high. People supported each other, and collaboration across teams was smooth. However, over time, things have shifted. The culture is gradually becoming more toxic, with visible favoritism and internal biases, especially within the QA team. What once felt like a team-oriented environment is now strained by a lack of transparency and inclusiveness.

post_title: All That Glitters Are Not Gold тАУ A.K.A тАЬGreat Place To WorkтАЭ - LOL
full_review: This company has a repeated pattern of terminating employees. They terminate employees quietly so that others donтАЩt notice. There is a serious client crisis. Most of the clients are gorib. The few that come in do not stay for long. If there is no client, employees slowly become irrelevant and get kicked out. Teams are shrinking left and right. Most teams have only 2тАУ3 members. Over the past year, a significant number of people were sacked. However, as mentioned in some other reviews on Deshimula, those who are 'ashirbad prapto bhai-brothers' seem unaffected. Besides this, there is zero long-term monetary gain beside salary. ItтАЩs important for new joiners to be aware of these issues before making decisions. It is high time their fake fa├зade is exposed.

What truly matters is whether someone is terminated unjustly or without any notice. IтАЩve been here for the last 7 years and havenтАЩt heard of a single instance like that.
You mentioned that the clients are тАЬgoribтАЭ. Is that really your concern? Your salary is paid by Cefalo and itтАЩs CefaloтАЩs responsibility to ensure that. IтАЩve never heard of a single instance of delayed salary at Cefalo. Clients will come and go, thatтАЩs the nature of a client-based company. Last year a number of developers were without clients for a long time, yet I didnтАЩt hear of any delayed salaries or unjust terminations. Most of those developers were eventually reassigned to clients this year.

About the тАЬGreat Place to WorkтАЭ recognition, yes, it may seem a bit tacky, but did Cefalo ever ask us to leave a positive review there? As far as I know, they didnтАЩt. So I donтАЩt understand what your complaint is about that.

post_title: Our team lead is an I*i*t
full_review: My lead called me and told me to leave a review, so here it is. This is only about him and less about the company. Because he is the reason why there is no team. i joined his team and he made me do so much work and reporting for no reason. time to time, he is the only one that compaints about the company , and blames management for not getting a promotion. i dont see him as anything else than what it is. Eka kam kore bhalo, but team e bhai ekta nightmare. Ami mone hoi abar nursery te aishe porsi. He told me to leave the real review about the shitty company but reality is , he is the only one that is going through it. I came in from a different company and i hate working under this guy. but amader team e eto unhappy kao re o dekhina. Mone hoitese he is the only one that comes in and comments with someone else that got fired in the past, for attendance. I had a tough time blending in, work was hectic as this is a night job. but other lead walked me through it, and they hired someone full time for assistance, only because of this other individuals i was able to do a lot of task. time ektu tough jai, but we are all fine. ekhane shob jinish na believe korlei hoi. obhaga manush aisha apnader shob opporutnity onno desh e ditese. whats the worst? interview den, kam bhalo na lagle chaira den, but atleast nijer experience niye jan, onno der kotha na bishash kora bhalo. question goes out to people, apni jodi eto unhappy thaken, then are jaigai kaj nenna ken? truth is, era jane ekhane taka bhalo dei. Taka o nei, gali galaz o kore. Ami bhalo kaj paile amio choila jabo, nijer reputation keno kharap kortesen?

post_title: Story of being Humiliated
full_review: This company offers an average working environment with a well-structured salary system. However, some senior employees (based on my personal experience with one) are not particularly supportive. Instead of helping juniors when they face challenges, they often resort to mockery or humiliation. They may not provide clear guidance on tasks, yet criticize the outcome if it doesn't align with their expectations. Additionally, internal politics among colleagues can be quite toxic. On a positive note, the Managing Director is exceptionally kind and approachable, which is a valuable aspect of the organization.

post_title: Seen good time, seeing bad time
full_review: V!vasof7 was a company everyone wished to work for here. When I joined this company, I thought it was time to settle down. But day by day, Vivasoft ain't the place you want to come to anymore. Pros: On time salary ЁЯСНЁЯП╗ЁЯСНЁЯП╗ЁЯСНЁЯП╗ Most of the employee are valo manush. motamuti sobai sobaire chine and ekta large percentage people er mon manushikota valo. though ei valo manush er count decline kortese. Gym ache, besh koyek type er khelar jayga ache, ghumanor jayga ache. Food was good, though there is still variety, quality has declined, hiring more kitchen staff would solve this issue, I think. HR apu gula besh valo. Ohetuk jhamela kore na jodi apni nije thik thaken. Cons: Management theke team recism. In the name of culture, oshalin poshak allow kore. esob nia bolle abar bole nojor er hefajot, potential r**ist etc (typical shahbagi kotha barta, asole sheal to chay je murgi or jimmay thakuk lol). eto beshi vape tane working area te je vivasoft ke vapesoft bolle vul hobe na. Increment khub e minimal or zero.┬аNo proper salary structure. Salary negotiate kore ekdom new market er pant er dokaner moto. PM gula ekekta overpaid goru bisesh kore Santa Claus. Passive request korbe majhe majhe deshimula/glass door e valo review dite. Music corner is too loud. jokhn iccha tokhn osur besur golay gan dhorbe ar baddo bajiye concentration noshto korbe. Biri room er member hote hobe and dui tinta circle ache oi circle gular member hote hobe naile apnar dam nai management er kache. Apni jodi pathao er sathe kono vabe connected hon, tahole apnar dam e dam. Achievement er theke altu faltu lafa lafi beshi. Behuda showoff er jonno khoroch korbe (over seas office) but salary increment dewar time e taka nai. Bishes circle er member na hole employee loyalty nai. Valo teamlead nai bollei chole. Team wise culture ache, skill issue nia kotha ache but ogula subjective. tai ar ogula nia kotha bollam na. Message to the management: Santa type kichu gutikoyek er kotha mathay rekhe odhikangsho employeeder asha icche deny koiren na. Ei employee rai mirpur chader office theke ajker etoboro office e tene nia asche. Because they belived in Viva's vision. But nowadays, ja kortesen, tate oi koyekta pm, marketing(!!!) ar chatukar theke jabe, company er heart valo engineer gula chole jabe. tokhn 27 e gia sukh tan diye sukh newa chara ar kichu korar thakbe na.

post_title: Harassment in the name of Interview
full_review: I want to share a terrible experience. A few days ago, I attended an interview for the Sr. SQA position, and it turned out to be an awful case of harassment. Two other Sr. SQAs from 8RAC IT were taking my interview. One of them was formal and decent, but the other was extremely rude and unprofessional. That rude person didnтАЩt follow even the minimum level of professional behavior. He started misbehaving right from the beginning. When he made a mistake, he tried to prove that I was wrong instead. At one point, I even considered walking out of the interview. I held myself back twice but stayed, hoping it would end soon. But it didnтАЩt end. Instead, he started asking unclear questions and kept talking on his phone during the interview. He didnтАЩt let me properly answer and interrupted constantly. When I gave a different opinion on something, he became even more disrespectful. Eventually, the interview ended and I left. On my way home, I kept thinking тАФ why did I even go for the 8RAC IT interview after seeing so many bad reviews? Also, I donтАЩt understand why 8RAC IT management would send someone like him to take interviews. After coming home, I searched on LinkedIn and found his name тАФ P****z H*****n . He has only around 3.5 to 4 years of experience and has already switched 3тАУ4 companies. This is the situation. My humble request: If anyone plans to attend an interview at 8RAC IT, please be mentally strong and prepared beforehand.

post_title: Automation SQA II rant session
full_review: I appreciate this page a lot. Where I can finally come and vent about internal company problems. This was something that was needed in our community for so long, especially after so many staff augmented companies are coming to Bangladesh. I was really confused on what the company does in the beginning. When I asked HR and during my onboarding I was truly skeptical. How does these young guys land that big of contracts with client name they mentioned. Whatever I thought giving it a shot. The first week was extremely hectic, I had no idea about any documentation, but our project manager was nice enough to atleast walk us through it. this is where I think the management can use some help. Take off the so call "leads" or "managers" they are they only one ruining the team culture. The other team is being lead by a solution architect and amader ta pura baje. He claims to have 10 years of experience but only graduated in 2020? Makes no sense. He is a great worker but absolutely 0 help in the team and society. I won't mention name, but this automation II was extremely toxic and made sure all of us write bad reviews in this page. So this goes out to you, do your work and stop influencing people to write bad reviews or you yourself writing horrible reviews. The amount of negative feedback I see, I don't even think our SQA team has that many people. in the middle I was notified by the client about my performance, when I let him know, he stutter and absolutely had no idea what to do, since then I stoped asking him. I requested additional help and followed up day after day, was now yesterday got my performance bonus. Other than SQA team, especially people under him they go out and have fun. Does random meetup, bhalo culture. after I saw the bad review I had couple of calls with the upper management asking about the hire and fire culture that I'm reading everywhere, I was concerned about my job. Later in the management walked me through the firing list and one by one, why with details. The transparency gave me a little more confidence. The pattern I see with the firing is as simple as not attending meeting without webcam, mic guli thake eto baje quality , amar nijer lojja lage. final verdict: if you are a ┬аhard worker, can improve on your self and constantly want challenge I would recommend this place. It's out of the traditional places I worked before. Bairer client er sathe exposure Onek bhalo. But can get overwhelming from time to time. If you complaint, and Sharadin aamar automation engineer er II moto complaint koro. Don't expect much
