post_title: Shadow Coders and the Rise of Adhu Bhai
full_review: Every year, they launch their oh- so- glorious " Star Coder" program like it's the gateway to Silicon Valley. TheyтАЩll say youтАЩre getting permanent positions instantly , but surprise тАФ only 10- 20% actually get that offer . The rest? Welcome to TraineeLand with a shiny 10,000 BDT salary and dreams sold on discount. But the fun doesnтАЩt stop there. You think youтАЩll be learning? Nah. YouтАЩll be thrown into projects doing senior, lead, or even principal engineer- level tasks тАФ but youтАЩll still be a тАЬ trainee.тАЭ Meanwhile, the client pays for a senior, but itтАЩs you, the newbie, whoтАЩs actually writing the code. ThatтАЩs not called experience тАФ thatтАЩs called corporate cosplay . The logic? Why pay one skilled senior when you can get 10 trainees for the same price and confuse the hell out of the client? Result? Buggy code, overworked juniors, and vanished project quality. Shocking? Not really. And the seniors? Well, the real seniors either left or were shown the door. What remains is the Adhu Bhai Squad тАФ the ones who stayed not because theyтАЩre skilled, but because they mastered the ancient art of giving oil to the SBU heads. These folks donтАЩt code. They run with laptops the moment a boss enters, just to look busy , then go back to doing what they do best: blame juniors . In this company, being a junior means you are expected to know every tech stack ever invented , switch from . NET to WordPress to Java in weeks, and deliver like a machine. No specialization, no growth тАФ just survival. YouтАЩre not learning a stack. YouтАЩre stacking stress. Oh, and promotions? bonuses? They act like the company is about to collapse during review season. But right after that? Back to hiring sprees like nothing happened. ItтАЩs the classic " mula in the next quarter" trick. DonтАЩt even ask about the HR department . Slow? No. ItтАЩs turtle on vacation level. But if youтАЩre from that one specific university and know how to do sanda oil , you're all set to chill there. Lunch? Provided. But you might question your life choices after eating it. Bonus? Comes three months late . Because... logic? At this rate, BS23 will soon be run by an army of adhu bhais , and trust me тАФ that ship is already halfway sunk. Unless they start respecting real talent , building up existing employees, and focusing on actual growth тАФ itтАЩs all downhill from here.

post_title: Optimizely CMP has the best culture and people
full_review: I work in CMP Product, which is the old Newscred team. Newscred always had the best engineering culture and team. I work with amazing people. No one needs to say things, we are like family; we are like family. We still keep in touch with old peers. People come to the office to meet, even people who left the office ages ago. The upper management and team will have your back when you are dealing with a family issue. Even though Optimizely has a leave policy due to some compliance issues, it was never a hassle to take time off when you needed it. Your manager and team lead will not even ask why you are taking leave. In cases where I needed to take leave, but sent a leave request to my manager later to handle some formality with HR. But people are so workaholic that sometimes managers ask them to take time off. You will get market market-competitive salary, even you can openly discuss your salary. If your friends getting better salary in other companies, you can bring this up to management. They will listen to your feedback and take actions accordingly. You will get very good increments over the year. There is no bootlicking or oiling for promotion and better payment, upper management is so much against it, you may red flagged if you try to do it. Promotions completely dependents your performance. The performance is measured by ones impact not just code lines count. In terms of engineering, you are going to get to work with cool and sophisticated technologies and an amazing engineering team. Sophistication comes with the architectural evolution of 10 yr old product. You are most welcome to a fierce engineering debate in terms of technology choice and system architecture. Great engineers and PMs from CMP gets some relocation opportunities, too. This happened with several amazing engineers and PM. Old newscred days, there are a lot more engineers than operations people in Dhaka, now there are a lot more ops people than engineers in Optimizely Dhaka. So the culture got a bit shifted and feels less like a software company. Optimizely Dhaka management has some good people take feedbacks into consideration to make it better workplace for everyone.

comments.comment_text: A very balanced and reasonable review.

post_title: Not a Paradise, But a Good Start
full_review: Left this company a few years ago, but I still believe it offers valuable opportunities to learn and grow in the fintech sector. Backed by a well-known parent organization in the international card industry, it provides exposure to innovative technologies and a strong foundation for building a career in fintech and payments. The team includes several highly experienced professionals in EMV payment systems, developing software for Nexus Pay and Nagad, both of which enjoy fairly good reputations. The benefits were decentтАФbetter than those offered by many other software companies. Salaries were paid on time, and employees enjoyed perks such as meals, snacks, monthly team outings, transportation, and more. I found employees friendly and helpful. While I've experienced some limitations during my time there, it's still a good place to work, IMOтАФespecially within the context of the Bangladeshi tech industry. It's not a dream workplace, but if you can balance your expectations with reality, it's a solid option worth considering.

post_title: Good Company. Disappearing Local Management.
full_review: To be honest I am happy with the company. But I genuinely felt that there is no point of considering this as a place of engineering excellence when most people here are junior engineers and all of the senior ones are leaving. If you are GenZ, this is a perfect place for you to learn and then eventually leave for Canada or EU. But also, this is not a good place for long term growth. Just ask why the average age is below 35 and you will understand that nobody with experience stays back here. The salaries are also only good till you are SWE II level. After that it's no longer competitive at all. The culture here is great. The hires are also mostly great except a few radical people (I have nothing against them but they have problems with anybody who isn't a follower of their cult or have different views). The reviews on Deshi Mula prove what I am saying to an extent. But I like that the company is very fast evolving and very willing to build new things. Not like Old SaaS. So what you work on will be cutting edge for sure.

post_title: Salary in dollar
full_review: Everyone said a lot of good things of cefalo. Those are all true. I have only one regret. With so much inflation and price of dollar getting higher, cefalo could easily can pay employees in dollars. At least, employees won't worry about price hike. Also, increments would actually feel like increments and we will feel more motivated. This will definitely make cefalo the hottest company in Bangladesh. Also one thing, where people complained about food. Yes, it is unintended that both of the cefalo coffee machines got broken and nescafe gold has almost stopped. But for other special food, it depends on so many people's requirements that even cefalo feels difficult to make it suitable for everyone. We recently had medical examinations conducted by Cefalo and a lot had fatty liver and cholesterol. So, if you also consider these, it is a big challenge. Nevertheless, the company is great, it cares and hopefully it can provide salary in dollars.

First thing you need to understand the following points:
1. Cefalo's revenue doesn't come in USD rather in NOK
2. A registered company in Bangladesh is bound to pay their employees only in BDT and only in Bank account. Other types of payments are fully illegal.┬а
3. Only a foreign company can make direct USD payment to external consultants or remote workers only. I┬а that case you will no longer be employed by Cefalo Bangladesh Ltd. and Bangladeshi rules/regulations/holidays/labor law etc. will no longer be applicable in such case.┬а

post_title: Hell. Batshit hell
full_review: If you ever want to get into this company, think like dr strange. Because one in 14 million scenarios, you might get out of this company with your career and honour. Management is extremely rude. No growth promised. All they believe is bond--- 10 years bond even if they spend zero on your training. If you think of resigning after seeing the batshit crazy MD and his robin aka s**** a** to treat all the stuffs as generational slaves, they will file a fake case on your name. They wanted to launch a gratuity scheme, asking its employees to put a certain percentage of salary in the gratuity fund. After several months the fund scheme had been scrapped off but the employees never got their money back. Zero career growth but eternal slavery for the fear of fake cases. They are land shark and a prominent player in gold smuggling busines. Think again before joining here

post_title: It was my first "Job"
full_review: App Coderz was the first job for most of the team members. We tried our best; we won sometimes, while we failed many times. The most amazing thing about App Coderz was the CEO . He was so gentle and soft and always inspired us to learn something. We failed, or someone failed. He always tried to keep his calm and move forward for a better future. Unfortunately, the journey ended last year. Now I am in a good place, with a good salary and a well-structured, productive team, but I genuinely believe App Coderz has made me what I am today as a content writer, as someone capable of finding the good side in every situation. Thanks a lot for making our lives beautiful and I loved my days at App Coderz. May Allah bless my boss and my co-workers.

post_title: Not an job just an labour work
full_review: In my experience, they hired me for a Playwright automation project. However, after a few days, the client decided not to continue the project. Following that, I was reassigned to a Mabl automation project. But just one week into it, I suddenly lost all access to my email and Slack accountsтАФwithout any prior notice or communication. It was a very unprofessional experience, as I was let go without any explanation or formal offboarding. Avoid this company if you value professionalism and job security.

Ekhono sure na je full salary paben kinaтАФmostly 30тАУ40% moto dey. Kaj bolte random bug fix kora, majhe majhe kichu feature. Learning bolte kichu nai. Salary onek kom. Eta ekta complete toxic environment. Respect nai, value nai. Shobai chole jete chay. Onno dike ora abar job post kore, but companyтАЩr kase current employee der salary deyar o taka nai. post_title: when developers become the product
full_review: COO often insulted people, he basically has no common sense about what to say and what not. CTO hallucinates like chatgpt. Everything they show online is just show. This was the most toxic environment I ever experienced. You will always be monitored through CCTV. COO has no work other than that. He complains to team leads if anyone uses phone during office time just like your teacher did your parents when you were in school. Work-life balance here felt like a joke. The breakfast break was just 15 minutes, but the CEO still seemed concerned about developers taking an extra five minutes to relax or chat during that time. He gathered everyone to remind them that J**n pays strictly for eight hours, not for the additional breakfast or evening snack time. As a result, he suggested increasing the office hours from nine to nine and a half, which might actually violate government regulations. Ironically, they didn't even compensate employees fairly compared to what they received from J**n for the standard eight-hour workday. During last Eid, they made employees come to the office and work despite it being a holiday, showing little regard for personal time. They could easily manage this leave. This isnтАЩt really an IT business; their actual product is the developers themselves. They treat developers more like products to display when J**n visits and are quick to lay off developers once John leaves. They have the audacity to fire you without any reason. The lack of career growth is apparent, with 3 senior developers around due to the absence of promotions or salary increases. On top of that, the lunch they provided was notoriously badтАФsome employees even found flies in their meals. Despite complaints, the management showed no interest in changing the vendor and instead seemed to ask for more feedback of the same kind.

full_review: The company's leadership, particularly the CEO, has been described as autocratic and disconnected from the technical aspects of the business. Employees report a lack of appreciation for their work, with management focusing solely on output without considering employee well-being. Unrealistic deadlines and last-minute changes are common, leading to a stressful work environment. Salaries at Bdgobs.com are reportedly below industry standards, with minimal increments and delayed promotions. Promises of profit-sharing and provident fund benefits often fall short, leaving employees feeling undervalued. The physical workspace lacks basic amenities, including clean restrooms and proper dining areas. Employees have also expressed concerns about excessive surveillance, contributing to a lack of trust and autonomy in the workplace. Opportunities for professional development are limited. The absence of experienced mentors and a structured growth plan hinders skill enhancement and career progression. The company enforces strict working hours, often requiring employees to work on weekends without adequate compensation. Policies regarding leave are rigid, with sick leaves requiring medical proof and casual leaves being difficult to obtain. While Bdjobs.com may offer initial exposure to the corporate world, potential employees should weigh the reported challenges against their career aspirations. Prospective candidates are advised to conduct thorough research and consider alternative opportunities that align better with their professional and personal goals.

post_title: Jail == Adventure Dhaka Ltd.
full_review: Nice workplace with a decent office environment. Good office lunch and snacks provided for employees. From day one, the company instills fear with constant threats of punishment, termination, or disciplinary action. Employees are monitored every minute, creating a suffocating, jail-like atmosphere. As a Japanese company, they view Bangladeshi engineers as low-cost labor, unable to afford Japanese engineers. Engineers are treated like garment workers, with little respect or regard for their humanity. The leave policy is highly intrusive and unfair. Sick leave requires prescriptions, or itтАЩs counted as unpaid. Employees must publicly justify leaves in a WhatsApp group, and HR publicly shames those who donтАЩt comply, forcing employees to prioritize work over personal emergencies. Office hours are strictly 8 AM to 5 PM, with a one-hour break for lunch and prayer. Any extra break time (even 5 minutes) must be compensated with overtime, with meticulous monitoring of every moment. The promised overtime pay is nearly impossible to obtain. Overtime is only recognized after working 2+ extra hours, rendering shorter overtime periods unpaid and unacknowledged. Salaries are delayed with no fixed payment date, sometimes arriving as late as the 6th or 10th of the month. Employees must submit monthly work reports to get paid, a rule not clearly communicated by HR. After 5 months of employment, I am experiencing mental trauma and pervasive negative energy due to the toxic work environment. The companyтАЩs teams in Japan and India, particularly the Indian team, dominate Bangladeshi engineers harshly, fostering a discriminatory and oppressive dynamic. Treat Bangladeshi engineers with respect as professionals, not as low-cost labor or slaves. Transform the workplace into a supportive environment, not a jail. Train HR to understand and respect the needs of engineering professionals.

post_title: Br0tec5 - From Promising Culture to Growing Challenges тАУ A Candid Employee Review
reviewer_role: Wellwisher Employee - Serving for a Long Time.
full_review: Br0tec5 once had a strong culture тАФ no politics, solid bonding, and some real talent. But recent internal changes are quietly eroding that foundation. The CTO needs to step in before more capable people leave and the companyтАЩs image suffers. Already, some тАЬfakibajiтАЭ local projects are about to onboard тАФ something unthinkable in the old Br0tec5. ЁЯФ╣ Overall Company Culture & Management Pros: Earlier, the culture was genuinely good CTO is a kind and well-meaning person Works with top-tier Fortune 500 clients Some teams still maintain healthy senior-junior dynamics Top management has an Islamic ethical mindset and has tried to uphold good values Cons: Office politics is growing across departments Management equates long office hours with productivity; remote work is often mistrusted Office space is extremely cramped тАФ feels more like a garments floor than an IT company, though some people think itтАЩs тАЬexcellentтАЭ Salary structure is average, though a few delusional juniors believe itтАЩs higher than GoogleтАЩs ЁЯШЕ Career growth is limited and often not merit-based Internal team rivalries are quietly encouraged over real collaboration Wrong people are promoted to leadership, killing motivation among skilled employees The growing mindset seems to be: тАЬThe company is running, so itтАЩll keep running тАФ quality doesnтАЩt matterтАЭ ЁЯФ╣ Team-wise Breakdown 1. Cloud Team Bad sides: Overloaded with seniors; many tend to show off Though juniors are being hired, the show-off culture hasnтАЩt changed Occasionally engages in blame games with other teams Good sides: Supportive to juniors Strong team leader who knows how to defend and support the team Decent overall team bonding 2. App Team Bad sides: Deep blame-game culture within the team Maximum Most-seniors are unqualified тАФ surviving only by shifting blame Acting like a тАЬseniorтАЭ and pretending to know things is often enough for a promotion Promotion is more about image, good relation with lead than real contribution Good sides: A few truly hardworking and talented developers still trying to push through Team is culturally humble and quite active socially (team outings, workouts, etc.) Outwardly, bonding within the team seems good 3. QA Team Bad sides: Technically the weakest team in the company Lacks automation skills тАФ mostly manual testing Leadership given based on flattery, show off and politics rather than merit Leads tend to be chosen because they speak more, act busy, and тАЬlookтАЭ like good managers тАФ but actually тАЬGhorar DimтАЭ Many members lack common sense in assessing issue priorities Time estimates are often dishonest тАФ lots of show, minimal actual work. Internal politics and favoritism are present Good sides: The team tries to maintain unity 2тАУ3 members are genuinely talented тАФ but they wonтАЩt grow unless they leave Juniors are tasked with most of the work, which at least gives them learning opportunities 4. IT & Management Bad sides: Too focused on rules, not enough on real productivity Over-regulated: emails required for basic requests, fines for minor device issues, etc. The new HR looks polished but lacks IT professional depth тАФ people can tell the difference Good sides: Top management has tried to maintain ethical standards CEO used to be very involved and kept things running well Recently, after the Management and HR expansion, there's been a visible power shift тАФ and the company has started to downfall ЁЯФ╣ Extra Observations In some teams, fixing a couple of UI bugs and talking smart is enough to earn a six-figure salary тАФ but real skill holders needs to hard -improve yourself in review room Just carrying a тАЬsenior vibeтАЭ can get you promoted тАФ no deep understanding or problem-solving needed The culture of chapabaji & telbaji > capability is quietly being normalized ЁЯФ╣ Advice to Management CEO should get directly involved again, like before Rebuild the old sense of family and fairness Promote based on skill, impact, and leadership тАФ not politics or image Stop rewarding those who only тАЬlookтАЭ busy Trust remote work and value output, not just time spent in the office Br0tec5 still has a chance to get back on track тАФ but only if these issues are acknowledged and addressed

post_title: Financial Criminal Operating from Bangladesh
full_review: Unlicensed Financial Activities: тАЬNe> Use of Custom VPN for Operations: Our tech department was tasked with developing and maintaining a Virtual Private Network (VPN) infrastructure. This was ostensibly required to bypass national restrictions and surveillance, enabling access to foreign financial systems and platforms. The necessity of a private VPN in this context was a significant red flag, suggesting efforts to evade detection by regulatory bodies. Non-Transparent Ownership and Capital Flow: There was a notable lack of documentation and transparency regarding the source of funds and investors. Payments were often made using untraceable channels or through third-party wallets and platforms, circumventing proper AML/KYC procedures. Suspicious Ties with Government Official: The company had unusually close and informal interactions with ICT State Minister Zunaid Ahmed Palak. These associations often extended beyond professional boundaries and were not documented via official channels. The frequency and secrecy of these meetings raised concerns about possible influence peddling or corruption. Behavioral Red Flags During Operations:

post_title: Money hungry management, bad work culture, nepotism
full_review: This company would be perfect for people who want to work 2-3 roles while being paid a minimal amount for a single job position. The management will always try their best, ABSOLUTE BEST to pay you the minimal amount. So, negotiate ЁЯСПЁЯП╗ negotiate ЁЯСПЁЯП╗ NEGOTIATE ЁЯСПЁЯП╗. DON'T SETTLE FOR LESS. The MD promises a whole bunch of "benefits" but realistically, you'll have no access to those benefits before a year and a half of working there. Add 3 more months for those who join as an intern. Don't count on company rules because those rules the employees have to abide by, will change in a minute if the MD decides so. On the subject of interns, "Treat interns as developers" said the MD. He expects production ready, 10/10 quality, fully functional code from interns. He will try his best to get a whole system coded by interns. Unrealistic deadlines for development will be set and you'll be pushed, berated to meet those deadlines. Nepotism is on the rise, thanks to the MD. Employees from a certain organization can get in with barely any interview process at all. Meanwhile, legitimate candidates will get through several interviews only to be rejected in the end. Go look at the LinkedIn profiles of people who joined in the last one year time period, you'll see what I mean. The company culture is sinking down in the gutter real fast. I have heard many tales of a "great culture". I have yet to experience it myself. We have no sick leaves, only 12 casual leaves this year. On top of that, 1 leave gets deducted for every 3 day late count (10:05 am is considered late. Office starts at 10 am). The only REAL pro of a job in this organization is, salary paid by 28th. Personally, I think this should be the normal standard but I'm trying to be positive here.

post_title: Good but deserves better
full_review: Pros: Standard or medium-range salary. Officially hybrid, though most employees work from home. Muslim-friendly office environment. Free in-office meals, including lunch, and snacks. No noticeable office politics or toxic behavior. The company organizes a big annual tour for employees and their families. Opportunities to work with the latest technologies and frameworks. Colleagues and management are friendly and always willing to help. The company covers the cost of personal vendor certifications and regularly hosts tech talks, training program and other activities. Cons: Despite being in business for 12 years, the company's growth has been disappointing (only around 140 employees). The work schedule often starts late in the morning, and employees tend to work into the late hours, which negatively affects work-life balance. While the company has one of the largest business development teams in the Bangladeshi tech industry, their outcomesтАФsuch as online presence, marketing efforts, and acquiring new clientsтАФdo not seem to be as impactful as expected.

post_title: What to and not to expect from Cefalo
full_review: Is cefalo a heaven? No, it is not. Like any other private job, it is not a permanent job. The company will care for you and give you flexibilities if you are dedicated to the company and to your role. All good things that was talked about Cefalo are true. There are some negatives vibes which I believe got explanations as well. But what should you expect and dont expect from cefalo? 1. Does cefalo care: Yes, it does. If you are sick and on leave they will keep on touch with you. You will get sick paid leaves. Is there limit? Yes, in paper. But they will show flexibility depending on your value to the company. It also encourages healthy work life balance. So it expects you to work 8h per day on average excluding 1h break. If client requests to work on weekends, you will get extra payment. 2. Is cefalo time flexible: Yes and no. If you don't abuse it and do your job properly it has no problem giving you that flexibility. For ex: we have flexibility for remote working 2 days per week. During this time, cefalo expects you will be available on office hour and clients can reach you. If you go to park or market and don't respond to your client, what should happen? Always be available to your client on slack or whatever medium you are using. If you are unable to join a meeting say that you will be available in few minutes or if you are in an emergency clarify that. You need to ensure that client is happy with you. 3. Does cefalo let go of employees: Cefalo always tries its best to keep their employees happy and keep them. But there are some factors which hinders it. Cefalo is a client centric company. So let's say you are hired for your special skills. But now the client went away. Cefalo will try to reintroduce you with another client. If it sees in the near future it can't, they will be direct with you and give you until your notice period to find another job. Sometimes clients complains about employees and if cefalo finds it true or employee isn't willing to change, then they will give you time until your notice period. Another thing is if cefalo told you to learn a different stuff because of client requirement (not too far away from what you know), but you are stubborn not to. Then if cefalo can't match you with existing or future clients in queue, they will give you time to look for another job until your notice period. 4. Will cefalo give me promotion based on experience and skill: This is the hardest thing to answer. It depends mostly on your client. If client is happy, you will get better raise. Salary is private but promotion is public. You also need to understand the depth of promotion. This is sometimes (as I am not part of management i can't say for sure but what i heard) used to get your appropriate value from the client. So if you are junior, but you are more valuable to the client, they will promote you. Promotion also means what client expects from you now and what you need to deliver. Cefalo gives promotion based on experience, client's feedback and your contribution (team mates will vouch for your contribution). So there are few factors here. Let's say you are experienced but you are not giving what the client wants or not doing as per client's requirements or not improving yourself, you may get promotion later and lesser increment. Are all clients good? The answer is no. Some can be stubborn, some may not what they want. But you need understand your role here. Your role is to give the best consultations possible based on clients requirements and domain. If client disagrees, still go with the client with a proper tone and finish your role. If you want to switch client or want different challenges, cefalo is always open to it and assign you one as soon as one is available. So you need to be patient with this type of work. 5. Does it always make the best decision: No. The initial decisions sometimes may seem difficult to comprehend. They do give a decision based on various inputs from different management but still it is not always good. But the best thing is that they are always open to hear from you and they can change their decision. The door to MD, EMs and Oslo Management is always open to hear your feedback. They know that if employees are not happy, the business wont survive. They constantly tell us that it is us that made Cefalo come this far. So for any query or explanation you can reach out to them. We also have some good colleagues and seniors, not officially part of the management but would stand up for us when they see anything unfair or some improvements can be done. So, if you keep yourself updated and do your job properly, you will be considered a valuable asset and cefalo will care. If not, cefalo will respectfully tell you that you are not fit for the culture. I think this same for all private companies. Your job is not permanent. You will need to grow your both tech and soft skills to reach higher. Don't take this job for granted and relax. Yes, it is a job with great work life balance compared to others. But at the same time, you have to keep yourself updated and worthy.

post_title: Toxic Leadership | Data Team
full_review: LetтАЩs stop pretending. The so-called "lead" of the Data Team has become a textbook example of what happens when the wrong person is given power. What we have is not leadershipтАФitтАЩs arrogance disguised as authority. No accountability, no emotional intelligence, and certainly no respect for colleagues. Everyday work has turned into survival under his ego. Intimidation is a strategy. Micromanagement is control. Favoritism is rampant. And respect? ThatтАЩs only reserved for people who choose to flatter instead of challenge. People arenтАЩt leaving the team because theyтАЩre weak. TheyтАЩre leaving because theyтАЩre sick of the constant disrespect, gaslighting, and dirty politics. Management knows. HR knows. Everyone sees it, but no one acts. Why? Is this the culture we are promoting nowтАФwhere toxic leadership gets a free pass? You can silence a few voices. But when an entire team starts speaking up, itтАЩs no longer a complaint. ItтАЩs the truth. Enough is enough.

post_title: Toxic Leadership, Constant Micromanagement & Zero Work-Life Balance
full_review: Looking for a workplace where meetings last hours but productivity dies in minutes? Where job titles are meaningless, HR is fictional, and the "CEO" is whoever shouts the loudest? Congratulations! youтАЩve found your match. Salaries are actually paid on time. If you're A$h!qтАЩs favorite, you might even get a nod of approval тАФ just before being publicly humiliated the next week. Work from home? Sure. But donтАЩt forget to attend 4-hour meetings and work on your weekend. Free of charge, of course. LetтАЩs start with the elephant in the room: According to the script, Ar!╞Т R@hm@├▒ is the CEO. Unfortunately, this man is more elusive than a unicorn тАФ no oneтАЩs seen him. Ever. In reality, A$h!q R@hm@├▒ calls the shots. But donтАЩt say that out loud тАФ he тАЬjust represents the stakeholders.тАЭ Cute. A$h!q is a masterclass in the DunningтАУKruger effect: high confidence, zero clue. Loves to micromanage every pixel while confusing control with competence. Need updates? DonтАЩt worry, A$h!m the Deputy Director-slash-Personal Assistant-slash-Update Beggar will ping you 15 times in 30 minutes. Because obviously, constant interruption equals progress. There is no SDLC, no documentation, no planning тАФ just chaos in bulk. Agile? Waterfall? No, we practice Tsunami тАУ wash away everything weekly and start again. Senior devs? QA leads? DoesnтАЩt matter. If A$h!qтАЩs chosen parrot reports something you didn't do (or did too well), youтАЩre out. Loyalty is measured by how many times you say тАЬYes SirтАЭ per day, not by actual skills. The HR department? Exists in theory. In practice, itтАЩs just a loudspeaker in human form who specializes in zero conflict resolution and 100% gaslighting. Want to learn? Perfect! YouтАЩll learn how to survive on 12-hour days, skip weekends, tolerate verbal abuse, and still be blamed for things you werenтАЩt told about. Real-life Hunger Games. The project knowledge is hoarded by a few тАЬspecial onesтАЭ like itтАЩs the One Ring. No knowledge sharing, no documentation тАФ just vibes and confusion. Stop pretending Arif is CEO тАФ at least own the dictatorship. Give A$h!q a break from тАЬrepresenting stakeholdersтАЭ and maybe send him to a leadership course. Or therapy. Remove the throne from under A$h!m and maybe assign him a calendar instead of a whip. Fire yourselves and start over. Give employees the basic dignity of structure, respect, and actual HR. No one is asking for magic тАФ just a little professionalism and fewer breakdowns. This place isnтАЩt a tech company. ItтАЩs a corporate reality show where power trips, micromanagement, and gaslighting are daily episodes. You donтАЩt build a career here. You build trauma. So if youтАЩre a masochist looking for a masterclass in how not to run a company, welcome aboard! Otherwise, run. Fast.

post_title: Unprofessional and Toxic Work Environment
full_review: I had an extremely disappointing experience at D0tp0t IT. The work environment was toxic, and there was a clear lack of professionalism from the top down. Despite my contributions, I was not paid my due salary upon resignation, which is a serious breach of employee trust and ethics. Moreover, leadership behavior was highly concerning. The CEO displayed inappropriate and unprofessional conduct, including substance abuse within the office premises тАФ something no employee should have to witness or tolerate. I strongly advise others to consider these issues before associating with this company.

post_title: Tired of Injustice and Nepotism in My Workplace
full_review: Sometimes it's not the workload that breaks you тАФ it's the sheer unfairness. I've been tolerating a lot of internal injustice at my bank. Whether it's favoritism, uneven workload distribution, or silent expectations to just тАЬadjust,тАЭ IтАЩve somehow kept going. But something happened recently that really shook me. A junior colleague, R@bbin@, seems to have her path paved by privilege. Her mother, who works at Bangladesh Bank, called in like a panicked guardian тАФ not for anything serious, just to ensure her daughter gets extra benefit or soft treatment. And what happens? My supervisor, clearly intimidated by the callerтАЩs position, bends over backwards. Even asked me to go easy on her. Just like that. Not because she earned it. But because her mother holds influence. I can take a lot тАФ but nepotism like this, where someone skips the line because of a phone call, while the rest of us grind in silence? That crosses the line. It sends a clear message: merit doesnтАЩt matter, connections do. I know this post wonтАЩt change the system overnight, but I needed to put it out there. post_title: Great learning for freshers, but management & work culture are a nightmare
full_review: Pros: 1. Steep Learning Curve for Freshers: If you're a recent graduate, you will get exposure to real-time projects from day one. This can be overwhelming but also offers a chance to rapidly develop your technical and problem-solving skills. 2. Hands-on Experience: You'll often find yourself working with new technologies and unique challenges, which helps build confidence and resilience early in your career. 3. Responsibility from Day One: While not always a positive, having full project responsibilities immediately does push you to growтАФsink or swim style. Cons: 1. HR Management is a Joke: Easily the worst HR experience. Policies are inconsistent, lack transparency, and often change arbitrarily. There's zero empathy for employeesтАФleave 10 minutes early and be ready to justify it the next day or fill it in later. Flexibility is non-existent. 2. Toxic Senior Developers (Worse than bad management): Some of the senior developers at Astha IT are not just uncooperativeтАФthey're actively toxic. They reject new ideas from juniors without even listening, stick to outdated or inefficient methods, and refuse to accept feedback. If a junior suggests a better solution, theyтАЩll shut it down just to assert dominance. ItтАЩs less about whatтАЩs right and more about whoтАЩs in charge. Worse, they humiliate juniors in team meetings making work feel unsafe and demoralizing. Constructive discussion is replaced by ego battles. Even if they make a mistake, theyтАЩll deflect it or dump the responsibility on someone elseтАФusually a junior who had no part in it. If you speak up, youтАЩll be the topic of backroom gossip. Some seniors go as far as to badmouth their teammates behind their backs ЁЯдг, creating a toxic, distrustful environment. There's a clear culture of favoritism and sycophancy. If you flatter the right people, youтАЩre safeтАФregardless of your performance. If you challenge the status quo, even respectfully, youтАЩre targeted or excluded. This environment is not only unhealthy but also deeply discouraging for anyone who wants to grow through open collaboration! 3. Strict and Irrational Timing: Zero flexibility. You're expected to clock in and out like a machine. Forget about a flexible or stress-free work culture. Deviate from the routine, and expect HR or seniors to hound you. 4. Micromanagement Culture: Rather than focusing on productivity or creativity, the company culture revolves around surveillance, blame-shifting, and rigid rules, maintain the time, senior will also involve if you are not filling the time ЁЯдг if you leave early. 5. Terrible Food: The food provided is of very poor quality. If you're a fresher looking to get your hands dirty with real work and can tolerate a toxic work culture just for the sake of learning, maybe you'll survive a year here. But long term? Not sustainable. DonтАЩt let the fake positive reviews mislead you!

post_title: Disappointed
full_review: My initial experience at the company during the first month was positive тАФ I was assigned tasks aligned with the role I was hired for, and the work environment seemed promising. However, over time, the situation changed significantly. There is a severe lack of work-life balance, and transparency is virtually nonexistent. Policies often shift without proper communication, and expectations are not clearly defined or consistently upheld. One major concern is the misleading nature of certain financial and role-related commitments тАФ agreements made during hiring or internally are often altered later without accountability. The notice period policy is also unreasonable. Even employees under probation are required to serve a two-month notice, which is highly unusual and restrictive. Additionally, getting approval for time off тАФ including sick leave тАФ is unnecessarily complicated and often discouraged. Employees are frequently expected to work on weekends and public holidays. Overall, it feels like employees are used primarily to meet project deadlines rather than being valued as long-term team members. Based on my experience, I would not recommend this company to others seeking a fair, transparent, and balanced work environment.

post_title: Industrial Attachment Scam тЭМ
full_review: Ami amar Industrial Attachment program er experience niye khubi hotosha prokas korte chai. Ekhane ja dekhte pelam: Industrial attachment er namee ebhabe marketing kora hoy┬а data center visit, professional class, etc. Kintu ashole eta shudhu chomok prod photoshoot chara ar kichui noy. Bishes kore, Sh* rif Ahs* n namok ekjon instructor niye amar onek obhijog. Uni relevant technical bishoy gulo ekdom bad diye shudhu motivation ebong photoshoot niye byasto thaken. Tini students der course outline related topics avoid koren, ar shudhu motivational boktrita diye dean ,ei course korle ei salary paabe, oi job paabe etc. Protidin photoshoot-e shomoy katano hoy, kintu real education er kichu i deya hoy na. Student der tin mash shomoy noshto kora hoy, ebong tader opor diye shudhui marketing er┬а photosession kora hoy. Notun students der khub shohoje manipulate kora hoy karon tader experience nei. Data center-e giye chobi tola chara shotti kono shikkhoniya jinis deya hoy na. Apnara jodi real skill shikhte chan, tahole ei institute ebong ei instructor ke avoid korun. Tobe jodi kono ambition chara shudhu majja korte ebong somoy katate chan, tahole apni ethane asshte paren.

post_title: All the good they built was undone by their shameless neglect of those they let go
full_review: !nfo1ytx had the potential to become one of the top-tier companies in Bangladesh тАФ offering a good work-life balance, learning opportunities, and an almost zero-toxic work culture. However, all of that has been overshadowed by their recent actions. Despite everything theyтАЩve built over the past years, they failed to provide layoff benefits for the last two months and instead created confusion and uncertainty for the affected employees. The promises made during this time were vague and insincere, completely undermining the credibility and goodwill the company once had. The salaries owed to the laid-off employees are not substantial тАФ especially for a company like ACI, which was involved тАФ yet the CEO of Infolytx proved to be a poor negotiator. His incompetence is evident: he couldn't bring any clients, collect dues from ACI, or stand up for his employees. The solutions developed by the tech team were exceptional and timely, but the CEOтАЩs inability to sell them rendered all that effort meaningless. He deserves an award for sheer incompetency. If you ever need a case study in failed leadership, look no further тАФ Badrul Husain embodies everything a CEO should never be: incompetent, indecisive, and indifferent to the people who built the company. Even companies known for toxic cultures typically uphold basic responsibilities like offering severance after a sudden layoff. What Infolytx's management has done is nothing but pure evil and injustices. No amount of good work culture in the past justifies such a shameful neglect of employee rights. If they had been honest from the beginning about their inability to pay the affected employees and had sincerely apologized, the CEO might have retained at least some respect from the team. But instead, they created uncertainty and made false promises. It has been over a year now, and there is still no trace of the money they promised. The management should be deeply ashamed of their actions.

post_title: A Mixed Bag for Developers, Great Perks, but Senior Dev Looks Elsewhere
full_review: 1) Timely Salary. Salary plus other financial benefits are decent, but on average 20-30% lower than other similar statured software companies. 2) Two yearly increment. Again 2 generally less than one increment from other similar statured software companies. 3) Fully subsidized lunch. Provided by catering. Catering does change a lot. So quality flactuates. 4) Office environment and sitting arrangement is good. 5) Flexibility in office timing and work from home opportunities 6) Good leave policies. Leave encashment is available for unused annual leave. 7) Office politics is at extreme level. Mogoj has a lot of employees, so to get promotion or decent increment you have to stand out. My first team lead said "ржирж┐ржЬрзЗрж░ ржврзЗрж╛рж▓ ржирж┐ржЬрзЗ ржкрзЗржЯрж╛ржи". So people try to stand out and also try to shit talk about teammates to managers to get ahead. Absolute shithousery in this aspect. 8) HR's make lot of promises. But rarely keep it. Can't rely on them or their words. 9) Lots of employees actually work from client's premises. In that case 3,4,5 is not applicable. Generally client's premises environment is horrible. 10) Medical insurance and provident fund. Insurance is upto 25k in a year. In case of any emergency I doubt that will help. 11) Good learning opportunities. Office will provide training material or pay for it. You have to convince your sbu head. Generally not that difficult. You can get great guidance from seniors if there's any in your team. 12) Project management is total lottery. If team lead is great, you will have good time. If not sorry for you. 13) There is lot of praise about mogoj that they don't fire employees. That's because hr will tell you to resign. No firingЁЯШБ Overall I will say, it's a mixed bag. In perspective of bangladesh, there are not many software companies that has the pros like them. If you are a senior developer, If you are decent at what you do, you will probably look at other similar statured companies and you will think why should not I go to those places and get paid 20-30% more ! Probably this is the reason why senior developers don't stay here. That is why Mogoj has a scarcity on senior resource. Blend of appealing benefits and frustrating realities. For junior developers, this can be a valuable stepping stone, but for experienced professionals, the lower pay and lack of senior retention make it hard to ignore better opportunities elsewhere.

post_title: "When Nepotism Runs the Codebase"
full_review: A Family-Owned Disaster Masquerading as a Tech Company 1. A Family Drama, Not a Company This company is essentially run by one family тАФ the MD, CEO, CTO, HR, CFO, all of them. If you're not part of the inner circle, you're treated like you're disposable. They micromanage every detail, expect availability during holidays, and behave as if they own your time and energy. 2. Salary? Delayed, Cut, or тАЬPendingтАЭ Forever Timely salaries are a myth here. Payments are irregular, often split in parts, and justified by vague "fund issues." Raises, when granted, are frequently withheld or delayed. While staff waits for months тАФ sometimes over a year тАФ to receive what theyтАЩre owed, leadership continues to spend on vanity projects and internal politics. 3. No Growth, No Respect, No Fair Pay Underpayment is standard across all levels тАФ whether you're a junior or senior. Long-serving employees are edged out for cost-cutting, and career growth is practically nonexistent. Promotions and learning opportunities are rare, replaced by a culture of favoritism and arbitrary decisions. 4. Total Chaos, No Real Management ThereтАЩs no structured planning or project management. Tasks change randomly based on someone's mood. One day you're praised, the next you're accused of slacking тАФ even with evidence to the contrary. ItтАЩs reactive, inconsistent, and ultimately a toxic work environment. 5. HR & Admin = Unprofessional and Unaccountable HR and Admin, managed by family insiders, are among the worst offenders. There's no formal policy тАФ only personal bias. Rules change daily, favoritism is rampant, and accountability is nonexistent. Instead of offering support, they often create more problems than they solve. Bonus: Run Now, Regret Later тАФ Trust Me If you're thinking of joining, think again. YouтАЩre better off elsewhere. The promise may sound good, but the reality is far worse тАФ chaotic, demoralizing, and unsustainable. Advice to Divine IT Management: If you're serious about turning this company around and building something truly sustainable: Pay salaries on time тАФ fully and consistently. Stop citing "fund issues" while continuing to spend in other areas. Replace the current HR team (especially family member) with qualified professionals. Create a fair, transparent HR policy тАФ and actually implement it. Hire an experienced CTO like Zubair Bhai or Abir Bhai, and give the current engineering manager the autonomy to lead without constant interference. Bring in real problem-solvers тАФ developers and engineers who can think independently, lead, and grow without being micromanaged. Appoint a capable COO and Business Development Head тАФ someone like Mr. Ashraf or the late Mr. Baharul (may Allah grant him Jannah) тАФ professionals with real experience, not just family ties. Replace the current System Head with someone who understands modern infrastructure, scalability, and sound system design. Treat employees with respect. They're people, not machines. Support them, listen to them, and value their time. Late hours don't always mean hard work. Rebuild a healthy workplace culture тАФ because right now, it's broken. Bring back the spirit Divine once had тАФ before 2020 тАФ when it felt like a place worth working for.

post_title: Life in a corporate jail
full_review: I worked there as MDS for over 1 and a half year. I will break it down to you that how they will suck the life out of you. You will always have to be present on time. Apnar jedin shift thakbe na oidin o apnake arekjon er shift er coverage dhoray dibe and you CAN NOT say No. Decline korle disciplinary action neyar threat dibe. Apnar bap ma ICU te thakleo minimum sympathy show korbe na. Infact, they will somehow try to convince you to come to the office. Ar apni ICU te thakle to they will ask for documents and prescriptions. Otherwise, leave approved hobe na and it will count as unpaid leave. Their management earlier used to be good. But, their current management only focuses on boot licking and how they can deduct salaries from their employees. What surprised me is that there is a female employee, who is not even a graduate was promoted as a MDS supervisor. No surprise, how she got promoted (extreme level of chatachati and benefits). Bottom line is, no matter how hard working and dedicated you are, or for how long you have been working with the company, chatachati korte na parle you will never be promoted, even you have a high chance of getting fired without any valid reason. The manager (takla) and lead MDS supervisor themselves are the biggest ass*oles and womanizers with zero empathy. Their educational qualification is also questionable like the female MDS supervisor I mentioned about, the only quality they possess is they speak good English. No wonder why their life revolves around Augmedix. If you are a woman with dignity and self respect, you should stay away from those creeps. You HAVE TO stay for 9 hours in the office no matter what. Even if you are done with your shift earlier, you can not take a breathe for a minute. Arekjon er shift er duties dhoray dibe and you have to oblige till you complete your 9 hours. And the entire time you mobile phone will be in locker. A proper corporate jail. Only pro about this company is you will get your salary on time. But their increment is about 5k only in every 1 and a half year. They used to have retention bonus of 1 lakh after completing 3 years. But they cancelled it last year. Thanks to the new clown management and the takla manager. If you are willing to sacrifice your self respect, good at chatachati, and willing to do kamlagiri 365 days (including eid and public holidays), then Augmedix is a perfect match for you.

comments.comment_text:
I don't agree with most of the things mentioned here.
> You will always have to be present on time.
You're working with foreigners and thus, you're supposed to be strictly punctual.
> Apnar jedin shift thakbe na oidin o apnake arekjon er shift er coverage dhoray dibe and you CAN NOT say No.
That's the employee agreement of working there. If you don't have any assigned work, then you'll covering for others.
> Ar apni ICU te thakle to they will ask for documents and prescriptions.
Providing documents is a MUST everywhere and it's a universal thing.
> If you are a woman with dignity and self respect, you should stay away from those creeps.
I don't believe women with dignity and self-respect choose Augmedix as their workplace in the first place and the management is well aware of this fact.
> You HAVE TO stay for 9 hours in the office no matter what.
Again, that's the working policy. That's what you're getting paid for.
> And the entire time you mobile phone will be in locker.
HIPAA compliance. no need to take it out on the Ops.
┬а

post_title: Company's name is "We11"Dev, but hardly cares about the "Well"-being of the employees
full_review: I will straight away get into the cons of the company that needs to be addressed. I will keep it simple and not sugarcoat things. People work here for money, as simple as that. They claim to be a multinational company, but have been disbursing salaries in installments. They have disbursed only half salary of the previous month and the other half is still pending. Similar incident happened few months back. They tried to compensate the situation by offering 25,000 taka to all the employees as a gesture of commitment to timely salary disbursement. But, nothing has changed since then. Even, the situation has worsened. Salary disbursement is being delayed until the 15thтАУ25th of the following month without any prior notice. Forget about getting the salary of ongoing month right before Eid. And festival bonus? how dare you ask about it? It's an illusion. The HR team are a bunch of clowns to be honest except the junior HRs. Their hiring process is an absolute joke and keeps circling all over social media how they take ages, sometimes over 3 months for hiring a candidate. They are already a laughing stock in social media. Clearly puts a question mark on their efficiency. The senior HRs somewhat seems like per*erts. They will stare and flirt with the female employees and make them uncomfortable. As if no one will notice or get to know. I have personally seen one of the Senior HRs sitting with a Junior HR in the cafeteria and talking for hours like a lovey-dovey couple. I noticed it for a number of days. Whereas we, the other employees work hard for hours just to see these supreme HRs getting paid for Cozy Dates at the office cafeteria. What an absolute joke of a team. ZERO PRODUCTIVITY. I believe the company's reputation will deteriorate day by day if these issues are not addressed as soon as possible.

post_title: If wants to Destroy Carrier go to Alin Food Products limited
full_review: Salary delays of up to 2 months , with no proper explanation or timeline. Employees are terminated without prior notice , often unfairly and without reason. Government holidays are not granted , and employees are expected to work without compensation. Toxic work environment , filled with pressure, fear, and unhealthy competition. Frequent misbehavior by senior staff and management тАФ including rude, insulting, or humiliating language . No action taken against those who mistreat others, creating a hostile and unsafe culture. Widespread dishonesty тАФ false promises, manipulated information, and broken commitments. Lack of job security , with no written clarity on roles, responsibilities, or duration. No final settlement after resignation or termination тАФ dues are not paid or even acknowledged . No respect for employee rights тАФ overtime, leave, and fair treatment are routinely ignored. Unprofessional conduct from HR and management тАФ employees are often disrespected or misled. Zero transparency in payroll, deductions, and internal decision-making.

post_title: Fantastic Company
full_review: I'm writing this review after seeing key-board warriors and bootlickers trashing the company, HR, Engineering Director unnecessarily. Like all companies, Opt!m!zely has some not-so-good things. Health insurance can be better, we do not have dental and vision coverage, increment is inconsistent based on departments. All public holidays are not covered. Does it mean it's a terrible company? NO. This same company supported us and did not deduct our salary when we could not work for over a week. My Manager called me to see if I'm okay. My colleagues in London covered for me. My friend in another company lost his job. If a holiday falls on a weekend, we get the next working day as a holiday. Engineering Director is new. It's normal for him to take time to get used to our tech stack and contribute. He's a social person, enjoys spotlight; our previous director did not. What is the problem? HR - sure there are questions on referral bonus. But are they all bad? NO. I was in urgent need of medical visa, I got one on the same day. I too thought 4-5 days for a document means they are incompetent, but one of them explained in a townhall the why. Clearly people do not listen. I wonder if Optimizely is everyone's first workplace. HR works on leave policy, salary, but they are not decision maker. Whenever I've reached out to HR, they were available and spoke with kindness. My previous company's HR was so shitty, maybe you do not know local company HR that's why you look for events and farewells from HR and do not see all the things they do right. I've found the HR team here very professional and doing their best. All the people talking shit -have you ever spoken with them or are you parroting what the sacked Finance Director and now bideshi Product Director filled your heads with. Engineering Director Bhai, you are intelligent. Maybe you mix with the fokinni gang because of limelight. Oita baad den, amra apnar theke shikhte chai. We respect you, please do not lose that.

post_title: ЁЯЪл Beware of Step Media тАУ Unethical Company Practices ЁЯЪл
full_review: ЁЯФ┤ Unpaid Salaries Most employees are owed 3 to 4 months of unpaid salary. This has become a regular issue, not an exception. ЁЯФ┤ Ridiculously Delayed Payments Even when they do pay, itтАЩs after the 20th or 25th of the month тАФ completely inconsistent and unfair. WhatтАЩs the point of a salary that doesnтАЩt come on time? ЁЯФ┤ Cash Payments тАУ No Banking Salaries are paid in hand cash , not through any official bank transfer. This not only lacks transparency but is also against standard corporate practice. ЁЯФ┤ No Salary Slips or Records Employees are not provided with any salary slips , so they have no documentation of what theyтАЩve been paid and when. ItтАЩs nearly impossible to keep track or raise disputes. ЁЯФ┤ Disrespect and Exploitation When employees ask for their rightful salaries , they are treated poorly , as if they're begging. Management shows no respect for their teamтАЩs hard work. ЁЯФ┤ Luxury for the Top, Struggle for the Staff While employees wait months for pay, the MD and DMD drive luxury cars worth crores . ItтАЩs shocking how disconnected leadership is from the people who keep the business running. тЪая╕П Final Word If you're thinking about working at St3p Media, please think twice . No job is worth sacrificing your dignity and financial stability. A company that doesnтАЩt value its people is not worth your talent.

post_title: Not perfect but still among the best
full_review: Is C3fal0 perfect? Absolutely not. C3fal0 has faced some criticism regarding its culture in this platform which is surprising. Very few companies in this country can match the culture of C3fal0. I personally feel that the negativity C3fal0 receives from some employees is not deserved. When you work in a company, interpersonal issues may arise. The best way to deal with them is by being open and discussing them - not by bashing your colleagues on anonymous platforms. In all my years at C3fal0, I have never felt unwelcome when expressing my views to my colleagues, especially the management. The Oslo management has also been equally supportive. Perhaps we should be more open about our concerns and work to solve them together, rather than posting anonymously and avoiding our responsibilities. That said, C3fal0 does have some issues , particularly around the evaluation process, which seems like a mystery to many. ItтАЩs creating a lot of friction, and hopefully, C3fal0 will address this matter soon. Peace тЬМя╕П

post_title: Is it the place someone should stay in for more than a few years?
full_review: The sky's the limit here. If you play your cards right, youll get to learn a ton of things here as an Engineer. From Software to Infra, the expertise here is mind boggling. Knowledgeable people all round. If you are a new grad, sorry to burst your bubble but I stand with the CTO here that work-life balance should not be your priority right now. You must give your all to learn what there is to learn and extract as much real-world knowledge as possible from the highly experienced people here. Both foreign and domestic. Communication is the one soft skill that is highly appreciated and lets you grow beyond your immediate team bubble. You MUST engage with your collegues and management if you want to be valued here. High salary blah blah, you've seen the other reviews and the list of cons that come with that. I'd like to highlight a few things though: CTO is "sad" about it. Does nothing. And gave false assurances. Big mistake. No one believes his assurances anymore regarding management decisions. The level of respect he has for his huge depth of technical knowledge is tarnished by poor management decisions. (Him being a core founder has a lot to do with it) Another conscious decision that is constantly being talked about in the office these days along with delayed salary and has lead to low morale and concerns regarding company future. We are joking around now, but people have started looking elsewhere to find more stable companies. Yeah it seems like leads feel uncomfortable vetoing stupid management decisions. Planning week? Its a joke. Its frequently suggested to us by the CTO that team leads decide on things to do and plan according to the capabilities of engineers under them. But nahhh. No one believes that crap. Decisions are top down and sudden. "Need this now because CEO wants this " is very common and everyone's life is made shorter trying to push those deadlines. Most of Planning week is spent trying to finish last 2 week sprint's work. Bootcamps at Jashore? Literally makes you work from morning to midnight, sometimes for a week or two. WITHOUT any additional compensation. What the hell?? And that too, not for some imminent threat to business, but just because they can? Are leads making the decision here? Nope, its all CEO and CTO and some other folks. And they laugh about it during sprint meetings. Yeah, no one outside of management is laughing. They are bitching about you and your lack of compensation and delayed salaries. Yeah, no one will ever buy your " We dont work like other companies who gives lots of leaves and are really slow to achieve anything ". That doesnt make the company a fast moving one, just makes it what it is: 12 something years in and still having cashflow issues? Its understandable, really, we can have bad periods, but cmon, lets stop with with this fancy " we are better than others " business and just allow your employees some basic time offs that almost all white collar job holders IN BANGLADESH enjoy. Stop aligning yourself with the US holidays, being a company in BD. Act like a company in BD . You are not achieving any major business goals other than constantly disgruntled and abused and demoralized employees who will eternally hate your leave/holiday policies and your disrespect of work-life separation. Domestic Engineering managers and leads also have no option but to push/ask juniors to work overtime to avoid upper mangement disapproval. Literally everyone i've talked to who left Chaldal Engineering, see it as a relief when it comes to having a life outside of work . That says something about how traumatizing and deeply flawed the culture is. Is that really the kind of culture you want to keep around? The CTO is a workaholic and understandably so, he's a founder and in general a super-talented geek. But he should dial his expectations down when it comes to his overworked engineers who dont get to spend holidays with family. The company is a PLC now. Shares were promised, I assume as a way to align the engineers more with the company goals, where are those? HR is one of those resources that should be working for the employee interest rather than against them. And in here, HR is a joke. Filled with people who are used to constantly hiring, fining, firing,┬а warehouse folks. Not one engineer thinks we should have to share the same policies as the warehouse folks. We understand (and also are against some of) the limitations and policies that have to be in place for ground staff. But as an engineer, in an engineering focused company, we shouldn't be held to the same standards and policies, but rather be on par with other engineering-focused/engineering companies. There are a lot of exceptions made for engineering just because CTO is a co-founder. And it is genuinely appreciated. But this is also the "norm" in other engineering companies outside and not the exception, so while its appreciated, a lot of talented individuals had to leave the company/were about to leave the company for them to consider these. And the pessimist in me thinks more people need to set their boundaries for management to consider any meaningful change. The reason i'm giving a mixed review is because after all of these, you get to grow a lot here and be solidly prepared for an engineering life with confidence that you're so traumatized, most things outside you can handle. Be it Google or Amazon or any other company, foreign or domestic, you can carve your space with confidence if you want and if you focus, your communication skills would improve due to the english-focused management. So as it stands now, Cha1da1 is one of the best place to start your career . Not sure about the rest. Not sure if management even wants to build a loyal, genuinely content, long-term employees with deep interest in the company future. Or we are just contractors, needed for a few years, until the next batch of fresh grads come.

post_title: Great people. Great place to work. Terrible last month.
full_review: I don't want to say much because I have already left this company (thankfully) and have a much better role elsewhere. I miss Optimizely and all of the people there. Honestly, I do. I loved the work. I loved the engineers, the pms, the sales teams, the solutions guys, the commercial people, and even the support team. I see all of these complaints on DeshiMula and I can't vibe with them because back in our times, they were not there. But I also hated it the last few months. The way HR spoke to me once I told them I am planning to leave still has my ears ringing. The way they forced me to resign even though I had already communicated in advance that I am waiting for an update on something and would resign later. The way a guy on their team was absurdly rude to me. The way I could not even ask a question about the financial issues. The way they asked me to sign paperwork then and there immediately almost as if I am a criminal for deciding to accept a better offer. The way they weren't giving me a release letter and were chilling in some other country when it was important to me. I will never forget that. It was odd how HR suddenly turned on me the moment I told them I found a better role! There was no proper exit debrief (shouldn't that be standard?) or else I wouldn't be writing it here. But I was hurt. And I will carry that feeling forever that this company treats you like shit once you leave. Just speak to some other people who have left and you will understand. Some of the guys who were in newscred had it different. It wasn't the same experience for us. Man, it wasn't even my manager. It was a bunch of sore losers who didn't even know me properly. I just wish I was in a financial position to throw the money in your face and walk away instead of having to go through that.

post_title: A note of gratitude
full_review: It was the company where I started my career as a fresher. To be very honest, my experience with this company was truly great. The environment was friendly, they always encouraged the little things, celebrated small achievements, valued employee opinions, and maintained transparency. I still remember the days when I worked there. My parents were going through several health issues, and The TL, other seniors and even the CEO (Ron bhai) personally kept in touch with me to check on their condition. He even offered help to arrange my motherтАЩs check-up abroad, online! This is what i call the beauty of a good workplace. IтАЩm not sure about the current situation there. One thing I did feel was that the salary was a bit low compared to the current market standard. I also gave some feedback when I left. There were a few other things to mention, but I wouldn't call them "major." They were still a new company with limited resources, so I believe some of the challenges came from that. Perhaps not all resources had adapted to the positive culture yet. There were many perks too (you can find them on their JD) To be very frank, this place showed me what "good culture" and "employee value" truly mean. IтАЩm currently working at other companies, but IтАЩll always be grateful to them for introducing me to "the culture of a truly employee-friendly company." IтАЩve been seeing a lot of complaints about the HR recently, which made me a bit sad and confused based on my own experience. So, I felt the need to share my honest review here. I have so many good memories. IтАЩll always wish you all the best. Advice: Please give proper attention to the salary structure, and also seriously consider the complaints you're currently facing.

post_title: No Growth, No Standards, No Future тАУ My Time at 2SL Wireless
full_review: I worked at 2SL Wireless, and it was the worst company I have ever experienced. The system analysts there donтАЩt have any knowledge of the latest technologies. Even when junior developers want to implement something new, they reject it. They are very old-school, not open to change, and unwilling to learn anything new. They donтАЩt follow any standard processes, especially in API development. For example, every API response is returned with a 200 status code, regardless of the actual resultтАФthey donтАЩt follow proper HTTP status code conventions. I want to mention a few system analysts who destroy developer motivation. Developers do all the work, but these individuals take the credit: M****, A***, N*****, and R****. They donтАЩt do any real work and spend most of their time gossiping. There are no benefits other than the salary. The yearly salary increment is very low and not based on performance.

post_title: C0ward CEO of We11Dev hides until he pays last month's salary 10 to 20+ days late
full_review: In the last 12 months, the salary was given on time only once in We11Dev. The CEO provided only half salary to the local employees (who don't earn in dollars due to having salary less than 1000 USD) on 12th May. Today is 22th May and the other half has not been paid yet. The ones who get more than 1000 USD, their salaries get delayed regulary more than the local salary and they haven't even gotten half salary. Just before paying the first half, one C-level employee (If you can't manage the payroll, resign please) sent a message to the Bangladesh-only members channel saying that he UNDERSTANDS the frustration and trully APPRECIATES our patience. Stop with your monthly whining about how you regret "not being able to provide a clearer picture". Always with the same whining when everyone becomes impatient without receiving their salary. They do not even communicate properly that the salary will be late. And most of the time, the reason is "technical difficulty from the Switzerland bank's end". WTF do you mean? And when the salary is finally given, the CEO finally crawls out of his tiny hole to set up a "General Meeting" where he does not acknowledge the fact that 90%+ of his employees are not receiving salary even after 15+ days. He basically preaches on these calls. Last January, he promised to fix this when he came to Bangladesh. He compensated (bribed) all Bangladeshi employees 25,000 TK and said that this will not happen again. But, he blamed the clients saying that they did not pay the company. And this delay is only seen on the Bangladesh side. The other guys from Switzerland, Canada, and Austria get paid on time (AFAIK). That is why the shameless apology messages from that C-level employee is sent only on the Slack's Bangladesh-only employee channel, every month. Give salary on time, or at least, pretend to try.

post_title: A Year of Change: What IтАЩve Really Seen Inside AGT
full_review: I joined the company 11 months ago, back when it was still in its early stages. Things were a bit rough around the edges at the time тАФ as youтАЩd expect from any new company тАФ but IтАЩve seen consistent improvement in how processes are handled, how communication flows, and how the overall structure has matured. I applied directly through their HR link without any referral. Shortly after, I got a call to schedule an interview. One area that could be improved: I received that initial call at 9 PM, which is quite late тАФ HR could definitely be more mindful about contacting candidates during reasonable hours. Interview Experience: The interview itself went well. I was nervous and stumbled over some answers, but the interviewer was incredibly kind and understanding. He could tell I was anxious and even gave me a moment to breathe and collect my thoughts. That kind of empathy during interviews is rare these days and really stood out. Onboarding: The onboarding process involved the usual background verification steps тАФ nothing unexpected. I was later asked to take a final call with management on a weekend, but I had family commitments and requested to reschedule. Again, scheduling could be improved, but they were flexible and understanding once I asked. In the final call, the manager took time to ask how my day was going and provided detailed feedback on my interview and areas for growth. It felt like a genuine conversation, not just a formality. Work Culture & Benefits (based on my experience): Unlimited sick leave Fully remote (thereтАЩs an office, but in-person engagement could be more frequent) 14 days PTO тАФ would love to see this increased, especially for those based in Bangladesh Up to 100% bonus based on performance No formal festival bonus Equipment reimbursement (40k BDT тАФ available post-probation) Probation period feels long; could be shortened Monthly trivia contests with 10kтАУ20k BDT cash prizes Paid interviews Overtime is paid at 1.5x the standard rate Management communication has been consistent and respectful in my experience Addressing the Negative Feedback: IтАЩve seen some negative posts lately, and while everyoneтАЩs experience is valid, I genuinely havenтАЩt had those issues. The company sends out monthly anonymous surveys where anyone can share feedback directly with leadership. If youтАЩre facing challenges, I encourage you to use those tools and voice your concerns constructively. Posting frustrations in public forums might feel like an outlet, but it doesnтАЩt lead to meaningful change. If you want something addressed, let upper management know directly тАФ from what IтАЩve seen, theyтАЩre open to feedback and willing to take action when somethingтАЩs not working. To sum it up: this is still a┬аyoung company finding its rhythm, but itтАЩs come a long way in just a year. IтАЩve personally felt supported, respected, and heard. That may not be everyoneтАЩs experience, and thatтАЩs okay тАФ but I wanted to share mine.

post_title: AGT ei ekta lesson chhilo life e
full_review: Shobai review dey jokhon ora job ta peye jai. Ami chaitesi ekta alada story bolte тАФ ekjon jini peye-o rakhte pareni. Shuru te boro boro plan chhilo тАФ Slack e vibe onek bhalo chhilo, mentor ra reply diten timely, ekdin to Smash Karts o kheltam team er shathe. Pure fun chhilo oi night ta. But, ami ekta boro bhul kore felli тАФ modules e full focus dite parini. Amar chhilo onek distractions, r 2 bar ami warning paisi je ami module timely submit kortesi na. post_title: Ghosting on hiring
full_review: After getting shortlisted, I went to their on-site interview. They have a junior HR named K****r D*s who doesn't seem professional at all. However, even though my interview went well and they told me that they would contact me soon with the next step, guess what? They never did! Point to be noted, even though they gave a strict, tight schedule for the onsite interview, they started my session 39 minutes late. They are not punctual enough themselves. However, the interviewers were very decent, professional and overall very good, I must say! They mentioned that if the work isn't done, then there's no ending time for the day! That means they can make you do overtime without paying for it. This type of ghosting mentality towards the candidate after the onsite interview isn't appropriate. Sending a generic email to all the candidates doesn't take more than 3 minutes. You should understand that the candidate also needs to maintain some aspects in terms of time and making decisions, right? As the candidate comes to your office for an onsite-interview even though you take the interview late, they can expect a reply in email according to your policy. This is the least you can do to honour everyone for coming there. Also, you guys never ask any candidate whether they need anything, like water, the way to the washroom, etc. You guys eat in front of them casually (I know this might be normal). However, there is a thing as basic courtesy. If you keep eating whatever you want in front of newly arriving candidates, then either you should do your eating in another room or at least offer them a glass of water or something as a courtesy (in most cases, the candidate might request water, nothing else). I expected professionalism and punctuality in your behaviour, but unfortunately didn't see any. Only the three interviewers were good and professional.
