post_title: The Downfall of a Department тАФ Caused by One Person
full_review: I have been a part of Pa7ha0тАЩs marketing department for over 3 years now. IтАЩve had the opportunity to work under various managers in my career, and throughout this time, IтАЩve truly appreciated PathaoтАЩs culture and values. However, what once felt like an admirable workplace now often feels like a daily struggle тАФ and the reason, unfortunately, lies in one toxic individual: my brand head. Let me be clear тАФ our marketing department head is someone I respect deeply. He is wise, strategic, and genuinely invested in our growth. IтАЩve felt valued whenever he directly engages with me and conducts meetings with my team, offers insights, and encourages growth for my service vertical. But this sense of value is quickly shattered by the toxic leadership of the person leading Brand. Despite having several years of work experience, our lead consistently displays insecurity, power abuse, and emotional instability. She often prevents us from collaborating directly with senior leadership, fearing it might undermine her control over us, brand subordinates. Rather than empowering her team, she chooses to dominate and belittle. She lashes out over the smallest issues, often screaming in meetingsтАФ sometimes so loudly that it echoes through our entire floor. She insults managers infront of us juniors, which is humiliating for them, and as well as for us to witness such toxicity. During campaigns, she severely messes up and blames us for it. She will assign us unrealistic deadlines without much direction on what needs to be done, and then attack us for not fulfilling the output she expected. She will commit projects to higher ups, without aligning us and then blame her own misalignments within our own team, when we are unable to deliver to the external stakeholders. Then she will present us, even the most skilled professionals, to be incompetent. Her leading our team is based on fear and humiliation, not guidance or support. Behind peopleтАЩs back, she mocks and criticizes everyone, be it the CEO or VP or any colleague senior or junior. Yet to their faces she maintains a false charm, with her fake smiles and deceiving tactics. She formed our work group titled тАЬPeacekeepersтАЭ тАФ ironically, she is the biggest threat to our peace of mind. While we work weekends and holidays by her forced orders, she spends that time partying, having fun and posting stories we send тАШloveтАЩ reacts to. As a result тАФwe do the hard work, she takes the credit for it infront of top management. She regularly boasts to other departments that тАШmarketing departmentтАЩ canтАЩt achieve anything, itтАЩs a failure department, and that ┬аwithout her we cannot do any projectтАФ yet spends more time demoralizing us than building us up. If she finds our office so horrifying, why is she still here with us for over 2 years? If someone doesnтАЩt follow her absurd instructions, she says, тАЬTui korbina? Onno manush diye kore feli tor kaajтАЭ, no matter if youтАЩre a manager or executive, we are treated as slaves by her rather than educated corporate professionals. These constant threats of replacement have us severely demoralized and demotivated. Several team members have taken their concerns to HR and higher ups, yet no action has ever been taken against her. SheтАЩs heavily protected because she goes clubbing with them. She faces no consequences for mistakes at all, and wasting our companyтАЩs big budgets. Once a female executive from PMT resigned after repeated verbal abuse from her. One of our talented senior designers left due to her abusive tone and attitude towards the design team. The brand team has seen mass exits after her arrival and fresh hires were from her own cohorts. The pattern is undeniable, yet overlooked with excuses. To cover up her damage to us, she provides us with superficial тАЬteam bondingтАЭ gestures тАФ gifts, drinks, casual outings. But beneath that, she resents anyone smarter or more capable than her and continues her tyranny with us. She body shames our male/female colleagues and told one of my team girls to dress better and wear makeup тАФ a humiliating remark, especially coming from someone who claims to champion womenтАЩs empowerment on her socials. Her hypocrisy runs very deep! At the beginning of this year, she posted her new year resolution as: тАЬDonтАЩt let your ego stop you from communicating with empathyтАж Power shouldn't come at the cost of someoneтАЩs dignity.тАЭ But every day, she conducts office in the opposite way тАФ threatening our team with arrogance and cruelty. She canтАЩt control her tantrums and bad temper at her workplace at all. And humiliates us in unimaginable ways. Her LinkedIn is filled with posts like: тАШFor me, multitasking isn't about doing everything at once-it's about knowing what to prioritize, staying adaptable, and keeping a cool head.тАЩ But none of it reflects in how she practically functions as a professional. In reality, she canтАЩt keep a cool head herself, nor smoothly run multiple projects, nor lead us in the proper direction. I am speaking up, in the hopes that there is a change. The department is suffering. Morale is low. Growth is stunted. One personтАЩs unchecked toxicity is ruining the entire departmentтАЩs success. ItтАЩs time someone takes this seriously тАФ for the future of PathaoтАЩs brand.

post_title: A Company Built by Its People Deserves Better.
full_review: I have recently come across several posts on DeshiMula. Initially I was not following them very closely. It is not that I am indifferent. I just did not have the time or energy to go through everything being said. However I do appreciate the purpose of this platform. Giving professionals a voice and allowing them to reflect on their work experiences is a valuable initiative and one that deserves recognition. Regarding Opt!m!zly I want to start by saying that no company is perfect. Every workplace has its strengths and weaknesses. I have read a number of the recent reviews and some of them make fair points. Constructive feedback is important and when offered with good intent it can help leadership identify areas for growth. Whether or not those insights lead to actual changes is up to the people in charge. What pushed me to write this post is not disagreement with criticism. It is the way some of the criticism has turned personal. It is disappointing to see posts targeting individuals with hostility. Many of the people being criticised have spent years building the very environment we now benefit from. I have had the chance to interact with some of them both professionally and informally. Despite their seniority they have always treated me with respect and made time to support when needed. That level of professionalism deserves to be acknowledged. Of course nobody is perfect. Not the leadership. Not the employees. Not me either. We all have flaws and yes we all sometimes complain or gossip. But there is a difference between sharing thoughts with a colleague and publishing personal attacks on a public platform. If someone genuinely caused harm by blocking a promotion or creating a toxic experience I hope that it was addressed with a manager or through HR before being made public. If not then it raises the question of whether the goal was improvement or just public venting. Life is always about trade-offs. To offer an analogy consider the residential area of Bashundhara R A. It has many challenges. Some say there are not enough mosques. Others mention the distance to grocery stores or the nearby university students' lifestyle that might not appeal to everyone. Still many people choose to live there. They might have a child studying in a nearby school or university. Or maybe it is closer to work. Or maybe it provides a better security then other areas. And those who cannot adjust simply move somewhere else. No one forces anyone to stay. The same applies to workplaces. If the culture or environment does not suit someone they have every right to leave. But leaving with grace is very different from trying to tear down what remains. Especially when others still work there and appreciate what has been built. Opt!m!zly is a global company. We work with colleagues from a wide range of cultures religions and personal backgrounds. Naturally there will be differences in lifestyle and beliefs. But our purpose here is not to push personal ideologies. It is to perform learn grow and contribute within a global professional setting. I also want to point out something important. The job market is connected in more ways than we often realize. When someone speaks negatively about their workplace online it creates an impression that may follow them. If I were hiring and I saw a organization name associated with public hostility towards from their employees, I would hesitate and think carefully before bringing that person into my team regardless how talented that person is. Talent is valuable but team culture matters too. I am not defending every decision made by leadership. This message is not about taking sides. It is simply a call for professionalism and perspective. Respect your workplace. And if it does not feel right anymore seek opportunities that align better with your long term goals. Do it with maturity. To the leadership team at Opt!m!zly both past and present I want to say that there are many of us who see your effort and dedication. We may not always say it out loud but your contributions are noticed and appreciated. To everyone reading this I hope this comes across in the spirit it is intended. If I have unintentionally offended anyone that was not my intention. I am simply offering a viewpoint from one professional to another. Wishing you all continued growth and success in your careers and lives.

post_title: DonтАЩt Let Anonymous Noise Define Reality
full_review: Let me start with this: Anyone can post anything here. No verification, no fact-checking, no accountability. ThatтАЩs what this platform allows тАФ and while it gives people space to speak up, it also opens the floodgates for personal attacks, fake reviews, and straight-up lies. That one review going around about the SQA lead? Come on. You donтАЩt have to be a detective to guess where itтАЩs coming from. Ekhane jodi keu truly kaaj kore thakto, tader tone onek balanced hoto тАФ not full-on personal rage and unverified drama. If you had genuine feedback, youтАЩd go through a proper channel, not write a hate post IтАЩve been part of this company long enough to know that not everythingтАЩs perfect тАФ but jader theke feedback ashe, ora at least specific hoy. Ei dhoroner тАЬX person is a moronтАЭ type post bolbe na. Real talk: Ei forum e verification nai. Ami-o ekhon ekta review post kortesi тАФ amakeo keu verify kore nai. So letтАЩs not use this platform as the judge, jury, and executioner. Company te jodi problem thake, monthly surveys ache, HR ache, escalation path ache тАФ use those. Bhai, ei shob personal grudges diye review likhle company r naam na dube тАФ amar, apnar, shobar naam dube. We all work in the same industry. If any future company wants to come to BD with their offshore jobs, things like this will deflect them. If you didnтАЩt make it in the company or got removed for performance, boro manush er moto accept koro. Next e better koro. But ei type namer opor attack kore kichu hobena тАФ it makes you look worse, not them. And letтАЩs talk about Syed for a second тАФ I personally worked with him. HeтАЩs one of the hardest workers IтАЩve seen. He taught the team tools, set up reporting systems, and handled responsibilities that clearly rolled up to a QA Lead level тАФ responsibilities that IтАЩm pretty sure most of you never even got exposure to. He works efficiently, helps others without hesitation, and brings nothing but positivity to the team. If you think thatтАЩs a problem, thatтАЩs on you тАФ but IтАЩve seen the kind of person he is, and heтАЩs genuinely one of the most wholesome and capable people in this company. Take your petty drama somewhere else. And seriously тАФ kon team e layoff nai? In a team of 3, if 1 person is let go for performance or alignment reasons, how does that automatically mean the whole company is a mess? By that logic, every org in the world is a disaster. LetтАЩs be real, numbers matter, context matters. I donтАЩt know who needs to hear this: Grow up. Move on. Do better.

post_title: We11Dev: A Toxic Playground of Incompetence
full_review: LetтАЩs be realтАФWe11Dev used to be a decent place to work. Now? ItтАЩs a dumpster run by clueless management whoтАЩve turned it into a stress factory. The more people they hired, the worse it got. The culture? Gone. The environment? Hostile.The morale? Dead. #Salary? More Like "Maybe Later" Getting paid on time here is like winning the lottery, except you already earned it, and they just canтАЩt be bothered. Employees have to beg for their own salaries while management acts like itтАЩs no big deal. Unprofessional? Absolutely. Disrespectful? You bet. # Fresher Exploitation: The We11Dev Special Their entire business model? Hire cheap, burn out fast. They bring in fresh grads, give them two months of training, then throw them into client projects. Why pay for one skilled senior when you can overwork three clueless juniors. And donтАЩt even get me started on salariesтАФitтАЩs a mess. Some juniors earn more than mid-level engineers because fairness doesnтАЩt exist here. Promotions? Based on who the client likes, not skill or effort. #Senior Devs = Company Slaves If youтАЩre a senior here, good luck. Management will pile on impossible deadlines, ignore your workload, and expect you to work miracles. Work-life balance? LOL. YouтАЩre expected to sell your soul just to meet their unrealistic demands. #HR: The Joke That Writes Itself The recruitment process is a circus. HR schedules endless interviews, wasting everyoneтАЩs time, then hires based on who knows what. The HR manager? A walking disaster. His English is so bad, even Google Translate would cringe. HeтАЩs late every single day but loves lecturing others about punctuality. This personтАЩs brain operates at the speed of a rusty bicycle wheel. You ask a simple question, and he just... freeze. His face goes blank as his overworked brain cell struggles to process even the most basic logic. By the time he finally spit out a response, youтАЩve already aged five years, and whatever he say is usually nonsense anyway. Female employees avoid him because who knows what weird, inappropriate nonsense heтАЩll say next? # Meet the Leadership (If You Can Call It That) - The COO тАУ Thinks heтАЩs a genius. His quarterly reports? Pure fiction, like he and his team members generates them after getting high. He use to provide lame level of problems to the candidates in order to make hiring decision. - The Deputy COO - A high school mean girl with her own gossip squad. They stalk employees, waiting for someone to fail so they can laugh about it. - The CFO тАУ Master of empty promises.┬аSays sorry more than he says hello. His finance team? Zero emloyee engagement. Employees don't even know some of their names and they hide behind glass walls like a secret cult.┬а Friends with management people or from the same religion, congratulations, you are hired in Finance or HR team. - The QA Lead тАУ Does zero actual QA work. His favorite place in the office are gaming zone and CFO's room. He spies on employees, plays table tennis for hours and hours, and snitches to the CFO. - The CEOтАУ Ignores every problem while forcing Bible verses on Muslim employees like some self appointed prophet. Tone deaf and arrogant. - Job satisfaction? Non-existent. - Work environment? Toxic. - Salary? Late and unfair. - Management? Incompetent and cruel. - Benefits? A bad joke.

post_title: We11Dev's Financial Failures: When Paychecks Become Optional
full_review: Forget everything you've heard about professional workplaces - We11Dev has rewritten the rulebook on how to mistreat employees. Over the past year, they've established a disturbing pattern of financial negligence that would make any respectable company blush. After particularly egregious delays earlier this year, management attempted to buy silence with a one-time 25k BDT "goodwill payment" while making hollow assurances. Predictably, nothing changed. This isn't about cash flow problems - it's about priorities. The fact that certain offices always get paid on time proves We11Dev could fix this if they cared to. Instead, they've chosen to treat Bangladeshi staff as second-class employees, maintain a culture of broken promises, hide behind pathetic excuses rather than solve problems, prioritize preaching over payroll. Any company that can't master basic payroll fundamentals doesn't deserve your talent. We11Dev has shown repeatedly they view timely compensation as a privilege rather than a right. Until they demonstrate fundamental respect for their workforce through consistent, on-time payments across all locations, no employee should trust them with their livelihood.

post_title: A Call for Constructive Feedback
full_review: This platform allows anyone to share their opinionsтАФunverified, unchecked, and sometimes driven by personal emotions rather than facts. While itтАЩs important for employees to voice concerns, we should also recognize that anonymous posts can sometimes be misleading, exaggerated, or even false. IтАЩve been with this company for a while, and like any workplace, it has its challenges. But if we truly want to improve things, the best approach is to provide constructive feedback. Public rants, especially those fueled by personal grudges, donтАЩt solve problems; they only spread negativity. We all share the same industry, and our words shape perceptions. If every frustration turns into a public attack, it doesnтАЩt just hurt the companyтАФit affects all of us. Future investors and global employers looking at Bangladesh might hesitate if they only see hostility instead of professionalism. LetтАЩs aim for solutions, not just venting. If we have real concerns, letтАЩs raise them constructively. ThatтАЩs how we growтАФas individuals, as a company, and as an industry.

post_title: The best in Bangladesh
full_review: Aiming for Excellence: The Managing Director (MD) is truly determined to make Cefalo the best company in Bangladesh. Strong Management: The management teamтАФespecially the admin departmentтАФis exceptionally active and efficient. Best in My Career: In my 12-year professional career, I have found Cefalo's management to be the best IтАЩve ever worked with. Positive Response to Challenges: I once had a very unpleasant experience with an HR head named Zakaria. However, I received a very satisfactory response from top management. Eventually, he was removed from the company, which showed that the leadership listens and takes action when needed. Client-Based Culture: Cefalo is a client-oriented company, so you must satisfy both the client and Cefalo. Since not all clients are the same, you need to be prepared to adapt to new projects or adjust to different client expectations. Satisfying Cefalo is fairly straightforwardтАФif you follow at least 60% of the office rules, management will be quite happy. Healthy Work Environment: IтАЩve been with the company for about 2.7 years and have never experienced any toxic "vai-brother" culture. Of course, like any company, there are always a few old-timers who live in their own worldтАФbut thatтАЩs natural. Excellent Engineering Managers: IтАЩve worked with four Engineering Managers (including one former EM), and all of them were highly skilled and approachable. post_title: False Promises, Zero Growth: My Experience with Dijitech ICT
full_review: The ICT department at Digitech gives false hope to its employees. They promise permanent employment after six months, but in reality, it often takes over a year тАФ sometimes even longer. Employees stay silent out of fear of losing their jobs. What are their goals? Their plans? Their mission? Honestly, even they donтАЩt seem to know. Most of the staff are beginners with very limited industry experience тАФ and to be fair, that's not their fault. But the lack of proper guidance and mentorship only makes things worse. While a few in-charges genuinely try to support their teams, most of them lack even the basic experience to handle real projects. They often withhold important information, avoid clear communication, and some seem to receive special treatment from upper management. As a result, the employees working under them struggle to grow тАФ and even worse, their hard work is often taken credit for by those leads. Incentives? Forget it. No one hears that word in this department unless theyтАЩre among a тАЬfavored few.тАЭ Yearly increments are just as disappointing. In some cases, itтАЩs as low as 500 BDT. Sometimes, the only тАЬrewardтАЭ you get is a new designation тАФ with no actual benefits. Ironically, those who get the most out of the system often have little to no understanding of what CSE, EEE, ETE, or even basic engineering really means. On the other hand, IтАЩve heard good things about Walton Hi-Tech тАФ at least they seem to value and support their people. If youтАЩre considering career options, avoid Digitech ICT. ItтАЩs not worth your time or talent.

This place is a real hell and an example of a garment factory!

post_title: This company is popular only for its name. Employees have the worst treatment. CEO has mean personality.
full_review: Pros 1. Colleagues are friendly, decent and religious minded. Their work ethics have no vanity to step over others. 2. Office is at good location. Environement is comparatively quiet and clean. Perfect for attentive works. 3. You get salary on time to your bank account. Cons 1. There is no standard chain of command. Boss does what he thinks, rejecting other's opinions directly with own logic. 2. Employees need to show work rather than doing it. When you work in collaboration, boss have doubt that you are wasting work hours. 3. Boss misbehaves and often bullies whom he does not like that much. HR is also a stupid and afraid of boss, He literally acts as his puppet. 4. Boss relies blindly on 2 people who praise him. They are not accused of breaking any office rules ever! They play games for hours but HR does not warn them. 5. No lunch time at office in 2024! How inhuman! They tell you to eat ASAP and return to desk for work. You can smoke at balcony, but you cannot relax or leave office. 6. Office has no intention to keep loyal and experienced employees happy. Boss thinks he owns large company, so he can get anyone anytime. The employee count became less than half in one year. 7. One specific department gets privilege over others. All departments do not get the same dignity and facility. Racist mindset by boss. 8. Boss is extremely miserly person, Does not even spend extra 10 tk for office function. Forces employees to attend on special days. Does not let them turn on AC in extreme temperature to save bills. 9. Every opinion and videos are scripted. Office posts fake positive reviews on Glassdoor, Clutch and others to hide the negative ones. 10. Salary increment is poor. Salary negotiation is worst. Some colleagues got half my salary even with bigger KPI. They do not give festival bonuses to everyone. 11. HR system is s!@#! They rewarded employees who save causal leaves yet quit without notice after salary! They do not even recognize honest regular attendants. 12. If anyone wants to leave after completing yearly agreement, HR thinks them enemy! Ridiculous! 13. My maid eats better than the office lunch (partially subsidized). Worst 10tk snacks and unhealthy tea. Advice to Management The CEO needs to open eyes and see what other companies are doing in present moment. Others care for their employees like families. They do not give mental pressure. But V!S3R X has the worst KPI evaluation and office amenities.

post_title: My Experience with Station & n0pStat!on (eCommerce SBU)
full_review: I wanted to share my honest experience тАФ highlighting both the positives and areas where improvement is needed. Timely Salary тАУ No need to worry about Salary, you will get it before month end. Appraisals Twice a Year тАУ A rare and motivating benefit. Quarterly Bonuses (4 times a year) тАУ If you are just doing your job you will get good reward! Two Eid Bonuses тАУ As per your basic Provident Fund тАУ You can even take loans from it with 0% interest. Gratuity Fund тАУ A solid step toward long-term financial security. Flexible Office Hours Growth-Oriented Culture Strong Job Security These truly make a difference in day-to-day work life. Lunch & Snacks Quality тАУ Needs urgent attention. Salary Structure тАУ Needs to be more competitive. Medical Insurance тАУ Need to be more comprehensive. Training Opportunities тАУ More structured upskilling initiatives would help. Senior Talent Drain тАУ Many seniors are leaving, and honestly, itтАЩs not right. One major reason is the salary structure тАФ itтАЩs not attractive enough to retain or hire experienced people. Another important point is that the companyтАЩs growth spiked suddenly, and senior resources didnтАЩt scale up with that growth. Food Quality тАУ This must be taken seriously and improved immediately. Salary Recognition тАУ High performers should be rewarded based on contribution, not just years of experience. The company should also invest in hiring mid-level resources at better compensation. ЁЯТм Final Thought: This is my personal experience тАФ others might have different perspectives. But one thing is clear: this is a service-based company that values those who genuinely add value, If you're just looking for a typical 9-to-5 job without pushing yourself to grow or contribute meaningfully, this might not be the right place for you. It rewards doers, not seat-fillers. I often notice that people who struggle with performance tend to be more vocal about negatives, while overlooking their own improvement area and the many unique benefits the company already provides. ЁЯОп In today's market, it's rare to find all of these positive elements in one place тАФ and that deserves acknowledgment.

post_title: While as a Company BS is great, there are some middle managers who are unqualified and unprofessional to lead a team
full_review: I want to share my experience regarding an SBU named U****t. While the top management of U****t is highly professional and knowledgeable, the middle management is completely unprofessional and, frankly, a disgrace. There is a certain PM in the SBU who lacks a basic sense of boundaries and displays zero professionalism. Even in her role as a QA, her qualifications are well below standard. All she has is a loud mouth and a constant urge to win arguments with sheer volume. ItтАЩs unfortunate that in a company like BS, such unproductive and unprofessional individuals still exist. The same applies to a certain Tech Lead in the team. He has very limited technical knowledge yet behaves as if he knows everything. He is clearly neither smart nor qualified enough to lead a team or engage with clients. How someone like him ended up in a leadership position is beyond comprehension. I believe even the upper management of U****t is aware of this dysfunctional duo, but no action has been taken to improve the team or raise the standard. ItтАЩs disappointing that BS claims to be an industry leader, yet key roles have been filled with such glaring incompetence.

Expect broken buttons, misaligned elements, and websites that only work тАЬsometimes.тАЭ ItтАЩs like a treasure hunt тАФ except all you find are errors. YouтАЩll pay upfront, and then play the waiting game. And waiting. And more waiting. Eventually, youтАЩll start questioning your life choices. Somadhan IT delivers alright тАФ mostly disappointment. post_title: All I want to say is that they donтАЩt really care about us
full_review: All I want to say is that they donтАЩt really care about us - MJ This line resonates deeply with what many current and former employees are feeling at 8RAC IT. Concerns around nepotism, toxic leadership, internal politics, and even basic infrastructure issues like inadequate seating continue to go unaddressed. These are not isolated incidents, theyтАЩre echoed across numerous reviews on platforms like Deshi Mula. WhatтАЩs more concerning is the apparent indifference from management. Despite repeated feedback, there has been no visible effort to acknowledge or address these issues. Instead, the focus continues as if nothing has happened, the same routine, the same distractions, and the same avoidable problems being ignored. Internal events are still being organized as usual, which, while perhaps well-intentioned, feel tone-deaf when the real challenges remain completely unaddressed. Employee engagement is important, but it cannot replace the need for a healthy work environment built on fairness, transparency, and respect. When HR prioritizes surface-level activities over real concerns, it sends a clear message, one that aligns all too well with that song lyric. For the 600+ employees, thereтАЩs an underlying fear, if the situation continues unchecked, they may ultimately be the ones to face the fallout, while those leaders benefiting from the current status quo remain unaffected. Real change starts with listening, and then acting. Until then, the silence speaks volumes.

post_title: Great, Can Be Greatest
full_review: Like every company, We11Dev has its good sides and areas to improve. But overall, the positives stand out more for me. тЬЕ Good Salary Salary is good enough than any average company in Bangladesh. тЬЕ Job Security Company likes to keep their employee as long as possible. Even the employees who left the company with good vibe are welcomed to join anytime again. тЬЕ Fun Break Options The office includes a gaming zone with table tennis ЁЯО╛, foosball тЪ╜, and a PS5 ЁЯЦе (FIFA). As long your sprint performance is excellent, no one cares about how much you spent in the gaming zone. тЬЕ Great Food (Unlimited) The office offers high-quality meals all day: Breakfast: Biscuits, tea, coffee Lunch: Beef, mutton, fish, or chicken (one per day) Snacks: Fried chicken, shawarma, sandwich, firni, beef/chicken with bread (one item per day) тЬЕ Work-from-Home Option After six months (or sometimes earlier), employees can work from home 2 days a week. YouтАЩre free to choose which 2 days suits you best. тЬЕ Supportive If You Speak Up If you are vocal about your working pressure, necessary steps will be taken. Most people fears to talk about it. тЬЕ Flexible Leaving Time YouтАЩre supposed to stay 8.5 hours, but itтАЩs okay to leave after 8 hours of work. тЭМ Salary Delays Salaries are being delayed for about a year, although which has been promised to be resolved (multiple times though ЁЯШЕ) тЭМ Not Fully Flexible for Everyone Flexible working hours should be availed for everyone. тЭМ No Feedback System for Team Leads Team leads can give feedback to team members, but thereтАЩs no proper way for team members to give feedback to their leads.

post_title: A Rollercoaster Ride Worth Taking-Flexible Working Hours and Competitive Salaries with cons
full_review: I won't lie!!! Starting at this company truly felt like being thrown into the deep end without a life jacket. The onboarding process was minimal, leaving me to navigate complex projects with little guidance. Communication from management was sporadic, and expectations often shifted without notice. However, I came to view these challenges as valuable opportunities to develop and refine my communication skills. Facing these initial hurdles pushed me to become more resourceful and self-reliant, qualities that have significantly contributed to my professional growth in my opinion. The flexible working hours: while a perk, sometimes blurred the lines between work and personal time, especially when collaborating with international clients. This isn't unique to this company; similar dynamics exist in global top agencies. I was sad about this but then doing a little research i found we are better than more famous agencies in this country. It's a reality of working in a globally connected environment. Over time, I came to appreciate the unique opportunities this environment offered. The company's commitment to growth meant I was constantly exposed to new technologies and methodologies, significantly enhancing my skill set. The team, though remote, was incredibly supportive and collaborative (there are a few exceptional people which you know no one loves it happens in Google too so why should i complain), creating a sense of community despite the physical distance. Moreover, the compensation was competitive while i joined , and the company made efforts to recognize hard work through timely payments and occasional perks. While the journey had its bumps, the growth and experience I gained here were invaluable. To be honest It's a place that challenges you, pushes you out of your comfort zone, and, in doing so, prepares you for greater heights in your career. Advice to senior management First off, I want to express my appreciation for the strides the company has made in creating a flexible and dynamic work environment. The commitment to timely compensation, exposure to diverse projects, and the autonomy provided to employees are commendable and have positively impacted many of us. However, I've noticed that communication is an area where we could elevate our game. Some team members have mentioned challenges with clarity in expectations and feedback loops. Enhancing our communication channels could foster a more cohesive and supportive atmosphere, ensuring everyone feels heard and aligned. By investing in structured communication strategies and perhaps regular check-ins or feedback sessions, we can bridge gaps and reinforce our collaborative spirit. This not only benefits our internal culture but also positions us to be a leading agency in Bangladesh, known for both our innovation and our inclusive workplace.

post_title: Mixed Review: Brain Station 23
full_review: Pros: - Timely salary and additional benefits like gratuity, performance bonus, and leave encashment. - Good environment for freshers to learn and grow professionally. - Medical insurance is provided (though it has limitations). - Helpful people all around, even you can talk to the CEO directly - Good amount of leaves annually - They work on lots of modern technologies. - Separate learning development, and highly encourages to complete various courses they assign for free Cons: -┬аCompetitively low salary compared to industry standards. - Bad lunch qualityтАФneeds immediate improvement. Fire the admin department guy, problem will be solved. - Management discourages negative feedback, creating a culture of silence. - No annual tour* - Very poor admin departmentтАФinefficient and unresponsive to employee needs. - Medical insurance is a jokeтАФjoke means absolute joke. Suggestions for the CEO: 1. Revamp the Admin DepartmentтАФeither shuffle staff or bring in more competent professionals to improve food quality and overall efficiency. 2.┬аRe-evaluate Salary StructuresтАФoffer more competitive pay to retain and attract talent. Don't try to balance all types of employees together 3. Encourage Open FeedbackтАФcreate a culture where employees can voice concerns without fear. 4. Improve Medical BenefitsтАФenhance insurance coverage to meet employee needs. 5. Consider Annual ToursтАФboost morale by reintroducing company outings. Station 23 has potential, but addressing these issues could make it a much better workplace.

post_title: Wearing Badges to Climb Ladders
full_review: Bangladesh is apparently still lagging behind in the tech job sector where credentials are valued more than practical or hands-on experience, especially in the tech sector. And IтАЩm not just talking about software development. While some companies hiring software dev have started adopting more effective hiring practices, such as assigning real-world problems to candidates, the approach still remains limited. In most other areas, such as Cybersecurity or Information Security, there's still an overwhelming focus on certifications rather than practical qualifications, such as years of relevant experience, hands-on work, and a solid portfolio. In fact, it's nearly impossible for someone in Bangladesh to transition into an IT field even with strong practical experience and a portfolio, if they don't have the so-called тАЬindustry standardтАЭ certifications. ItтАЩs baffling. ЁЯШС

I got this idea after seeing some positive comments on this post.

Everyone here discuss about food taste and flexibility. None of them discuss about other points. Interview process, Project structure, Project documentation. Also there are no business analyst and PM for the projects. didn't it responsible to losing projects and clients. Please hire some senior who are actually technically good and experience not in the year of numbers.

I do not fully agree with the issue regarding the termination. I have been working at Silicon for a long time, and from my experience, terminations are very rare. In most cases, such actions are taken only when there is significant indiscipline or repeated failure to perform responsibilities properly. Even then, only one or two individuals have been let go, and there were valid reasons behind those decisions.
As for the food, itтАЩs important to understand that preferences vary from person to person. Not everyone will have the same taste. While I wouldnтАЩt rate it a 10 out of 10, I would confidently give it an 8 out of 10. It's not unusual for a few individuals to occasionally find the taste unsatisfactory, considering the food is prepared for a large group of people.
Also, I would like to point out that the management team is very supportive and understanding. They consider personal situations and offer considerable flexibility to employees in various aspects. Therefore, it is unfair to place the entire blame on the company just because one or two individuals were terminated due to their own mistakes.

This company rarely fires anyone unless their performance becomes truly unsustainable. IтАЩve seen developers who struggled, given years to improve. However, when IтАЩm capable of handling my responsibilities but fail to meet the companyтАЩs expectations, it can seriously harm the organizationтАЩs health. After this has gone on for years, I must accept the decision to fire me.
As for the food, itтАЩs not always great, but IтАЩm satisfied with whatтАЩs provided.
I strongly agree that the hiring process is not up to the mark, however, it's getting better lately. The recently hired employees seem very capable, and IтАЩm impressed by the choices made.

I think you should place some proof as you are claiming about a company and making hard for other employees to the developer community. If you are making statement as they terminated you not good. Because there may be your fault or company. If you claim company fault then you just place reason and how you have been terminated with minimal proof. We believe everyone trying their best to effort for their companies. I have seen many employees make false alligation where they have done terrible things.┬а
Also about food. It's up to you to like it or not as this provided by company. So you can't make it alligation who brings food or who cook food. If you are saying such cheap things then you┬а should think about your mentality. You should place real alligation and own those.┬а

IтАЩve been with SOL for quite a good amount of time, and based on my experience, I can confidently say that the SOL management genuinely takes care of its employees and makes every possible effort to maintain a positive work environment.IтАЩve found a culture here where developers are fully trustedтАФprovided they are dedicated and responsible in their work.
Of course, not everyone is able to maintain that trust due to their own carelessness. Still, IтАЩve seen the office provide sufficient support and counseling to them. However, if someone repeatedly fails to fulfill their responsibilities and continues to show negligence, then it's natural for them to receive a notice from the company. IsnтАЩt that fair?And from what IтАЩve seen, even these notices are issued in compliance with BangladeshтАЩs labor laws.
I consider myself fortunate to be part of such a supportive teamтАФsomething that is truly a blessing for any developer. A strong team can handle even the toughest projects with ease, and IтАЩve personally witnessed this.
Now, regarding the food issueтАФDue to work, IтАЩve had the opportunity to spend some time at several leading giant companies in Bangladesh, where IтАЩve experienced their breakfast, lunch, and snack offerings. Compared to them, SOL actually provides fairly good food.Of course, not everything is perfect every single day, but I would rate SOLтАЩs food quality as follows (on a scale of 10):Breakfast: 8, Lunch: 7.5, Evening Snacks: 8.5 (on average).Even though this food is completely complimentary, I donтАЩt quite understand why thereтАЩs so much dissatisfaction about it.

From my experience, the office environment is friendly and stress-free. Breaks are relaxed, and thereтАЩs no micromanagement тАУ youтАЩre trusted to get your work done at your own pace, which I truly appreciate. The flexible work schedule is a significant advantage, making it easier to maintain a good work-life balance.Even when thereтАЩs no client project for some time, they donтАЩt just fire the employee. As far as I know, no one has been fired simply for not being able to perform. If someone was let go, there were likely other reasons behind it.
As for the food, itтАЩs decent. Everyone has different tastes, so it's hard to please everyone, but for me, itтАЩs a nice-to-have, not a dealbreaker. What stands out here is the supportive team, positive culture, and the trust youтАЩre given to handle your responsibilities independently.

IтАЩve been working here for quite some time, and overall, itтАЩs been a good journey. If youтАЩre responsible with your tasks, youтАЩre trusted to manage your own time. It really helps when you have personal or family stuff to handle.
The office environment is friendly and stress-free. Break times are chill, and no one is standing behind you or pressuring you unnecessarily. You can focus on your work in peace.
About the food тАУ itтАЩs decent. Tastes will always vary from person to person, but I see it as a bonus. It's not something I expect to be perfect every day. For me, having supportive teammates, a flexible schedule, and a relaxed environment matters more.
Please hire some project manager, business analyst. Don't push developer to doing all role task.┬а┬а

I had been working SOL┬а for 2 years. Food habits vary person to person.┬а But I found (from my view , please don't take it personal) there was truely lack of technically expert person as Lead or RM. If anyone have no knowledge about how to make a system design but know the tools name and try to use them that's make the problem. So I think it is one of the reason for recent incidents like lossing projects.Also previously they had the requirements problem. There was no fixed requirements for a project.

I get that everyone has different experiences, but just wanted to share mine.
IтАЩve been working here for a while and honestly, IтАЩve had a pretty good experience overall. The work schedule is super flexible, and weтАЩre trusted to manage our time тАУ which makes a big difference. Break times are also chill, no oneтАЩs micromanaging or breathing down your neck.
And Food is a subjective matter, office meals are meant to be a complementary benefit, not a core metric of work experience.
Agreed with you. They give you advise to bring food from home. but not making it better. ha ha.ЁЯШВ

IтАЩve seen SOL take good care of employees, even over a year after theyтАЩve been terminated by the client. The recent firings were only of those whose negligence directly put important projects and the companyтАЩs reputation at risk. Some client relationships were damaged, and we even lost a few onboarding projects because of those issues.
As for the work environment, itтАЩs genuinely supportive. The company provides breakfast, lunch, and evening snacks. ThereтАЩs unlimited coffee at your desk. What more could you ask for?
Even on remote working days, if I need to be at the office, the company always covers meals, and I often order platters from Mad Chef and similar types of places. Today, I asked them for home made lunch, they shared: grilled chicken, a small grilled coral fish, veggies, and rice. If the food isnтАЩt to your taste, youтАЩre always free to order your own. I do that from time to time.
I also take long personal breaks during office hours, and management never asks any questions. Often, I travel for weeks to months and work remotely. If you perform your responsibilities well, you have unlimited freedom here!
Why don't you bring your own food if you don't like it? Hudai pechal

full_review: The entire business was split up into two sections. One is the Devops division, which employs six or seven individuals, and the other is the service-based own product division, which currently employs over 40+┬а people. The interesting part┬а is that the entire business makes money from only devops services. With a service-oriented employee through attitude like, they produced millions of dollars, which looks like shit. The other factor is: 1. The company washroom looks like Mirpur's public toilet. 2. Bad lunch quality 3. Competitively low salary compared to industry standards. 4. On time salary

post_title: Acts like a director, actually a thief; with an as*l**ker group
full_review: This is the story of the previous payroll director, who used to act as if he is giving out the salary to people, as if the salary is not earned by the employees. The guy used to act high and mighty in fornt of people, but at the back did everything to steal money from the company. He had the budget of the cultural committee, and misappropriated the budget. He bought liquor for the people who drink alcohol during the office retreat; but there was not even a single drop of juice for the people who do not drink or who are religious. This former "director" along side the other director (who ran away to UK, applied for the role but bragged that the company apparently begged him to go to UK lol) did not even think about more than half of the employees, and just thought about their own urge to drink free alcohol. When asked they would just say, "we informed everyone about it, why didn't you come?" Like bro, you informed someone religious that there would be alcohol, please forego your religion and drink alcohol. Those two used the budget for their own desires rather than thinking about everyone. And please don't tell me, this is an inclusive company. The payroll "director" gave money to his gf to get eid gift boxes for the office, bro playing the company on different levels to get money. That money went to his pockets and people praised him saying great gift. But please praise him like a god, as if he is bestowing your hard earned salary out of his pocket. This "director" didn't even follow the proper tax laws for income tax, and when someone would ask him questions related to income tax, he would sidestep it. Don't forget about the as*l**kers. These two phenomenol "directors" has assembled a group whose only task is to lick the asses of these two. One got kicked out once, but then he came with a vengeance to slander the company; man if you are not happy with the company just leave, stop saying negative things to people and new hires; no one wants to hear your stories. But no, he won't leave, because he gets money here, and a generous manager who isn't firing him. Then the other asslicker, who can't even put two sentences together properly in English, trots around as if being the asslicker of directors is something to be proud of. These two are the dogs of the directors, if the "directors" give them shits to eat, they would eat it and say this is the best food in the entire world.

post_title: Toxic Workplace with Rude Management and Unprofessional Senior Staff
full_review: This company is an absolute nightmare to work for. The management is shockingly rude, dismissive, and completely unprofessional. Instead of fostering a supportive work environment, they create unnecessary stress through their arrogant and disrespectful behavior. Even worse, some of the senior software engineers lack basic manners and professionalism. They are egotistical, condescending, and make collaboration unbearable. Rather than mentoring or guiding junior employees, they belittle others and act as if they are above teamwork. The office culture is toxic, morale is low, and there is zero accountability for poor behavior. If you value respect, professionalism, or a healthy work environment, avoid this company at all costs.

post_title: Honorable mention: The operation manager тЩея╕П
full_review: Well, first of all, IтАЩm grateful to the company because I was struggling to find a job. This company gave me the opportunity to start my career with zero salary. I left the company years ago. Pros: If you have skill issues or canтАЩt manage to get a job or internship, you can start here. Of course, donтАЩt expect any salary during your internship period. Cons: 1. Your job can be terminated at any time without notice. 2. Poor management. 3. No work-life balance. 4. If you plan to resign, donтАЩt expect to receive your pending salary. Honorable mention: Raja Vai, the Operations Manager. Sometimes, he doesnтАЩt behave like a civilized person. In the end, I just want to say тАФ this company could have been one of the best in Bangladesh. They had the financial backup. But the original owner, a Saudi man, has no idea how this manag ement is ruining the company.

post_title: I don't care if you call me DALAL
full_review: 2-3 years of experience e kon company manual QA k 45-60k salary pay kore, sai company k dekhte chai. I have been working at AGT for around 7 months. I received MacBook Pro 16" to use as my office device (Jodio job here dile return kora lagbe). But ekhon 45k pay kortasa device er jonno (1 year AGT te thakle taka return kora lagbe na) Ami recruitment post dekhe e apply korsi j night shift. So no complaint. Ami contract paper a 1 year e same salary te kaj korar jonno raji hoisi. Amar 1 year complete hoile contract renew hobe. Ami chill mode e kaj kori, client meeting sob attend kori. So amake niye reporting manager r client side er positive vive ase. Ami tel mari kaj kori na. kaj na thakle free time e movie dekhi. Even Sakib bhai o ei bisoye jane. Ami Ratul bhai er sathe kaj o korsi. He is not a bad guy. If you complete your assigned task, it is okay for him. Kono pera dai na. Ami kichu manus k terminate korte deksi. Sobai k tader kajer karonei terminate korse (Rabab bhai er case ta different) I will say, if you know how QA works, then you will survive here. Kaje gafiloti korle chient side theke complaint asbe. And you will be assigned to another project, or you will be fired. For me, the Overall management is okay. 5-6 tarikh e salary deposit hoy. AGT is a staff augmentation company. If the client needs you, you have the job otherwise, you will be terminated.

post_title: Work-Life Balance Done Right! One of Bangladesh's Best Companies
full_review: I can confidently say that Monstarlab Bangladesh is one of the few companies in the country that truly upholds international standards in the workplace. Salaries and increments were always on time. something thatтАЩs not easy to guarantee everywhere. While no company is perfect, MLBD came impressively close. MLBD is home to some of the finest engineers in the country I will say this with full confidence. Unfortunately, due to a series of poor decisions at the international management level, the company underwent significant downsizing. But thatтАЩs life. That said, I sincerely hope the company finds its way back. Even during the toughest times, Monstarlab Bangladesh remained committed to its people, trying to provide fair compensation and support to those affected by the layoffs. I miss MLBD. Thank you, MLBD ! and best of luck on the road ahead. To everyone still working hard to keep it going: kudos to you all тЭдя╕П A suggestion to the higher management: Perhaps itтАЩs time to consider a new CЁЯН╡O !!! Someone more agile, forward-thinking, and bold enough to dream big. This isnтАЩt to say the current one lacks competency (ЁЯШЙ) but sometimes, real progress needs a fresh perspective and a shift in leadership to move things forward. (And yes, IтАЩm being nice while saying it┬а ! read between the lines ЁЯШЙ)

post_title: A Humble Request to Management
full_review: Recently, a number of vulgar and inappropriate reviews have been posted here. While I do not support the use of such language, I also understand that some of the underlying concerns may be valid. Th3rap is still a good company, and many of us appreciate the opportunities it provides. That said, I would like to respectfully request the management to show a bit more considerationтАФsimilar to how things used to be not too long ago. Please try not to normalize working overtime or assigning work on government-declared holidays. If a release is urgent, perhaps only the directly involved team can be asked to handle it, rather than occupying everyone. And if thatтАЩs not possible, could we at least be given a compensatory day off? I understand that, as a large US-based company, it's not feasible to shut down for 10 days. We do appreciate getting work-from-home on June 11 and 12тАФbut June 5 was a government-mandated holiday, and we wonder why that wasnтАЩt respected. Not all 10 days off are necessary, but why not from June 5 to 10? That seems like a reasonable compromise. I truly believe that the leadership at Th3rap is doing their best. But being too strict wonтАЩt silence people's frustrationsтАФespecially when even those who donтАЩt speak up feel the same way. I hope this message is taken as a humble request to be a little more thoughtful in such situations. We care about our work and the companyтАФbut we also need understanding and balance.

post_title: SQA Interview - Referrals Matters (Disheartening)
full_review: As a Tech grad from BD, most of us know Eno5i5 is a well-known company. So, I was very interested in working there. I always heard about the referral system there. But from the beginning, I have a thing of self-respect and am kind of adamant that I won't grab any job with others referring me.Though I know few seniors at eno5i5 who will gimme me refer if I request them but I applied through LinkedIn in usual way. TBH I knew there's very little chance I would get the interview call as huge applicants apply. After 1.5 months they mailed about the assessment. HackerRank test-> Technical Interview ->Final HR Interview passed all the steps. Technical Interview: A team Lead vai took the assessment on Google Meet. I did my best. And at end part he gave me vibe that he is convinced about almost all the answers. HR Interview: After 7 days HR meeting took place. He asked stuffs about me and about prev job experiences. And bit of other casual talks. He was very friendly and gave me vibe like he was convinced with me too. (I gave a lot of interviews in my life XD I kinda know now the signs interviewer likes the candidate or not ). interviewer told me they will mail the decision within 2 weeks. So I was very happy with the whole process. I worked very hard to prepare myself for the interviews of Eno5i5 and gave my best effort. And after the phases I was kinda sure they might choose me . I kept my fingers crossed and really hoped I might get the job. After 14 days of no response so I mailed about follow up . No Reply After around two months, they replied that vacancies have been filled up for the position. It was very sad for me. It's ok, it happens. At this time I finally reached out to a senior vai of mine who works at Eno5i5 and asked him if he could gimme any info about my situation. He got back to me after few days telling "You passed all phases, but among other candidates few of them had direct referrals from very senior positions like Senior/ Team lead etc. So they had to pick them " That was like breaking my heart into pieces. I know it's just a job and I moved on. I believe ALLAH wrote my riziq somewhere else. But I really worked hard for the interviews and had high hopes. From a famous company like them, I did not expect that. I could have managed a refer, but did not, as I was confident I could ace it. Never going to apply again at Eno5i5. If any job candidate reading this, I would suggest applying at eno5i5 with a reference or dont. Not saying they don't hire ppl without refer but nowadays they mostly give preference to referred ppl.

comments.comment_text: One thing you are wrong about and change your mentality here is that getting a referral isn't a bad thing at all. For example, tech giants like Google, Amazon won't even look at your resume without a referral. Even the companies in our country holds over 5k resumes. Referral is a great system to get noticed. When they notice you, you are on the driving seat. In your case, although you are feeling that you were eligible but those people who got accepted were the same as you. They also needed to pass all the tests and interviews. Enosis gave them the opportunity becuase they knew someone who can vouch for them inside the company. So, after this whether you apply on Enosis or any other big company, just get rid┬а of this false ego of not getting a referral.

If you have some time, IтАЩd really appreciate it if you could share some guidance on how to prepare for an SQA role in a reputed or large company. Given your experience with well-known organizations, your insights would be extremely valuable to me as I plan my career path.
Thank you in advance for your time

I am in the software development industry for almost 6 years now. I can feel your pain when you miss getting close. But keep up ur did best and as u have the potential to pass such phases, I hope eventually you will do well. All the best!
I saw someone's comment, I guess he/she might be from enosis.I agree fully as he said, "an internal reference can certainly help you get an invitation to the initial screening". Even I have referred someone who did not even pass the initial round.
But in my opinion, there is still some impact on the final selection process. As vai/apu "Senior Software Engineer" might also know that. I have seen scenarios like 2 vacancies and 5-6 made it till final selection. I was part of 2 interviews. And all of them are almost equally good. But finally HR had to choose with the ones with referrals as out of 6, 3 had referrals from senior position holders in the company.┬а
┬а

I hear your frustration about not getting an offer after the final HR round. While you might feel your sessions went well, it's genuinely hard to "read" an HR professional's opinionтАФthey're trained to be impartial. I've found the HR round focuses heavily on cultural fit, your career aspirations, and how your experience, expectations, and future planning align with the company's long-term goals.You're partially right; an internal reference can certainly help you get an invitation to the initial screening. However, it rarely guarantees a job offer in the final stages. In my experience, not all references even get the first screening round. Hope that helps clarify things.
---
Senior Software Engineer┬а

Sorry your experience wasn't what you hoped. In my openion, referrals often just help you get the interview in enosis. After that, it's really up to your own skills, and making it to HR round proves that you have the technical qualifications. The main reason of your heartbreak is most probably due to very limited new hiring. Also keep in mind that multiple managers take interviews of multiple candidates simultaneously. But since you made it to the HR round, there's still a good chance you'll hear back if hiring picks up. Best of luck!

post_title: Reflections on My Time at C3fa1o: Strengths and Opportunities for Growth
full_review: I am a former employee of C3fa1o, having left the organization before the recent management restructuring (specifically, the introduction of Engineering Managers тАУ EMs). Therefore, my feedback does not reflect the most recent changes that others have mentioned in this platform. Positive Aspects: The management is empathetic, kind, considerate, and genuinely employee-centric. There is no culture of micromanagement. Employees enjoy autonomy in managing their work and can operate independently with a great deal of freedom. Similarly, leave policies are flexible. The management respects personal time off and does not question leave decisions. The clients I worked with were polite, respectful, and professional. Salaries are competitive and always disbursed on time. Areas of Concern: The pace of work and overall progress can sometimes feel average or, in some cases, below average. For those who are highly ambitious and eager to contribute beyond expectations, opportunities may seem limited. Career progression tends to be slow. Even for top performers, advancement does not necessarily follow performance. While salary reviews are better in such cases, the differnce are often marginal. Value creation is primarily based on individual contribution, and over time, opportunities for growth may plateau, making it difficult to continue adding value beyond a certain point. While senior titles such as тАЬLead Software EngineerтАЭ or тАЬSenior Software EngineerтАЭ exist, in many cases, the responsibilities remain similar to that of a regular Software Engineer. This can lead to a lack of clarity and recognition for role differentiation. Criteria for promotion are not always transparent. At times, it appears that tenure is weighed more heavily than merit or impact. Moreover, job titles and salary levels do not always correlate. Performance management is often reactive rather than proactive. If a client does not raise concerns, performance issues may go unnoticed for extended periods. In some cases, known team challenges or productivity blockers are acknowledged internally but are not always addressed with effective action. Team structures can occasionally become unbalancedтАФfor instance, having five QA professionals in a team of fifteen engineers. If a client reduces team size or exits, reallocation of resources becomes difficult and stressful. Suggestions for Improvement: Monitor individual and team performance more actively without resorting to micromanagementтАФit is possible to strike this balance. Provide regular, structured feedback to employees, highlighting both strengths and areas for improvement. A quarterly or biannual system would be beneficial. Address substandard work ethics constructively. Allowing poor work habits to go unchecked can be demotivating for committed team members and may affect overall team morale. Raise the hiring standards to focus once again on experienced and proven candidates, as was the practice in earlier years. Make the career growth path and promotion criteria more transparent and performance-based, so that employees understand how to advance.

post_title: A disappointing experience with G!zant3ch
full_review: I usually donтАЩt post negative things, but this one feels important to speak up about. On May 20 , I applied for a ЁЭЧзЁЭЧ┐ЁЭЧоЁЭЧ╢ЁЭЧ╗ЁЭЧ▓ЁЭЧ▓ ЁЭЧШЁЭЧ╗ЁЭЧ┤ЁЭЧ╢ЁЭЧ╗ЁЭЧ▓ЁЭЧ▓ЁЭЧ┐ position at G!zant3ch that closely aligned with my skills and passion. I took the time to carefully review their requirements and submit a thoughtful application well before the deadline of May 25 . But instead of responding to applicants or providing any kind of acknowledgment, I noticed that on May 29 , the company simply reposted the exact same job listing with new deadline, no updates, no feedback, just a new round of exposure. It made me genuinely question their intentions. Are they actually looking to hire, or just using job postings to gain reach and visibility on social media ? Posting job ads should never be a tool to gain followers or boost visibility itтАЩs about people. Real candidates with real hopes, effort, and time invested. This kind of behavior feels careless and disrespectful to those who are actively seeking opportunities. To companies: If you truly value talent, please respect the process. Respond, even if it's a rejection. Don't treat job posts like engagement bait.

Hopefully, our applicants will receive a confirmation mail soon In Sha Allah, regarding the acceptance of their application. Further details will be shared later on.Thank you for pointing out the issue, we appreciate your concern.

post_title: Let's discuss what makes a company worthy of receiving a good review in Deshi Mula
full_review: Here is my opinion: On-time salary, work-from-home option, good food and snacks Balanced salary (People need enough to live, not just survive, jodio manusher pet koborer mati chara vorbe na) Balanced team knowledge. A good team lead who is willing to listen. (Sometimes juniors feel ignored if their ideas arenтАЩt heard, but itтАЩs also the team leadтАЩs responsibility to explain decisions. If your knowledge doesnтАЩt make you humble, you need to reflect on that vai!) No HR drama (please!), Meme > Text > short video insturction > short physical meeting > long Teams call (please avoid this, time is money) Flexible hours (No unpaid overtime in the name of flexibility. If someone starts late, let them finish their 8 hours or complete their tasks.) Respect and good behavior. Dedicated prayer zone. I see companies keep room for biri, sports, but not for the most important thing in humans life. Proper training after joining, opportunities for learning and skill development (sessions by other teamleads, courses etc) Proper penalty system for slackers (e.g., a 100 taka fine for unprofessional behavior or taking two days to change a button color, unless youтАЩre actually doing R&D with Pantone ЁЯШЖ). Also zero tollerance about people who is toxic. (durjon biddan hoileo poritajjo) Job security, in some cases, profit sharing Please share yours, be neutral and unbiased.

post_title: Welcome to the Twilight Zone of Tech
full_review: Nothing happens here. Literally.┬аNo engineering culture. No innovation. No real decision-making. People show up, follow orders, and go home. ThatтАЩs the cycle. ThereтАЩs no push for improvement because no one believes change is possibleтАФor even worth trying. Leaders who donтАЩt understand the work make the decisions.┬аThey estimate timelines without knowing whatтАЩs involved. No technical input, no reality checksтАФjust made-up deadlines that lead to unnecessary stress, overwork, and sleepless nights. Then they act surprised when things fall apart. ThereтАЩs no collaboration, no constructive discussion.┬аItтАЩs a one-way street: top-down instructions with no room for feedback. Engineers have become passive executors, not builders. No one challenges anything, because nothing ever changes anyway. Even with 130+ employees, thereтАЩs barely any real work.┬аThe office vibe is somewhere between a ghost town and a waiting room. The company hasnтАЩt laid people off, but it also hasnтАЩt moved forward. ItтАЩs just stuckтАФexisting for the sake of existing. This company doesnтАЩt know what it is.┬аIs it trying to be a tech company, or just live off the reputation of its parent brand? ThereтАЩs no clarityтАФjust confusion, masked with buzzwords. If youтАЩre an engineer who wants to grow, make an impact, or feel like your work mattersтАФthis is not the place.┬аAll youтАЩll find is a paycheck and the slow, soul-crushing realization that absolutely nothing is happening here, and probably never will.

post_title: Worst tech company
full_review: I had an extremely disappointing experience with this company. There is absolutely no job securityтАФemployees are let go abruptly without any prior warning or clear explanation, regardless of performance or skill. The fresher hiring process is highly exploitative. They take in batches of 10тАУ20 trainees, offer no stipend or salary during the training period, and then only select the top 50% for employment. This feels more like a filtered internship trap than a fair hiring model. Even after being selected, many freshers are kept on the bench without any project assignment. Despite having the required skills and repeatedly reaching out to managers, there is little to no response. Eventually, they call and force you to resignтАФor face termination. The HR team is unprofessional and lacks transparency, and the company's entire system appears to be run through nepotismтАФnot just favoritism based on connections, but also religious bias, which is deeply disheartening in a professional environment. This company does not value talent, commitment, or fairness. I sincerely hope no more fresh graduates or professionals fall into this exploitative cycle. Avoid this company if you care about dignity, growth, and stability.

post_title: Management Old wine in a new bottle
full_review: As an employee, I want to share some feedback about what I have seen in the company under the new management(Different name, same game) Culture and Work Environment The work culture has not improved. It feels more outdated every day. There is no effort to build a modern, positive work environment. Revenue Growth and Stability Revenue has not grown much. Without help from 8RAC, the company may not survive more than a few months. It is not building its own strong base. Leadership and Employee Growth Leadership quality is going down. Many important roles are given to people based on personal connections, not skills. This is hurting team performance and growth. Technical Progress Technical growth is slow. Compared to other local IT companies, 8RAC IT is falling behind. There is not enough focus on new technologies or improving technical teams. Recruitment Process The hiring process is weak. It lacks structure. Skilled people do not want to join because they donтАЩt see career growth or a good work culture here. Vision and Direction The company has no clear long-term vision. Many top leaders focus only on keeping 8RAC happy, not on building real value. They often make promises that are not realistic. Project Sustainability Many projects start with big hopes, but they fail to bring long-term results. After two years, they often cannot generate revenue. These turn into "in-hours" projects that donтАЩt grow or scale. The same mistake is being repeated with new projects. Project Management Standards More than 100 people work in project management, but many do not have the right skills or technical background. Most of them do not follow standard methods like Agile or Scrum. This causes delays, confusion, and poor project outcomes.

post_title: Utter Chaos тАУ The Worst Company IтАЩve Ever Worked For
full_review: 8evy Commerce is a textbook example of how not to run a tech company. From top to bottom, the organization is plagued by incompetence, dysfunction, and toxic leadership. Management is completely disconnected from reality тАФ they micromanage when they shouldn't and disappear when you actually need direction. Decisions are made arbitrarily, often driven by egos rather than data or common sense. Transparency is non-existent; youтАЩll often find out about major changes after they've already happenedтАж and usually because something has gone horribly wrong. The culture is toxic and demoralizing. Bullying behavior by senior staff is tolerated, even rewarded. Constructive criticism is taken as a personal attack, and there is zero psychological safety. If youтАЩre not a yes-person, your days are numbered. Workload expectations are brutal, with last-minute deadlines constantly dropped on employees due to poor planning. Burnout is rampant, and HR is either powerless or unwilling to address the issues. Promotions and recognition are based on favoritism, not performance. This is not a company that values its people тАФ it uses them and burns them out. Avoid 8evy Commerce at all costs unless youтАЩre desperate or want a front-row seat to a slow-motion implosion.

post_title: No recognition for productive and potential person
full_review: I worked in this organization for nearly half a decade, during which I consistently delivered my best and generated over millions of pounds for them through various projects. However, despite my significant contributions, I received no recognition or promotion during my tenure due to nepotism and my outspoken stance against corruption in procurement, recruitment, and other areas. Instead, my subordinates who lacked potential and worked under my supervision were promoted because they cultivated good relations with senior management. This was apparently done to mentally harass me and pressure me into resigning voluntarily. Although I was pushed out, the organization did not terminate my contract, instead recruiting different supervisors to manage me individuals who lacked knowledge and visionary planning. They merely used my work to showcase their own achievements. The main culprits behind this toxic environment were the Head of Monitoring, Finance Manager, IT Manager, HR Manager, Country Director, Program Manager (W**H Project), and the Coordinator (Mechanical Engineer). They have a very good syndicated in that organisation. Therefore, I would not recommend this organization to those who are career oriented and seek professional growth. However, for freshers, older employees, or those primarily interested in a good salary without strong ambitions or potential, this organization might be a suitable choice.

post_title: Loving the culture, tech, and leadership at 52 Digital тАУ proud to be part of it
full_review: Working at 52 Digital Ltd. has been an incredible experience. It's a denmark based software consultancy service provider where we provide technical support to our Danish clients, and the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology makes the job both exciting and fulfilling. The work environment here fosters excellent work-life balance, with flexible working hours, a supportive leave policy, and on-time salary payments, learning and growth which together create a strong foundation of trust and stability. The management is transparent and genuinely focused on employee retention and well-being. There's a clear culture of respect and recognition, especially towards the engineers and tech team. The company takes care of its people with thoughtful perks like tours and delicious breakfast, lunch, and snacks provided daily. One of the most standout aspects for me is the leadership тАФ particularly the CTO, who is not only technically sound and visionary but also incredibly approachable. He appreciates even the smallest efforts, recognizes good work, and continuously motivates us to bring out our best. That kind of leadership is rare and deeply valued. The seniors here are helpful, and the team culture is friendly and collaborative. Working with our Danish partners has also been a great experience тАФ it's rewarding to contribute to an international setup that values quality and professionalism. I'm truly enjoying every bit of my time here and feel grateful to be a part of such a thoughtful and dynamic company.

post_title: Nice screening system
full_review: Th3rap came to SUST this year for campus recruitment. There were 11 mid to easy level leetcode type coding problems. But the time was only 1.5 hours. Because the code was written in hand this time is not enough. Many of my friends had to write pseudo code or plan for solution only. But most of them were correct. But this interview was a joke. All the questions were given from the previous year. They did not even bothered to change the questions. And the HR chose the so called talented bd students that just wrote down memorized code. I mean these people knew they did not change the questions. Shouldn't they atleast check if the answers were genuine or even ask them a bit more different and difficult on site interview questions to judge them? If this is the interview process? Why even bother just do lottery.

post_title: The Internship That Shouldn't Have Existed
full_review: 1. Disorganized and Disgusting Work Environment The office environment was poorly maintained; desks were broken, and the overall setup was highly unprofessional. Coming from a well-known university, transitioning to this office felt like entering an unpleasant and disorganized space. 2. Lack of Basic Facilities It was an unpaid internship, and interns were required to bring their own laptops. No lunch was providedтАФonly a single cup of tea for the entire day. Washrooms were filthy and difficult to access. 3. Unrealistic Work Expectations Despite being an intern, I was assigned tasks equivalent to those of a full-time senior employee. I was even asked to train other employees who were permanent hires but lacked basic skills. 4. Unprofessional Management The managing director ignored me on my first day and didnтАЩt bother to acknowledge my presence. By contrast, my current company introduced me to the team, and the MD personally welcomed me and gave me tips, highlighting the stark difference. 5. Poor Interview and Onboarding Process They bluntly refused parking facilities during the interview and suggested using public transport, showing no consideration for employees. Other companies at least offer alternatives, but this company lacked basic courtesy. 6. Client Handling and Ethics The company showed no willingness to accommodate client requirements, insisting clients accept the software as it was. Client support was appallingly inadequate. 7. Oppressive Contract Terms The offer letter included a clause stating I wouldnтАЩt be allowed to work for another software company for two years after leaving, or they would take legal actionтАФthis was for an unpaid internship! 8. Mental Health Impact The toxic environment and lack of professionalism were enough to drive anyone into depression. Final Thoughts: I joined this company out of necessity to avoid a semester gap but left within a day. Within 17 days, I joined a better company out of three offers I received after leaving this place. This company is in no way a professional software firm. Avoid it at all costs!
