post_title: A Workplace Where Working Feels Fun
full_review: IтАЩve worked at quite a few places, but honestly, this one was the most fun. Not just flexible, but the overall vibe was so chill that you never felt pressure going to work. Say something happens at homeтАФthey sometimes let you work from home with a proper reason. There's even the option to take half-day leaves if needed. For me, I didnтАЩt mind working extra hour when there was pressure. This kind of mutual understanding just makes working feel better, doesnтАЩt it? When it comes to salary, they pay on time. IтАЩve seen people get their full salary even if they left in the middle of the month. That kind of fairness is rare nowadays. The salary might feel a bit low to some, and honestly, I canтАЩt compare it properly with the Bangladesh job market. But one thingтАЩs for sureтАФyou get huge opportunities for R&D. If youтАЩre eager to learn or try something new, they provide time, resources, and support. I even worked on R&D projects during office hours, which is not common everywhere. The environment here is super friendly and open. Once you join, you get a strong тАЬfamilyтАЭ feeling. IтАЩve seen many former employees come back just to hang out. Of course, no place is perfect. One thing I noticed is that they really watch how enthusiastic you are about learning and improving. This might not feel good to everyone. If you join and they donтАЩt see enough passion in you, you might get fired. At that point, you could feel like the company isnтАЩt treating you fairly. Still, from my experience, this has been the best place IтАЩve worked. post_title: Increment feels like alms
full_review: The increment amount is not acutally based on performance rather it's the inflation rate adjustment. I have been working here and burning my a** off for many years. Recently I came to know that the increment percentage that I have been getting yearly is actually inflation rate adjustment not performance salary hike. My performance and feedback from my team lead seems to be positive but the yearly increment is not satisfactory. The management should provide better increment amount to the current employees rather than hiring new ones in bulk. 8-10% increment every year is not enough, considering the way prices of everything is going up

post_title: Confused company, inexperienced leadership
full_review: All concentration on displaying positive vibes in social media, zero effort towards employee engagement. Indirectly banned sick leave without doctor's note, even for cold/cough/seasonal fever. Head of HR comes up with policies with no employee benefits and impose them without any consent. Nobody knows anything about company roadmap, only update comes from zoom channel updates. No path for future progress in terms of learning and self improvement. Hoping to move on asap. Career killer!!

post_title: Great people. Cutting edge work!
full_review: When I interviewed for Opt!m!zely, I was not even sure what the role exactly does, let alone what the company does. The products built here blew me away in terms of their general stability and maturity, so I am happy that I am now working on sensible stuff instead of a 7 person startup whose C3O is a ADHD patient. The culture is great. Inspite of what deshimula has me believe these days (yes me too), I have found everyone at office to be really receptive, supportive, and great prospect for growth. My Manager is on a global role and I see a lot of scope for me to grow into that in the future. There isnt really any barrier to that as a local employee and I love that. I am seeing people posted and sent to different countries on roles and that to me is positive. Although I am not on the engineering track, I feel it can be a good stepping stone for my career. I intend to stay here and gain some expertise before moving abroad for my masters and I even told my manager and they were perfectly okay with it instead of telling me "tomake hire kora to amar loss tahole" like the others. I also found a good community of people here who are working on their masters application and helping each other even at office which was pleasantly surprising. And one more thing I would like to point out is that having Optimizely on my resume has brought a lot of value to it. I now get called to random interviews where they would filter out my CV even a year ago. So I like that the brand stands out. Working on multiple local startups actually didn't have that for me and I am enjoying the sunlight lol. Office is situated in a great location. Transport is provided. There is a culture of gaming in the office. Lots of keyboard enthusiasts which I love. Even a book club! Very lovely set of people that I enjoy spending time with even beyond work. And oh, negativity o ache. Good teams bad teams. Good managers bad managers. Eigula thakbei. I guess I just got lucky.

post_title: CT0 has a Phd from MIT also a nobel prize winner and rest of the people is from Darul Ahsan polytechnic
full_review: Actually the head line is not true but thats what CT0 feels. Most ultimate dumb and at the same time dellusional guy I have ever seen. Though nobel prize is not awarded for computer sceince but he thinks he is the only one receiver of nobel prize so far. I am not disrespecting any educational institution but it is CT0 who does it, though being from a polytechnic. So called PM and and all the chamchas make him feel like this by continous oiling. Not only the CT0, all top management act like this, don't know how to behave. Totally inhumane and uncivilized.

post_title: New, so have to do office during EID. No holiday
full_review: I just started my job as a Junior Front End Developer here at this company and it's been around a month. So as we know EID is coming up after 2 days . So every one was preparing to go home so as me . We very much excited. It was my first income and Baught a Goat from my very small amount income. Planning buy ticket for going home . i am the onky child my parents have there is no one else in my family . Long story short ... The government has announced 10 day holiday for the EID yet our great great company honoured us with just 3 days of holiday 6 th - 9th July ! Where 2 says will take everyone just to reach home ... any ways I was given home office for the EID and I had no problem .. Now they are saying there will be no home office 2,3 of ┬аyou has to so be at office and this is no request this is must . ┬аBecause I was new I was honoured with the opportunity to stay at Dhaka and do the Office work where some of our team leaders already left for home today where there is 1 day left still for vacation to start... Just imagine.. you buy your first Kurabani and yet you can't even go to your family for the ...Allahamdullilah allah knows better .. If anyone sees this from the Company please have some common sense..

full_review: Pros: Cons: My opinion is, "Its beginner friendly. 1-2years here is good. For further growth I would recomend you to switch."

post_title: Still the best tech company of BD despite some management failures
full_review: So I'll start with this, what Optimizely was 2-3 years back, it's not the same anymore. I'll come to the negatives. But first, the positives. Hands down, the best people you can share your work life with. Most people are friendly, open minded and very helpful (except for some lowlife morons of course). The work process is well designed, OKR is set with reasonable expectations, and you can have a work-life balance (unless your manager is toxic). The pay package is good if you have just started your career or got 2-4 years of work experience. If you reach your midcareer phase, the package won't be competitive enough anymore. The work exposure is amazing. You're working with a global team, with company's own products, which most Bangladeshi tech companies doesn't offer. So it does add to your portfolio. Company is providing free transportation and lunch, where you're actually saving a lot of money if you're a regular office goer. Now the negatives, the quality of new hires dropped drastically in the last few months/years. Most of the new hires aren't culturally fit, thinks this is just a ''Chill'' place, and be with their own circle or bubble. The reason is, most of them has friends here working from before. And the whole blame goes to the TA team. Why everyone's boyfriends, girlfriends, childhood friends and their mother is joining this company? This is a pathetic practice. The company should immediately drop the referral policy. Another thing is, I wouldn't blame the new TAs entirely, because they're very young, they don't have enough experience, doesn't have much industry knowledge. It's their department head's fault who failed to understand, that a global company like this shouldn't rely on youngsters for their hiring process. And the major fallout, the company is not caring much about employee dissatisfaction anymore. It's all 'Business Needs'. I just hope the management understands their shortcomings very soon and take necessary actions to keep the great reputation that we have (I don't think it's already gone yet).

Probably one of the worst teams here.

post_title: Talented colleagues, nice office, decent benefits, but shifting culture
full_review: have been here a few years, and thought I would give an honest feedback positives: negatives i prepared a lot and worked very hard and was happy to finally join optimizely after a long interview process, but after getting in i realized there are many different teams, and not every team is same. different teams also have different work culture sometimes. not saying good or bad, sometimes i talk to different engineers and notice some differences. but its ok, a large company will have this i guess. but overall i am enjoying my time here, working with talented colleagues, and learning a lot. for anyone applying for a job here as an engineer, i would recommend to ask questions about which team, what is the role or kind of work and tech stack, how is the manager and team structure, etc. because it varies a lot. so make sure you are applying for the team or stack you are interested in.

post_title: Just Another Intern Exploitation Machine
full_review: Soluty@ is nothing but a scam company running an intern business in disguise . They donтАЩt care about talent, growth, or professionalism тАФ they only care about free labor . They hire batches of interns every few months, squeeze out full projects from them, and when the internship ends, they throw a disrespectful, insulting salary offer тАФ not enough to survive, let alone build a career. If you reject it, you're kicked out like garbage. Then they rinse and repeat with fresh interns. ItтАЩs a toxic cycle of exploitation. If you don't belive me, just check their Facebook & Linkedin page тАФ itтАЩs full of repeated intern job posts for software engineer in every few months. They use people and throw them away without shame. If you have any self-worth, stay the hell away from Soluty@ . They are not building careers тАФ they're running a sweatshop for interns.

post_title: Toxic Culture and Unethical Practices at 3WN Bangladesh
full_review: Toxic Culture and Unethical Practices at 3WN Bangladesh Review: As a current employee, I can no longer stay silent about the deeply unethical and exploitative practices at 3WN Bangladesh. If you're considering working here, I strongly advise you to think twice. What you see from the outsideтАФa fast-growing company promising innovationтАФis nothing but a fa├зade hiding a deeply toxic, mismanaged, and morally bankrupt organization. 1. Zero Accountability at the Top: Leadership is opaque, autocratic, and entirely unaccountable. Decisions are made without consultation, transparency, or foresight. The higher-ups often delegate blame and take credit for others' work. Constructive feedback is dismissed, and questioning unethical directives is treated as insubordination. 2. Unethical Employment Practices: The company routinely violates labor standardsтАФforcing employees to work well beyond legal hours without proper compensation. Contracts are often ambiguous or misleading. Promised benefits, such as bonuses or paid leave, are frequently denied or "forgotten." 3. Toxic Work Culture: Bullying, favoritism, and gaslighting are rampant. There is a culture of fear, not collaboration. Those who speak up about abuse or unfair treatment are sidelined or quietly pushed out. HR is either complicit or powerless to act independently. 4. Data Privacy Concerns: IтАЩve personally witnessed questionable handling of client and employee data. ThereтАЩs no clear protocol or ethical concern when it comes to user privacy, which is a huge red flagтАФespecially for a tech-oriented company. 5. Misleading Clients and Partners: Sales and project teams often overpromise, knowing full well the company can't deliver. There have been multiple instances where clients were misled about the scope, functionality, or progress of work just to close deals or secure funding. 6. Zero Growth, Zero Learning: Forget professional development. There is no mentorship, no training, no roadmap for progression. The moment youтАЩre in, youтАЩre on your own. Talented individuals are often burned out and leave within months. Final Thoughts: IтАЩm sharing this not out of spite, but out of concern for future employees who might fall into the same trap. 3WN Bangladesh needs a massive ethical overhaul, starting from the top. Until then, stay awayтАФfor your own sanity and career.

post_title: They take interview just to time pass
full_review: I gave Trainee Software Engineer Interview at We11dev. This took almost 4 months. First MCQ round. Then there consist of three rounds : First round: 1 hour consist of problem solving, OOP, DBMS. 2nd Round: almost similar, problem was little bit harder(Leetcode medium). Then In the last round, it is considered to be COO round. But before that, I was given three easy problem by HR(Leetcode Easy I guess). I easily solved them within 20-22 minutes. Then two junior engineer comes to evaluate them. But I quickly understand that, their behaviour was sooo absurd. They were literally trying their 100% to find out the issues in the code. On the last problem, I was iterating an loop from 0 to 7 instead of 8(just my counting issue fr). Even I found out the issue in front of them and corrected it. But they were behaving as if I made the biggest bug ever. Guess what, after 1 week, the cancel letter comes that, "I do have technical ability issue". But I think even GMs can make this simple and silly error, man! We11dev authority, you evaluate 1st and 2nd rounds with senior/lead engineers but evaluate the final rounds with some "low" mentalities junior engineers?? Like Seriously?? The way they take the interview to degrade the mentalities of interviewee cannot be compared. I asked these similar issues with my different friends and all were saying thr same thing. The last round management is horrondous. Please We11dev, make necessary steps to eradicate so called "stupid junior interviewers" from the last round.

comments.comment_text: disagree

Skill or luck issue I guess. I found their engineers very helpful during the online interviews, and in the final round,┬а two of the code reviewers were really friendly. And I was impressed by their COO's behaviour.
And finally,┬а I got the offer today.
An interview is about 60% skills and 40% luck. Market is really competitive, a slight mistake is enough to get rejected as there are so many applicants who may be better than you. You need to accept this and prepare yourself well.┬а
Trust me,┬а this is something I've learned from interviewing at companies like Enosis, Kona, Chaldal and Welldev. Guess what? I received offer letters from two of them already.
So, best of luck -- prepare yourself well!
The same shit happened to me, bro! In the 3rd round, I interviewed so-called 5 yoe seniors with no professionalism.┬а
When have you gave the COO round? and when you were informed about the Rejection mail?

post_title: Goriv but its okay
full_review: Currently Truck Dorkar is going with some serious financial problem. The CEO isn't enable to find funding from abroad. But its okay. They can quickly recover it, it may take maybe 1-1.5 year. Then the company can rise again. Overall the company is pretty decent company. The problem is in the tech team. I remember, their serious level of sacking introduce a "junior" SQA engineer to "lead"SQA. I know that manual testers don't need to be senior, specially here in TL.┬а But this event tells that the company has some serious level of mismanagement. Again the rest two leads have very limited tech knowledge as well as management skills. They fail misarably to introduce proper software engineering practice in the team. No testing codes, no proper code evaluation, no documentation, no design patterns and code strategies -- nothing is managed here properly. You can't make proper improvement by joining their team as well. Overall the company works with very basic things. Nothing specials indeed. Still the sprint periods are soo long and the poor maintainability of software principles are because of these poor skilled Leads. You find many other telling that the work pressures are too much. But things are actually different in real life. They just cant finish in time due to the leaders quality issue. On the otherhand, The CTO tried his level best to ensure┬а the harmonies among the teams. But sooner he will leave as well(I heard from other current employee). Well it may be the beginning of some serious level degradation for the team xD. Truck Dorkar must consider hiring top notch software engineer from the other companies. Otherwise these leads will finish the overall company's tech culture. The CEO must take it seriously.

post_title: Leave & Office Holiday Policy.
full_review: Let's start with the good thing, they'll allow you 22 days' casual leave. Generally, there's no hard restriction on taking those leaves. However, you'll have to inform the office around 25-30 days earlier, unless there's an emergency. & There's no office politics, the environment is professional, you'll have mental peace and a good vibe from that side. The office allows 13 public holidays, chosen by the office, but some of them will surely be eaten up by weekends. And, they'll not reschedule, even if it's on EID. So this time, there's only 1 Day Eid Vacation + 2 days Weekend. That's it! Almost the same thing happened on the last EID; one day of the EID vacation was eaten up by the weekend. So, if the plan is to provide 10 holidays, it should be declared so, and the major occasions should be prioritized. There are more things to discuss, but let's keep those for some other time. In general, BD software firms treat engineers as sugarcane and try to produce as much juice as possible, without wasting a single drop. I think this trend has increased in recent years.

post_title: Feedback on the current Dir3ctor of Engineering at Th3rapтАЩs BD office
full_review: There is an individual currently serving as the Dir3ctor of Engineering at Th3rapтАЩs BD office. He has been disconnected from hands-on team management and coding for several years. He is a key source of resistance to adopting new ideas or technologies and frequently offers opinions on matters beyond his expertise, often impeding progress. In meetings or discussions, he dominates the conversation, ignoring the context and the fact that others may not need to hear everything he says, especially when itтАЩs unrelated to their work. He often pressures team members to conduct research for him, without recognizing that they have higher-priority tasks that are scheduled for production. He lacks a realistic understanding of how long tasks take to complete, often setting impractical deadlines and even expecting people to work on holidays. His instructions are frequently unclear, and if any detail is missed, he responds harshly. Overall, he lacks the empathy necessary for effective collaboration.

post_title: Leadership Hazard
full_review: This company is suffering due to poor leadershipтАФand even worse, itтАЩs an engineering company led by HR, where sometimes technical decisions are made by HR people. ЁЯША Someone with no real skills was given a leadership role, while experienced leaders were pushed aside. Top management, especially HR, values personal connections over actual performance. ThereтАЩs even a rumor that a senior leader was removed from a client meeting due to repeated failures. Tasks are pushed down without guidanceтАФif it goes well, leaders take credit; if it fails, you take the blame. The hiring process is a mess. Many people avoid interviewing here altogether. HR is biasedтАФsalary reviews only happen on time if youтАЩre close to them. Even in HR team hardworking HR are ignored, while inactive ones are promoted through connections. There are no real benefitsтАФjust the salary. You might work holidays or weekends, but thereтАЩs no bonus. Even taking earned leave is a struggle, and sometimes public holidays require permission. Sometimes, HR invites only certain teams for lunch (usually chicken biryani), while others just watch. HR and finance leaders go on foreign tripsтАФlikely using company moneyтАФyet engineering teams are denied even the most basic requests. Occasionally, snacks are given, but only to those who stay at the office late like 8PM or 9PM. Job roles are unclearтАФyouтАЩll do everything while others do nothing. Promotions depend on who HR likes, not your work. No clear goals, no growth plans, and no proper training. Some employees asked for platforms like Udemy, but HR created a copy-paste version, assigned after office hours, and even marked wrong answers as correct ЁЯдг In the end, youтАЩre treated more like a factory worker than a tech professional. Hard work doesnтАЩt matterтАФonly office politics does. This place is a textbook example of leadership hazard.

comments.comment_text: The HR head and senior HR are two cute professionals who will utter words like professional, compassionate and cooperative but doesn't do a thing.┬а

post_title: Immediate recruitment, immediately revoked
full_review: @GT is not a software company. ItтАЩs basically just a middleman between clients and talent. They offer big salaries to attract candidates, but the entire process is a mess. They pressured me for immediate joining тАФ тАЬwe need urgent hiring, can you join right away?тАЭ тАФ but on the joining day , they sent an email saying тАЬwe canтАЩt proceed because of project priority shifts.тАЭ Seriously? After multiple interviews, hours of discussions, HR pep talks, and big promises about salary, growth, and facilities тАФ at the end, it was all just empty talk. The HR and even their so-called management sold dreams, but nothing happened. Just wasted my time. Don't resigned from your current job because of their fake commitment. Never trust words тАФ get everything official and in writing. If youтАЩre thinking about joining @GT, think 100 times. ItтАЩs high risk and can screw up your career. DonтАЩt fall for the nice words тАФ actions matter, not promises.

post_title: Negative interview experience
full_review: Totally unprofessional behaviour from the interviewer and HR. Had an interview at certain time suddenly HR called and told me if I am free then let's conduct the interview. I said I was free so HR told me to join the link and wait for 2 minutes. Joined and waited 15 minutes in my office day. Called and asked him what's the issue, he said the previous interview is still going on so wait 5 minutes. Even after around 10 minutes no call or anything. Called again and asked what was the issue, he informed me same thing. Then I got frustrated and told him my office is going on so I can't waste anymore time if you can reschedule do it or just leave me out of it. Interviewers joined the call then Imao. If you can't manage the time schedule then please don't hassle the person. Still don't know why the HR told me to join the link before 30 minutes of my scheduled time. Interview questions were easy but due to frustration and sweating like hell ignored some of the questions during the interview. The HR said this was just some informal interview but the interviewer were almost asking in depth question's in 15 minutes like some rapid fire round.

post_title: Toxic Culture and One-Man Show Leadership | Not recommended тАФ unless youтАЩre fine playing politics and staying silent.
full_review: My time at M0nstar1ab Bangladesh was, unfortunately, one of the most disheartening professional experiences IтАЩve had. While the company tries to present itself as a global, standard-setting workplace, the reality on the inside was deeply concerning тАФ and at times, downright toxic. LetтАЩs start with the work environment. It was anything but healthy. Office politics were a daily survival game. Favoritism, cliques, and inner circles determined your career path тАФ not your talent, not your dedication, and certainly not your performance. If you werenтАЩt aligned with the right group or didnтАЩt conform to certain personalities, your chances of being recognized or promoted were slim to none. The CT0 ran the show like a one-man army. All decisions тАФ from technical strategy to performance evaluations тАФ were driven by his perspective alone. Constructive disagreement was not welcome. If you didnтАЩt echo his thoughts, you were sidelined or worse, subtly labeled as a тАЬnon-team player.тАЭ The performance metrics used to evaluate employees were entirely set by the CT0 тАФ vague, unrealistic at times, and constantly shifting based on mood or bias. Appraisals were a joke. Promotions and salary revisions had less to do with achievement and more to do with which group you belonged to or how often you agreed with upper management. It was an environment where speaking up meant putting your career at risk. Worst of all were the internal communications. Some emails sent by leadership тАФ especially during restructuring and layoffs тАФ were incredibly unprofessional and, frankly, toxic. Instead of showing empathy or transparency, they felt accusatory, defensive, and borderline threatening. It was hard to believe those messages came from a so-called international company. M0nstar1ab Bangladesh had the potential to be a standout tech employer in the country. Sadly, that potential was buried under ego-driven leadership, unhealthy politics, and a complete lack of ethical culture. I truly hope the company takes a long, hard look inward before more talented people walk away feeling the same way I did.

comments.comment_text:
Have to disagree with you here. Let's go over this point by point:

Work environment: You mention office politics as "a daily surviving game." Don't see where you get this, since I have never been part of any politics, never tagged along on any tours or casual after-office conversations either. The lack of filter on my speech would never let me be part of any inner circles or cliques. I have a bad rep for quite a few things, but my performance has always been appreciated.
The CTO: Can't really say much regarding this. I don't think I have spoken more than 10 sentences with them over the last few years. I honestly didn't even like some things they said. Regardless, I never had to directly bother myself about appeasing their ego. Maybe you were close to him or something.
Appraisals: As far as I know, appraisals have been close to industry standards. Please define "Joke".
Internal communications: You mention internal communications, then refer to more or less the saddest and hardest time of the company over the past few years. I didn't get caught in the layoffs, and I didn't read into the emails much. But I think manage internal communications over Slack a lot better than most do.

You have a right to your opinion, but I suggest you look inwards. Maybe not get involved in the politics at all? Maybe not stir up baseless conversations with the CTO? Maybe if you get silenced, you should have talked to some others regarding your issues? Job environments are competitive. If you consistently find a way to get into people's bad books, you definitely won't feel at home anywhere. Good luck.

post_title: Six years. Still unpaid. Still carrying the trauma.
full_review: They owe me five months of salary тАФ and after all this time, nothing . In those six years, theyтАЩve raised funding , relaunched their product , and reinvented their brand more than once. They moved forward. We тАФ the ones who built it тАФ were left behind. They only paid those who could force them . I wasnтАЩt one of those people. I asked, waited, struggled , and got silence . Worse, they went out of their way to keep me from quitting тАФ making false promises, delaying, manipulating. It wasnтАЩt mismanagement. It was intentional. To this day, I donтАЩt know if theyтАЩre still operating. Maybe they vanished, maybe they just changed their name. But I do know this: they left people like me with real scars тАФ financial, emotional, and professional. IтАЩve moved on . IтАЩm doing well now. But what they did тАФ the stress, the betrayal, the toll it took тАФ still haunts me. And no success I achieve now will ever justify the way they treated those who gave them everything. If you're building a company, remember: how you treat people matters more than any launch, funding round, or PR win . Your team is not disposable.

post_title: On-time salary, everything else disappointing.
company_name: Int3grat3d Bus!ness Sy5tems & Solutions Pvt Ltd
full_review: During my time at !BSS, I encountered several challenges that significantly impacted my overall experience with the company. One positive aspect worth mentioning is that salaries are paid on time, which offers a sense of financial reliability. However, this is overshadowed by a number of critical issues. The company lacks a defined office culture, and there are no established best practices for software development. Projects are often managed without proper planning, code review standards, or structured workflows, leading to confusion and inefficiency. Another major concern is the mismatch between roles and responsibilitiesтАФemployees are frequently hired under one title and assigned unrelated tasks, with little to no alignment with their expertise. The increment process lacks transparency and consistency, with no formal evaluations or commitments from management. Furthermore, there is no active HR policy, no internal communication or notices, and no acknowledgment of employee milestones, such as farewells or achievements. Facilities are also below standardтАФoffice lunch is poor in both quality and variety, contributing to an overall lack of care for employee well-being. In summary, while timely salary payments are appreciated, the absence of structure, support, and professionalism makes IBSS a difficult place for personal and career growth. Caution is advised for anyone considering a long-term role here.

post_title: Positive Sides
full_review: I know there might be some harsh comments on this post тАФ many people have shared the negative sides of Div!ne IT. And perhaps some of them are true. Since IтАЩve only worked here for a short time, I canтАЩt speak about everything. But I still want to highlight the good parts I personally experienced. I joined Div!ne IT as a Trainee Software Engineer in the Java team , and I had the privilege of working with an amazing group of people. One thing I truly appreciated was how much emphasis our team put on learning. Our team manager often visited us, asked about our progress, discussed various technologies, and guided us on what and how to learn. As a junior developer, I wasnтАЩt pushed into production-level work right away. Instead, we were encouraged to focus on learning тАФ and that made a big difference in my growth. Whenever I got stuck on a task, I never felt hesitant to ask for help. The team would immediately say things like, "AnyDesk e asho... bolo kothay atkaiso?" тАФ and not once did I feel like I was bothering them. They helped me out like big brothers would, always with patience and kindness. IтАЩll definitely miss the little things тАФ like our coolest team lead saying, тАЬBoys, cholo ajk baire lunch koriтАЭ , and the casual chats under Moin BhaiтАЩs shop after lunch. Those moments turned our team into more than just coworkers тАФ we became friends. And, "Kothy? Niche namo...." After six months at Div!ne IT, I can confidently say that although I had decent problem-solving skills, I lacked technical depth. But being in that team helped me overcome that. The tech discussions, the guidance on what to learn and how тАФ all of that prepared me for bigger things. Today, when I crack interviews at companies, itтАЩs because Div!ne IT laid the foundation. Some might ask тАФ if it was so good, then why leave? To them, IтАЩll say: maybe if I had a better opportunity earlier, I wouldnтАЩt have come here at all. But now that I do, and with some family matters as well, it feels like the right time to move on. I wonтАЩt deny that others may have had difficult experiences тАФ my journey was short and I was still junior, so I may not have seen it all. But I believe in giving credit where it's due. For me, Div!ne IT gave me knowledge, growth, friendships, a relaxed team culture, and lots of memories тАФ all in a short time. IтАЩve left the company, but IтАЩll always carry forward the good I received. If people want to share negative experiences, I respect their stories. But this is mine тАФ and IтАЩm thankful for it.

post_title: Worst work Culture in Banking IT Industry ЁЯШиЁЯШи
full_review: If you want a healthy work-life balance, good leadership, and a chance to grow тАФ D33L Bank is not for you. ItтАЩs a toxic place where real effort is ignored, and only staying late and oiling is appreciated. 1.Long Office Hours Even though the official time is 9 to 6, most people have to stay much longer, often until late at night. Staying late is seen as more important than working smart. 2.No Creativity or New Ideas There is no space for thinking differently or bringing new ideas. Most of the time, people just follow old ways without trying to improve anything. 3.Useless Senior Executives (AVP and Above) Except for a few, most senior executives have no technical knowledge. They donтАЩt understand the systems or the work, but still make decisions without listening to the right people. 4.In-charge Without Real Leadership Skills The team in-charge only cares about people who flatter him. He doesnтАЩt understand project management, gives deadlines without checking the work, and thinks working late means working hard. 5.No Career Growth There is no proper training or learning. You will do the same thing for years without getting new responsibilities or real promotions. 6.Toxic Work Culture The environment is very stressful. ThereтАЩs no peace or calm тАФ just pressure, shouting, and last-minute work. ItтАЩs hard to stay mentally healthy. 7.Leaving on Time? YouтАЩll Be Targeted If someone leaves on time, they are treated badly the next day. Team leads try to keep them late, even if thereтАЩs no urgent work or if that person had a real reason to leave early.

post_title: Beware of fake reviews and a honest review
full_review: 1. ┬а ┬а It is inaccurate to generalize that all team leads are underperforming. While some may not meet expectations, others are competent and effective in their roles. 2. ┬а ┬а The company has a diverse portfolio of successful applications beyond just "Ringtone Maker" and "Wallpaper Maker." 3. ┬а ┬а The company provides a valuable learning environment where many employees, especially interns and junior dev, have developed their skills and advanced their careers. 4. ┬а ┬а All companies are increasingly encouraging the use of AI tools to enhance productivity and innovation. 5. ┬а ┬а Engaging in personal attacks is unprofessional and can undermine the credibility of the team or its leadership. It is important to address issues constructively. 6. ┬а ┬а Criticisms of the SEO or Marketing team may have some validity. The decision to disband the whole SEO team raises questions about the leadership of two bosses. 7. ┬а ┬а Previously, the two bosses were constantly monitoring you like a satellite. From what I have heard, the situation has improved significantly now. So, staying longer in office just to show the two bosses that you are a hard worker might not be correct. 8. ┬а ┬а Resorting to personal insults, such as calling someone a "clown," is unprofessional and reflects poorly on the individual making such comments. 9. ┬а ┬а The company is far from being a friendly workplace where everyone gets along. There is a significant number of internal politics, and I personally experienced the negative effects of it. Anyone reading the reviews can easily see that I am telling the truth. 10.┬а ┬аFavoritism exists in many companies, and it is important to recognize that the CTO, may have his own priorities and interests to consider. 11.┬а ┬аThere is a common sentiment that management expects high levels of effort from employees, but the rewards, such as salary increments, may not always align with the level of work put in. 12.┬а ┬аThe company strives for high quality products but may not always provide the same level of support or recognition to its employees. The MD will try to convince you that your working conditions are better than those of a garment worker. Do not just take my word for it ask the honorable MD or any former employee yourself. 13.┬а ┬аManagement is not interested in your input. They obviously doing something right, that must be why I earn less than my former colleague. After all, not every company can afford to pay senior developers a salary of 140000 to 150000. 14.┬а ┬аIf the dev team is d0gsh1t then who is making the apps that generate the salary of Analyst team? This one sentence alone shows the entire review was fake. 15.┬а ┬аIt is unproductive to place blame solely on the marketing team. The company has grown significantly over time and is now a leading iOS app development firm in the country, which is a testament to the collective efforts of all teams. 16.┬а ┬аSome good personality can be ruined by Some chutiya personality, but many employees still thrive in the company. Navigating office politics is a skill that employees need to develop. 17.┬а ┬аLinus tech tips or PC builder Bangladesh seriously!!! Do you have any idea how software company functions? I have tried to address as many comments as possible, and no one should spread false information about any company.

post_title: Avoid R!seup
full_review: Avoid R!seup Labs Like a Bad WiFi Connection тАФ Totally Useless Management & False Promises! I was hired by R!seup Labs last month for a Voice Campaign project тАФ sounded promising at first. They hired 20 of us, told us it was a 6-month contract with decent pay. Great, right? Wrong. Fast forward to exactly 1 month and 7 days in тАФ we get a sudden notice: тАЬCampaign is no longer available, youтАЩre all on break.тАЭ What does "on break" even mean when you were promised a contract ? are we getting paid a single penny while we on break? no bro. A few more days pass and suddenly weтАЩre told, тАЬWeтАЩll try our best to move you to another campaign.тАЭ Oh wait тАФ the pay there is 60% of what we were hired for! Oh, and guess what? Out of 18 remaining people, only FOUR got called back for this "amazing opportunity." If this is how they "manage" things, IтАЩd hate to see what happens if they ever run something important, like air traffic control. This company is a circus without a ringmaster. The management? Useless. Their planning? Nonexistent. Their promises? About as solid as a house of cards in a Dhaka storm. If I could drop a small nuke anywhere in Dhaka, it would 100% be on Nator3 Tower тАФ where both R!seup Labs and their evil twin 5kytech (another shoddy BPO) are located. The building seems cursed with the worst employers in the city. To anyone even thinking about going there for an interview тАФ DONтАЩT. JUST DONтАЩT. Save your time, save your sanity, save your bus fare. There are better ways to spend your day тАФ like watching paint dry, or staring at a brick wall. I promise they would be needing to hire twenty more people in the business team to overcome what I am about to do to them via reviews and connections of mine. Peace out.

post_title: Bad Management and TOXIC environment
full_review: -> Project coordinators lack proper understanding of SDLC and documentation practices, which often leads to unnecessary challenges for developers. DEADLOCK Projects. ->A significant number of employees do not come from a CS background, resulting in low adaptability to new technologies and poor technical integrity. Outdated tools are commonly used, and any attempt to raise concerns is often met with unprofessional responses, such as тАЬApni janen nah!тАЭ - BRUH MOMENT ЁЯдб -> BUSINESS TEAM SLEEPING ON THE BACK. -> Interns are frequently overburdened with responsibilities, being expected to handle entire projects with minimal guidance or support. This is an unreasonable and exploitative practice. NOT EVERYONE BECOMES NARUTO. HE HAD JIRAIYA. BWAHAHAHA -> The salary structure is so LOW, leading to high employee turnover and a general lack of motivation to remain with the company long-term.

post_title: Scammers of the highest order
full_review: I along with 17 others were hired for a big campaign which was promised to go on for 6 months, 1 month into the campaign the project was nuked. Evidence points to them never intending to run for 6 months, rather test the waters. They never respected our time, didn't give a crap about our livelihoods either. They only have 2 running campaigns and can't seem to onboard clients. This was just a facade to show foreign clients they possess a big workforce. Most us will probably be let go, while a few will be assigned to lower pay campaigns. Moral of the story: Only join if you're ok with broken promises, lies, awful communication.

post_title: A toxic workplace disguised as a corporate office, where survival depends more on bootlicking than merit.
full_review: Alright, IтАЩm going to tell you the real story now. So, how will you be treated once youтАЩre enrolled there? The reality is: if youтАЩre not a true bootlicker, this place might be hard for you to survive in. Only the genuine bootlickers can sustain themselves here. TheyтАЩre given special treatmentтАФlike getting to sit next to the team lead, working тАЬexclusivelyтАЭ with them, and other perks. And the rest of the team members? Who cares what they do? They have to go through an intensive 3тАУ4 round exam process just to get into the company, so clearly, anyone who makes it is qualified. But in reality, not everyone is treated the same. The bootlicking culture I mentioned? ItтАЩs very real here. Office hours officially end at 7, but if you work past 7, congratulationsтАФyouтАЩre safe from getting fired. They claim to play everything тАЬby the book,тАЭ but every day thereтАЩs a new shenanigan. YouтАЩll see it when it happens. Oh, and donтАЩt expect any transparencyтАФtheyтАЩll fire you at the last minute, in the last hour, of the last month. You wonтАЩt even see it coming. DONтАЩT FALL FOR THEIR тАШHAPPY SOCIAL MEDIAтАЩ CAMPAIGN! This is just a warning to anyone whoтАЩs thinking about joining that godown of a company. I genuinely wish everyone a happy and fulfilling career elsewhere. There are certain managers who act like they know everythingтАФwhich is a blatant lie. The Chief Operating Officer? DoesnтАЩt have much to do except monitor CCTV cameras. YouтАЩd expect to feel tired after working 8 hours straightтАФbut thereтАЩs no real break. When you're bored, thereтАЩs nothing to do. You canтАЩt go anywhere except the toilet. Maybe grab a cup of bland coffee from the canteenтАФbut even that is monitored: how long you take, how often you go. This doesnтАЩt feel like a company. More like a garment factoryтАФexcept youтАЩre stuck with a computer instead of a sewing machine.

post_title: Good company with Big Vision. Bold Code. Bright Future
full_review: There are plenty of great things about working here, from timely salaries and top-tier leadership to a culture that supports learning and trusts you to deliver without micromanagement. Salary is always paid on time, not even a day late. Competitive salary compared to the Bangladeshi market. Annual salary reviews are conducted on time. Leadership is amazing, top-notch quality. Generous salary increments, among the best in Bangladesh. Full flexibility for learning, exploring, and R&D with new technologies. Management focuses on your work, not micromanagement. ThereтАЩs no tracking, youтАЩll only be noticed if you consistently fail to deliver. If you lack certain skills, the company and management will give you time and support to learn and improve. Nothing is perfect, and of course, there are areas where management can make improvements: Update the bonus policy to offer 50% yearly bonuses for permanent employees. Efforts are being made to reduce work pressure and improve work-life balance , especially in certain projects. As far as I know, all projects except Bangladeshi ones are currently maintaining a healthy balance. Consider adding additional employee benefits , such as gratuity , health insurance , and leave encashment . Arrange at least one national or international team trip each year to boost team bonding and motivation.

post_title: Waste your time to join here
full_review: Pros : There is not a single pros here . Cons : Reasonable leave requests were not approved, even in cases where time off was necessary. Salaries were rarely paid on time, causing financial inconvenience and stress. Management was consistently late in evaluating and providing salary increments. There was little to no transparency or timely communication from HR or management regarding salary and policy changes. Employee efforts were often overlooked, and there was minimal support or appreciation for hard work.

post_title: Life is a joke, bro?
full_review: Yah, good workplace and everything else. They'll make you sign NDA: stay 2 years at least or else you gotta pay some big amount, if you plan to leave. For experienced personnels getting in (4-6+ years of experience) you might find difficulties in pulling up mark because, they will run training program. You'll need to score 180 mark at least, out of 200 to sustain or else you'll be out. If you are a person of muscle memory and, supposedly an average student (during education period) and you have trouble with memory or at least memorizing (to pass the course at least), this workplace is not for you. Trainers are biased towards good 'students' and they have a 'mental issue'. If you are making mistakes while working, their words will fuck you up in the head. Corporate, as they'd talk like but, trust me, if you are a stuggling incumbent, you'll lose hope when you listen as they speak. Office would look like cool, but, when you walk past, everyone be like, whispering as if they are in some danger. Everyone's face is like, they are always afraid of something. However, you get paid timely. And you want to know something funny? Out of nowhere, they'll kick you out! Believe me guys and girls, you'll be just OUT. They'll make your CV look bad and, believe me, after you are out, you'll be in deep shit! They run batches of recruitment process and they will make you visit 5 times for assessment. You want travel fares like other good workplaces are offering? Forget it. They'll just suck the life out of you. You get in after series of assessments, your next fear would be surviving the product knowledge chapter, I mentioned above. Join there IF you are a GOOD student and your brain is good! Or else, avoid. I'm suffering now as of career. They made my life a joke.

post_title: Never Fall in a Trap by seeing Facebook post

post_title: Best for Civil Engineers, Not the same for Software Engineers
full_review: If you're a Civil Engineer considering to join, this is a great company for career. If you're a diploma engineer joining, the pressure is a bit high but overall good growth. But if you're a software engineer, you experience will vary across teams. If you work in Re##a team, you have the best side of this company. Team leads and teammates are super helpful, you will use the latest technologies with best enviornment. If you work in AI Team, remember this is truly not AI team. It's actually automation team. You will make life of Civil Engineers easy whether through python script or ML model. If you want independent work that will challenge you, this is pretty neat team. Teammates are helpful. But get ready to get roasted by the dutch owner of the company. Dont take it too personally and you'll be fine. Sometimes you might have to work a bit longer but not too frequently. Then there comes the core team. There are two parts of this team. Both are shit. Shitty team leads. Older technologies. Longer work hours. No good planning. Seniors will criticize you whatever you do. The codebases are super messy. No career progression. Seniors dont take feedbacks. Only what they think right are right. Only good thing about this team is your job will be secure as no one will be able to understand this shitty legacy codebase (especially the BGT team codebase). Also get ready to use SVN. Some other overall stuff: 10 sick days, 10 casual leaves. Leave will depend on team lead a bit. Decent starting salary and increment. Never got late salary, sometimes got early salary during eid season. Has provident fund. Provides lunch and snacks. 9 hours time is 1 hour break (30 min lunch, 2 breaks of 15 mins for tea and snacks)

post_title: Fraud, unprofessional Management
full_review: The Dark Reality of Working at P!xmat3ch Limited I feel compelled to speak out about my deeply disappointing and painful experience at P!xmat3ch Limited тАФ a company that has proven to be the epitome of unprofessionalism, mismanagement, and deception. From the very top, the leadership structure is a complete disaster. The Chairman, Managing Director, Founder/Director, and CEO have collectively demonstrated a shocking lack of knowledge, vision, and integrity. These individuals do not even understand the fundamental principles of software development or how to lead a tech-driven company. Under their so-called leadership, employees are treated as disposable, with no respect for their hard work, time, or livelihood. WhatтАЩs even more distressing is that two months of employee salaries were withheld without explanation or resolution . Despite continuous promises, we were left unpaid and unheard тАФ a betrayal of trust and a clear violation of basic professional ethics. And now, it appears they are attempting to vanish without any accountability. The situation worsens when we look at the actions of the Project Manager/Chief Operating Officer (PM/COO) тАФ the individual most responsible for the companyтАЩs internal collapse. His toxic leadership style, poor decision-making, and unethical favoritism toward two specific female employees completely derailed the working environment. Instead of fostering productivity and collaboration, he brought in a culture of politics, manipulation, and chaos . It became evident that he lacks the skills, temperament, and ethical compass required to lead a team or a company. The atmosphere at P!xmat3ch quickly turned toxic, draining the morale and motivation of every talented individual who once believed in the companyтАЩs potential. It became a place where politics thrived, while talent, transparency, and hard work were dismissed. To anyone considering working with or for P!xmat3ch Limited тАФ proceed with extreme caution. This is not a tech company built on innovation or vision; it's a house of cards run by individuals unfit to lead, manage, or even understand the basics of the industry they claim to represent. I share this not out of bitterness, but from a sense of responsibility тАФ to warn others and to stand up for the value of honest work, skilled professionals, and ethical leadership.

They lack even a basic understanding of software development or what it takes to run a modern, tech-driven organization. Their mismanagement has fostered a toxic environment where employees are treated not as valued contributors, but as disposable resources.
WhatтАЩs more appalling is their blatant disregard for ethical standards. For two entire months, employee salaries were withheld without justification or communication. Repeated assurances were made, but ultimately, we were ignored тАФ left unpaid, disrespected, and deceived. This isnтАЩt just mismanagement тАФ itтАЩs a betrayal of trust and a serious breach of professional conduct. And now, their disappearance act signals a desperate attempt to escape responsibility.
Adding fuel to the fire is the disastrous role played by the Project Manager/Chief Operating Officer. His leadership was the catalyst for the companyтАЩs internal collapse. Through toxic behavior, reckless decisions, and shameless favoritism toward two specific female employees, he decimated any sense of fairness, productivity, or morale. Instead of building a functional team, he promoted division, manipulation, and office politics. His lack of professional maturity, leadership capability, and ethical grounding made him a liability, not a leader.
This was not a failure of a few decisions тАФ it was the complete failure of leadership at every level.

post_title: Time for Legal Consequences for Adv3ntur3
full_review: Adv3ntur3 has taken the shocking and unjust step of abruptly dismissing over 90 employees, without any prior notice or fair process. In a move that reeks of irresponsibility and disregard for employee rights, the company seized everyoneтАЩs laptops under the pretext of an "audit." To make matters worse, over the weekend, they sent out an email instructing employees not to come in at their regular time, effectively leaving them in the dark about their status. This is an illegal and unethical action that targets the hardworking software engineers of Bangladesh. Such treatment is not only a violation of labor laws but also a blatant assault on the dignity of the employees. This cannot and should not be allowed to happen. Legal action must be taken to hold the company accountable for this wrongful behavior

post_title: Narrow-minded CE0
full_review: If you are a fresher and in desperate need of job you can consider this company. The only thing you will get from this company is your salary and experience you can add in your CV, that's all. Theres no Eid bonus or any kind of bonus only salary, even that isnt certain when you will get paid, some people has left without getting their last month/months salaries. If you want a day leave they will assume youre asking for a leave to go on an interview because even they know people doesnt stay long in their company. And the most common dialogue of CE0 when people ask for salary is "The company is operating at a loss and has run out of cash." According to them its around 20 years old company and yet they operate from a 3 room apartment. The company hasnтАЩt grown much over all this time.

post_title: Its a circus
full_review: A few years back I used to work there for sometime. Its a complete heaven with such nice interior and peaceful ambience with very supportive and cooperative teams mates all over the place, except one giant jerk ! His name is Mik*ail who is the freaking A-hole that claims to be the MD of the company yet the only qualification he holds is his mom and dad owned the land where this structure is built !!! The freak doesn't even know how to run the office, even when everything runs ok, he will suddenly move into it and ruin the normal momentum!!! His attitude is like a dictator and his favourite quote is "Tahole ki kora uchit silo?" Whereas, in 99% cases he does some blunder and then tries to put it on the staff by saying "Tahole apnar ki kora uchit silo?" as if he is a feeder drinking infant who needs to be reminded and asked for tasks over and over - even if the employees ask him over and over to do something, he keeps his own way of ignoring that reminder entirely and then when shit hits the fan, he starts shouting at the people who reminded him for the task! Funny part is, he claims he is a super professional but in reality the whole company is nothing but a building's owner office where he dreams to be a king of his own kingdom. He will show big dreams and initiatives at the time of interview and then after joining you will find a place where you are nothing but a punching bag! People join and leave or asked to leave very frequently, even one week after joining people start to search a way out of this place just for this guy. Be aware and unless you have no income source at all, stay away from this company.

post_title: Toxic culture
full_review: The CE0 is a very mean person and he created an environment to please him whether he is right or wrong. And whatever facilities you have taken, you have to follow their ridiculous rules that are not included on the policy doc. Frustrating is that employess are being questioned about casual/sick leave but for his favourite employees, this is not applicable! Adding with that how much you have spent on restroom will also be counted whatever gender you are. CCTV are installed to micromanage employees, sometime they zoom in the camera to see what are actually an employee working. Even they are given restriction on LinkedIn usage, though its a personal platform for individuals. Never ever recommended anyone to go there.

post_title: The Curious Chronicle of a Simple Soul
full_review: They say the corporate world builds character. They never warn you what it might break first. I joined the company with modest hopes, a quiet desk, some decent work, and the promise of a timely paycheck. Instead, I got ghost bosses, vibe-based engineering, and more strikes than a baseball season. Here's my story. The boss seemed decent at first. Talkative, but respectable. I figured he was just busy; he rarely interacted with the devs, so I kept my head down and did my job. Then, one fine day in August, he disappeared. No messages, no meetings, no "Out of Office" auto-reply. Just radio silence. Two weeks later, he resurfaced on a random Google Meet call from the U.S., like some mythical tech nomad. I was relieved. тАЬAt least I still have a job,тАЭ I thought. That was my first mistake. The very next week, we had a тАЬrequirement sessionтАЭ that lasted over four hours. It couldтАЩve been handled in fifteen minutes, twenty if someone needed a coffee break (coffee break? How can someone take a coffee break without any coffee or tea?). Any question we raised was met with the ultimate black hole of decision-making: тАЬWeтАЩll think about it later.тАЭ Thus began our journey into Vibe-Driven DevelopmentтДв . A project built entirely on gut feelings and blurred ideas. Our ERP had no roadmap. Just vibes. The workday officially ended at 7 PM. Reality said otherwise. Meetings bled into 9 PM regularly. And if you survived the evening, there was always the dreaded 11 PM call, featuring BossтАЩs late-night philosophical breakdown of some other companyтАЩs ERP features, which went nowhere. Eventually, I drew the line. I stopped picking up calls after hours. I even politely brought it up. Strike one. Two weeks later, my team lead asked me to apologize to "maintain harmony." I did. Then came my probation review. I asked, тАЬHow am I doing?тАЭ Strike two. Apparently, I was the first person in his 15-year career to ever dare to ask that question. He told me loudly that, by labor law, he could keep me on probation for a year. After his mini meltdown, he calmed down and admitted: тАЬWe donтАЩt have a way to measure performance.тАЭ A 15-year-old company. No metrics. The very next day, he had us install Time Doctor. The twist? We never got company emails. So, using personal ones felt invasive. We made new emails for work use. To this day, not a single email has been sent to them. Ah yes. The silent sport of middle management: blame ping-pong . HR: тАЬBoss didnтАЩt approve the salary.тАЭ Boss: тАЬHR didnтАЩt send the salary sheet.тАЭ Meanwhile, my team? Blissfully uninvolved. We stuck to our work. Which irked him. Deeply. At one point, after another of his clashes with our team lead, he randomly called me, showered me with praise, and said heтАЩd finally make me permanent. After ignoring it for 20 days. It was bait. He wanted me to turn on my lead. I didnтАЩt. Shadow strike unlocked. тАЬIf I start learning Golang today, I can complete user, authentication and authorization service in 4 hours.тАЭ I chuckled. тАЬIt may be funny to you, but itтАЩs the truth.тАЭ тАЬтАжYes, boss.тАЭ This is the same man who thought backend done = project done. API integration? Testing? Parallel universe problems. He once refused to pay for a Postman because: тАЬItтАЩs nighttime there.тАЭ Time zones apparently affect SaaS. He had no concept of backend complexity, timelines, or reality. He believed motivation was more powerful than logic. Our timelines were born from his ego, not estimates. Twelve months. Never once was salary paid before the 10th. Most often? close to 25th. HeтАЩd shrug and say: тАЬDid we miss the month?тАЭ At one point, on the 20th, HR said: тАЬBoss asked you all to make other arrangements. Salary will be delayed.тАЭ I replied, тАЬThis is my arrangement.тАЭ Strike three. After my confirmation, the new salary didnтАЩt reflect in the following month. HR said the papers werenтАЩt signed yet. A whole month had passed. When I asked again? Strike four. He got furious. Said HR could revoke my confirmation at any time. Oh, and if you earned more than 50K? You were automatically bumped to post-15th salary club. Translation: See you on the 25th. Six months in. Four+ strikes. The boss was hinting at hiring new people scare tactics. I finally snapped and resigned. His tone flipped. тАЬWe were about to increase your salary. Why resign? Let me know your preference.тАЭ Right. The truth was, I was resignation #4 that month. No one wanted to join. My PM and lead talked me into staying. So I did, for them. Post-Eid-ul-Fitr, boss cornered me: тАЬAre you okay with me firing the rest of the team? If not, IтАЩll fire you too.тАЭ He tried to make me choose my job over four people. I didnтАЩt. A bonus strike in the spirit of Eid. Eid-ul-Adha approached. No salary. No bonus. We voiced our concern to HR. Next morning: termination letter . Everyone else in other companies got a salary, bonuses, and gifts. I got boxed. My PM called that night. Said HR miscommunicated. The boss didnтАЩt mean it. He wanted to walk it back. But no one said a word about salary. I stood firm: тАЬI have my dignity. IтАЩm not continuing.тАЭ I finally received the salary that everyone got before Eid on June 18, only after I threatened not to serve my notice without it. IтАЩm not sure how many strikes I collected in total, five, six, maybe more. What I do know is that some companies donтАЩt need a villain. They build entire ecosystems where mismanagement, ego, and passive aggression do the job. I stayed longer than I should have, not for the job, but for the people beside me. ThatтАЩs the only thing I donтАЩt regret. And that, dear reader, is the curious chronicle of a simple soul.

post_title: Toxic Work Culture and Poor Management.
company_name: Int3grat3d Bus!ness Sy5tems & Solutions Pvt Ltd
full_review: I worked for nearly 1.5 years, and unfortunately, my experience was far from positive. The company suffers from a toxic work culture , where junior employees are routinely disrespected by senior members. Rather than fostering a supportive environment, the leadership often behaves in an unprofessional and demeaning manner. Discrimination within teams is apparent, and thereтАЩs a serious lack of empathy or regard for employee well-being. WhatтАЩs worse, despite my continued dedication and contributions, I did not receive any promotion or salary increment during my entire tenure. There is no transparent growth path , and hard work often goes unrecognized. The management system is disorganized and ineffective , with poor decision-making and little to no value placed on employee feedback. ItтАЩs deeply disappointing to see a company operate with such disregard for professionalism and ethics. there are so many fucking developers named ABM Nasim. this guy is a bitch. and the team leader Who works in pubali bank.also works here for money such a low people. Even though I went to the office at 9:30 in the morning, they would keep me locked up until 7-8 at night. I hope this review helps others make informed decisions. If you're looking for respect, career growth, and a healthy work culture , this may not be the right place. dont go there Even if you are in a serious ┬аsituation.

post_title: From Employee's Favorite to a Company in Transition
full_review: 1. Let's start with the layoff which started recently and now it is the best topic to gossip. It's totally understandable that there are few employee who are not enough capable to cope up with the company transition, so they are being laid off. This is very normal for a fast growing company. They were totally judged on their performance and capabilities, not in any other factor and they have been provided 2 months salary in advance along with the necessary documents before terminating their contract which is really good and no one is talking about it. 2. Now let me come to the everyone's favorite engineering manager. Yes, you know who. I saw most of the reviews are about appreciation of the favorite manager. What I want to say is, from my perspective, his greatest talent is climbing up so high without having any talent. I mean just think about it, he made his work done by delegating to his colleague and once that is done, he is taking the full credit and not giving any appreciation or credit to the colleague. The work he is showing off to the management and the management be like - Wah plasmid Wah ! How many of you can do that? While you worked hard on your desk for his task, he went to the management, shared his ideas, took other's efforts as his success. There is one proverb in bangla - "ржлрж╛ржБржХрж╛ ржХрж▓рж╕рж┐ ржмрж╛ржЬрзЗ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐". Those who work with him, everyone knows he is a ржлрж╛ржБржХрж╛ ржХрж▓рж╕рж┐. With zero engineering knowledge or capabilities, someone can reach to manage the employees, have you ever thought how much talent it would need? How many of you can do this? His communication skill with the management is excellent but not with the resources he manage but that is the most important part of his job. If you have worked with the Indians, you would know they are exactly like this. They have tons of certification and excellent communication to climb up so high. DS! needs more of this type of people in it's company to be the Titanic. Okay it's getting that 20 page essay that we used to write on Bangla 2nd paper exam. Let's end this point here by sharing his most extraordinary work in my eyes - while everyone is bashing him for being solely dependent on chatgpt for everything, he replied on one post using chatgpt to defend himself. I am asking again, can you do that? Just ask yourself. If not, then this is the reason, he is managing you. 3. Now coming to the employee benefits. I believe DS! has most of the employee benefits but not all that a good sustainable company should have. Apart from the good benefits I would like to suggest introducing Performance Bonus, Profit Share, Provident Fund, 100 % Eid Bonus and Gratuity. Not all of them together but at least start implementing one by one. Like have you ever thought, you are firing people for the future benefits of the company but where are the benefits for your employee's future? Why are the employees in fear due to the layoff? What is their motive to serve you with his hardwork? I mean why would they work for you if they think you are going to fire him when you will think he is not competent to his job? Give them some futuristic reasons to motivate himself to grow more. Why not introducing more employee benefits? If you are planning to continue the layoff based on performance, should the employee do his job or grow him just because of the layoff fear? I mean give them the futuristic benefits, they will not be in fear, they will love to grow with you happily. Otherwise I don't see any employee future other than working with continuous layoff fear. Currently what all benefits you provide, it's all beneficial to their present only, it's not about their future. But you are thinking about your company future where your employees are left behind to think about their future themselves. On top of that, you expect them to believe having a secure future in your company just by saying "No, you are in the safest zone. Don't panic!" Why won't they? After all there is no future benefits plus having a blessed manager like plasmid. 4. DS! deserves appreciation as they went through the Deshi Mula/Oak Thu reviews to act on the constructive reviews. They are really working hard to improve. I really liked this positive approach. 5. DS! is trying to impose some strictness in some aspects which is good and bad perspective to management and employee. As a fast growing company, they need to take some action sometime to keep a balanced environment. But for the employee, it is again the fear of layoff along with loosing the flexibility. So if you ask as an employee, yes flexibility is almost gone. 6. Next, I would like to suggest focusing more on the international market rather than going after the govt projects again and again. Increase the sales person on international platforms. There is only one person who is the only active salesman in the international market, yet he is getting bashed for investing in international market which is the most funniest thing. 7. I don't want to write anything on the HR team since it won't change anything. DS! already knows what and where are the problems and yet they are happy to proceed. After all, who doesn't want the iconic HR vs Employee battle! 8. Overall DS! is a good place to work but with layoff fear. Both management and employee are focusing on growing culture. Hope DS! will try to increase the employee benefits. And why not doing this by introducing a employee benefits team/committee who will work on ensuring the employee benefits so that employee can work fearlessly focusing on growth with mental happiness.

post_title: Let People Disconnect. ItтАЩs Not That Hard
full_review: Does anyone here actually understand what being on leave means? When someone shares their leave dates in advance, that time should be respected тАФ no calls, no pings, no surprise meeting invites. This isnтАЩt a one-off issue. ItтАЩs a pattern across the entire organization. A culture where poor planning, last-minute chaos, and zero ownership are the norm. And when everything falls apart, the default response is to drag others in, regardless of whether theyтАЩre on leave or not. This is not okay. Stop treating employees like 24/7 support agents. Respecting someoneтАЩs time off is the bare minimum. If this company values people, then prove it тАФ not through words or slogans, but through actual behavior. People are exhausted. Not because of hard work, but because boundaries mean nothing here. This needs to change тАФ not eventually, but now.

post_title: Rotten Mula
full_review: I joined as a Software Engineer in 2023 through BGIT Academy training. The only good thing I received from BGIT was this robust and well-structured 4-month training. But they manage most of the training by one Senior Trainer (who is a great trainer). Then I got the opportunity to join BGIT (Engineering Division) with a huge expectation, but I was a fool! There were no big projects, good resources left this workplace already, and the rest are waiting to leave. Managers are good, but if the Sales team is bullshit, you can't get good projects. The marketing, sales, and HR teams were the worst I have faced. And the iron lady of this company is ruining it in all possible ways! I left the company already, as the layoff started a few months back, and it's still going on! If BGIT can get rid of this d*mb lady, it will go back to its successful stage soon.

comments.comment_text: Hello

Hey there, ex BJIT here. It's true that by the time you joined, the company was losing clients. Thanks to the now appointed chief service officer RT and a sales team made up of cavemen. I was there since 2021 and we had a bunch of projects to work on back in the day. Sad to see a great company crumble because an old man wanted some fresh kitty even after 3 marriages.

post_title: Our team lead had limited knowledge
full_review: I worked in the creative team at K!te Game Studio for about 3 years. The company atmosphere was generally supportive and colleagues were always ready to help each other. However, unfortunately, the behavior and attitude of our team lead had a negative impact on the atmosphere of the entire team. Our team lead had limited knowledge of design and often copied the work of others, forcing team members to do the same. Whenever a project brief came from management, he would change it to his liking, which led to a bad reaction to the project. However, he never admitted his own mistakes in these changes, but instead blamed the team members. He created an atmosphere of fear within the team, as if everyone was afraid of him. He could not tolerate anyone's success and often spoke badly about team members behind their backs. He showed no sympathy or support for anyone. Also, he criticized managers behind their backs, but when he was in front of them, he flattered them. There was no employee he did not criticize. He was quite lacking in competence. And I can confidently say that he was an unfit person for his position. Today, due to the influence of a few individuals due to negativity, the official environment of K!te Game Studio has been tarnished, and many employees are now suffering from depression. The most unfortunate thing is that he has dismissed many capable employees from their jobs by providing false information to the management. I have personally witnessed this incident. This company is a good organization, but because of one negative individual, many team members have suffered. I hope that in the future, more awareness will be raised in the leadership of the team and qualified people with real leadership qualities will be placed in such positions.

comments.comment_text:

But looking back, I realize that without that pressure, I might never have pushed myself the way I did. For that, IтАЩm grateful. I forgive him тАФ and I pray that Allah guides and helps him as well.
