His behavior has recently improved dramatically under pressure from above. He is very well behaved and straight personal these days.
Stop exposing him, he has changed his skin. He has been crying about his guilt individually now.If he is kept sad, management will kick us too. Let him be.┬а

post_title: WellDev's Corporate Storytelling
full_review: We11Dev's latest video reveals shocking workplace innovations like "saying hello" and "eating lunch". In a stunning display of corporate storytelling, We11Dev has released what can only be described as the most aggressively ordinary "regular day" video ever produced. Deputy COO bravely demonstrates such cutting edge leadership techniques. 0:08) "Generally, I wake up early in the morning, put on some medication music' - the sound of the alarm helps me trying to remember where I left my phone. ThatтАЩs not even my real alarm, I mostly wake up from CQSOтАЩs pings. And thatтАЩs not my Spotify playlist either, itтАЩs just a prescription due to the heavy workloads at We11Dev. (0:14) "I usually start work from home to avoid the heavy morning trafficтАЭ - truly revolutionary time management! Why didn't anyone think of this before? Oh wait, that's because unlike all my colleagues, I don't have to come in on time. I just make sure HR keeps a list of people who join late so I can call them out. Except me, my COO and the CTO, obviously. (0:23) "I started 9 years ago at We11Dev as a junior software engineer. Now I am the deputy CEO."...through a combination of luck, attrition, and never saying 'no' to unpaid overtime. My CEO found great marketing value in putting me (a female) in an executive position. After all, I am just doing all the unimportant work my COO isnтАЩt interested in doing. (0:31) "growth was only possible at a place where I feel trusted'тАж to make sure no one asks too many questions about my actual job description. By 'trusted,' I mean I managed to avoid too many direct questions. IтАЩve mastered the art of nodding in meetings while dissociating with the management and I AM the management now. ThatтАЩs how to do it, folks! ЁЯШО (0:48) "Once I reach at the office, the first thing that I do is to greet everyoneтАЭ like a forced morning parade through the open-plan office, waving like a beauty queen at a small-town parade. Honestly, I only make eye contact with my executive assistant and then immediately go hide behind my monitor. (0:56) "Today there is a big meeting with our clientтАЭ- probably just a quick chat. тАШBig meetingтАЩ since any project I am in charge of, the client always leaves at some point. 'Exchange' with marketing? I will probably ask them to bring something shiny for the CEO. 'Alignment' with the CEO? saying тАЬYes, absolutelyтАЭ while nodding vigorously, And remember: if all else fails, schedule another тАШalignmentтАЩ. Because saying "meeting" isn't corporate enoughтАЭ. And 'daily check-ins'? That means I just leave a thumbs up emoji to all the 27 places I was tagged in. (1:17) "Our amazing chef and his team always serves up something delicious' - No lies here тАУ people might leave this company because of what we do, but those who stay, stay because of the kitchen staffs who actually make this place bearable. (1:30) As a deputy COO, I make sure that operations тАШrun smoothlyтАЩ by Slacking someone else to do it. 'Cross-operation team alignment'? That's what Slack and forwarding emails are for, people. ЁЯТЕЁЯП╝ And 'strategic plan support'? That means I tell my executive assistant to annoy other people for no good reason. All day, I basically attend meetings about meetings, and send 17 follow-up emails to make sure nobody actually does anything until the next meeting. (1:43) "Meeting with COO bhaiтАЭ - He's probably asking for an update on something I forgot. Or asking me to create another google sheet to keep track of the rest of the other 73 sheets he created. Btw, This is where we discuss how to make all our BS sound super important. We will gossip for 45 minutes, achieve nothing, and schedule a follow-up. ЁЯШЗ (1:54) "This is my 'favorite corner' тАЬ - where I go to pretend to be deep in thought. Well, quite honestly, I go to these places just to spy on people to check peopleтАЩs productivity. Oh sorry, thatтАЩs my COOтАЩs job. He has his тАШproductivity eyeтАЩ everywhere. But this will be my favorite place soon for sure, I mean the way IтАЩm running this office to its ruin, this is the place where I'll cry silently and check LinkedIn for new jobs. (2:07) "I don't like coffee, but I know that we have a great baristaтАЭ.' - nothing says тАЬemployee engagementтАЭ like pretending to enjoy the perks you never use! Yeah he is great, yet I went after him for peeping on other girls, when I purposefully ignored the office's resident creeper sitting right in front of me. (2:19) "Almost done with 'work' today. Tomorrow, a 'very important strategic discussion.' - Sounds exhausting, doesn't it? Probably just means I have to prepare a few more bullet points for a google doc. But don't get me right, I usually force my colleagues to stay late by setting their EOD meeting after 6. And I make sure my female executive assistant doesn't leave before me. Girl power! ЁЯС╕ЁЯП╜ (2:30) "Rushing a bit because I have a 'dinner plan with my parents and husband' тАЬ - sounds sweet, right? DonтАЩt get me right, my husband doesn't even live in this country. I know what you are thinking. He doesn't like the way I lie either. I mean, look at the lift, itтАЩs only empty at 9 PM lol. ЁЯШЖ (2:36) "making time for family means everything to meтАЭ...Especially when the camera is rolling and I'm trying to look like a well-rounded individual for the тАШcultureтАЩ video. Thanks for tagging along. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go and тАШactuallyтАЩ finish my work, from home. After watching this video, if you're thinking they're doing completely normal workplace activities while filming it with the intensity of a NASA mission briefing, you need to understand what actually goes on inside this place. This is just a show тАУ not even a show-off, a white lie. At We11Dev, these executives have perfected the art of performative corporate serenity, where every meeting is 'strategic,' every lunch is 'family,' and the burnout is deliciously edited out. They are trying to show what they are doing is revolutionary. These people are frauds. They hate coffee but they love posing with latte art. That's what they are. C'mon DCOO, you can do better than this. Stop telling lies just because your boss told you to, just because you are being paid. Wake up. You set the wrong alarm tone. post_title: This company taps the phone of the people who goes to work there.
full_review: I think there need to be an option like "Horrible" / "Worst sh*t" or something like this in the vibe required to express the audacity of this review. I went to work there from a partner company and what I found is going to blow all your mind. It might seem unbelieveable but that's what is happening there and people inside the company knows this... These b*st*rds taps the phone of the people who goes to work there. By tapping the phone I mean they keep listening to everything you talk with people while your mobile is around!!! On my case what they did was they hacked my gmail, whatsapp, social media accounts and they kept circulating it to everyone inside the company. That's how I found out. As far as I understood they somehow injected some kind of spyw*re in my phone and then hacked all my personal accounts, messages and then kept spreading it throughout the company!! Seems unbelieveable right?? But that's not all. After I found that my mobile was hacked I stopped using it outside the office and used a feature phone to contact with others. And guess what they even tapped the phone of the people I have contacts with!!! This included my friends, my roommates, my family members, my previous colleagues and everyone I had contact with and they were constantly doing it for 24/7!! I think you should understand what I mean. This company is tapping the devices of it's users through their app. They are forcefully overriding user's microphone or other permissions and spying on its users.. The way they were tapping the devices of me and the people around me, I am sure they have been doing it for a long time. And obviously they were doing it illegally. Even after this its your choice whether you want to work for them. One more thing I want to add, they mainly hire through companies like 3xabyti9g, bib@soft, eyetogther, ds! etc. This is the secret of their recent hiring trends.. But know one thing for sure, once you join there your privacy is going to be ruined.. I know it's hard to believe but I am certain of everything I have shared here and people inside the company knows this.

Meanwhile, the ones who do the leastтАФfakibaj gulay who spend more time pleasing their bosses than workingтАФget praised, protected, and promoted. But unless the top leadership and HODs change their mindset, they will keep losing good people, especially the ones who could have built something meaningful.

post_title: Best Example of Mismanagement
full_review: It is the best example of mismanagement. Though it is a private company, the management still functions like an old-fashioned government office, slow-paced, mostly inefficient. There are so many useless staff in the HR, Admin and Accounts sections (especially Accounts). I wonder why and how they still survive there! The HR manager doesnтАЩt even care to reply to an employee's message, no matter how important it is. There are some as**oles who have worked there for a long period, and they think itтАЩs their father's property. Especially in the accounts section, there are so many dumbass. I don't know why these organization needs so many accountants. Mostly they do nothing and some of them are just swallowing the company day by day. The salary range is good enough, but you will never get a salary in time. The dining management is the worst I have ever seen in any private company. Food is just trash except the Biriyani and Bhuna Khichuri. Its business policy is also vague. I see only the downfall in the coming days.

post_title: 1 out of 5 тАФ Disappointed & Disheartened
full_review: IтАЩm writing this review with deep frustration and disappointment тАФ not out of emotion, but out of necessity, to warn freshers and job seekers before they make a decision theyтАЩll regret. This company once had a great reputation, but things have taken a steep downhill turn тАФ especially for those of us working in the Bangladesh branch. ЁЯЪи The biggest red flag? Salary is never paid on time. You work hard, meet deadlines, handle pressure тАФ but when payday comes, thereтАЩs always an excuse: тАЬThe client hasnтАЩt paid yet.тАЭ Strangely though, this only seems to affect the Bangladesh team. The Switzerland and Canada branches always receive their salaries on time. This clearly shows itтАЩs not a financial issue тАФ itтАЩs a matter of priority. Employees in Bangladesh are treated as second-class, despite doing the same (or more) work. ЁЯЗ▓ЁЯЗ║ And then comes the Mauritius branch. The company has recently expanded to Mauritius тАФ despite not being able to pay its existing employees in Bangladesh on time. Instead of solving internal salary problems, theyтАЩre focused on international expansion. This isnтАЩt ambition тАФ itтАЩs poor judgment and mismanagement. Meanwhile, work pressure stays consistent тАФ only your salary doesnтАЩt. YouтАЩll be expected to perform like a full-time, top-tier employee, but without the basic respect of getting paid when you should. Management is a mess. No transparency, no communication, no real solutions. Just a cycle of delays, promises, and disappointment. And to all freshers: Please donтАЩt join. The company continues to recruit trainee software engineers, but the reality will hit you after a month тАФ no salary, no appreciation, just stress and regret. A shiny offer letter means nothing if your hard work is ignored and youтАЩre left wondering when (or if) youтАЩll get paid. In the end, we work for one thing: to get paid. Before making any decisions, dig deeper and seek out insider insights to understand whatтАЩs really happening behind the glossy social media facade. Stay informed. Protect your future.

post_title: Hell Disguised As A Company
full_review: Working here was one of the most demoralizing experiences of my career. The Managing Director (MD) has a deeply ingrained habit of publicly humiliating employees тАФ not in private, but loudly enough to ensure everyone, from interns to admin staff, is forced to hear it. Respect is a foreign concept in this company. Even more disturbing is how he treats his own wife, who also works here. Shouting at her in front of the team is not uncommon, and it's impossible to ignore the discomfort it creates. If thatтАЩs how he treats family, you can imagine what heтАЩs like with staff. Dress professionally and youтАЩre met with degrading remarks like, "Too bad your brains donтАЩt match your clothes." This is not banter тАФ itтАЩs persistent, intentional belittling. Workloads are dumped on you without any structure, guidance, or support. Unrealistic deadlines are the norm, and there is zero regard for human limits or mental well-being. YouтАЩre expected to deliver without question, regardless of burnout or clarity. To make matters worse, the MD lacks even the most basic understanding of professional etiquette. Client meetings are a cringe-worthy affair; heтАЩll casually scroll through Facebook mid-conversation, showing utter disregard for the client and the company's image. If you value your dignity, sanity, or career growth, do yourself a favor and stay far, far away.
